Whimsical.name: Whimsical
Whimsical.description: With their cute buggy eyes and fuzzy hides, whimsical dragons have found their way to the hearts of many valers.  Some claim it is a sign of good fortune when they rub up against you.  Either that or it leaves valers with such joy, that they simply stop noticing small mishaps and misfortunes.  Oh, and head scratches are their favorite.

Seraph.name: Seraph
Seraph.description:
Astounding wizards both far and near,
The 400th dragon did appear,
And in a flash of burning light,
Flew 'round the islands just a fortnight

Tebori.name: Tebori
Tebori.description:
THAT NIGHT
The tebori dragon is fond of many things, but it especially likes being on the beach during a hot sunny day. So, when the wizard that discovered it, Donlo, invited it to the party, tebori didn't even hesitate for a second. Tebori was fairly new to the Vale and upon arrival it got many double takes, but only because everyone was mesmerised by the beautiful patterns on its body. Some wizards speculate these are powerful spells written in tebori's native language, others claim it’s a map to a different Vale. No one dared to ask what they were though. As the night progressed, everyone was enjoying themselves, but tebori was keeping its distance, as it was feeling a bit down because of all the looks it got at the start. That was until the chromacorn dragon arrived and went straight to it to say ""Hi"". Both friends ended up catching up for lost time and having fun all evening at the beach. No one was looking in their direction anymore, which is a pity because they looked so perfect standing together.

Oni.name: Oni
Oni.description: Oni dragons may look like they can live in any stark environment, but in actuality they love a comfortable den made of found objects around the Vale. Leaves, scraps of yarn, and even discarded Valefolk clothing are ideal for their makeshift bedding. Gwyddion the Great Nogard claims to have seen on lash out during this odd ritual. The oni dragon was diligently crafting its sleeping quarters when tree branches whirled in from a westward wind and decimated the dragon's hard work. The oni dragon drew its club-tail back and with one fell swoop, shattered them into a thousand pieces. It is rumored that the oni dragon smirked and started over again.

Lyuba.name: Lyuba
Lyuba.description: These dragons were first brought to the Vale by the Wizard Koody, from the faraway frozen wastelands of Seebear, where there are lots of... well, bears and other creatures adapted to the cold climate.  Koody was out and about looking for the best spot to set up camp, for he wanted to observe the aurora borealis.  He was told that at this time of year, this time of day, localized in Seebear, he would be able to see it.  With his camp set and fire lit, he sat back and looked up to the night sky to enjoy the spectacle.  He had heard stories of how beautiful it was but no one ever mentioned it would make sounds similar to that of a dragon breathing and yawning.  Realizing what was actually making the noise, he turned towards the source and saw a little baby lyuba dragon that had gotten lost from its herd, and had cuddled next to his fire.  His heart melted at the sight and made himself a promise, that he would help with finding its herd the next day.  The lyuba dragons were so happy to see Koody returning the calf, that they welcomed him into the herd, which eventually led them to the Vale.

Blue Moon.name: Blue Moon
Blue Moon.description: During the blue moon festival, a number of wizards buzzed about collecting its rare essence to the Moon Habitat in order to attract a blue moon dragon. It wasn't until days later the famous wizard Aiden Strongarm was able to find a way to bring the blue moon dragon back before it disappeared until... who knows when? It may have been one small step for dragons, but it was a giant leap for wizards.

Arcrider.name: Arcrider
Arcrider.description: The arcrider dragons are living proof that looks can be deceiving. Despite their calm and friendly appearance, they can actually be super high-energy mischievous beings. They would never miss a chance to surf down a beautiful rainbow, and are constantly wandering off looking for one, determination obvious in their eyes. Rumor has it, their only goal is to become better arc riders, but it's also noted that they love to party with the party dragons.

Party.name: Party
Party.description: The intrepid explorer Ser Rocco was traversing the Kakapo mountains when something lively caught his eye. It was a group of party dragons excited by the sight of his airship and vying for his attention! Thinking it might be his last chance to see a new dragon discovered, Ser Rocco invited several of these dragons aboard his airship. Since then, party dragons have been renowned for their bouncy, happy attitude.

Ghostly Flower.name: Ghostly Flower
Ghostly Flower.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The bright flower dragon is a favorite among dragon hobbyists. Though they sometimes get carried away, they aren't really dangerous. Just remember that they only bite because they think it's playing. It's important to train them not to bite before they get too big.

Ghostly Spectre.name: Ghostly Spectre
Ghostly Spectre.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Gath'ring his courage (and his beard) Nogard stood to see what neared,
 And looked out his tower window at the distant foggy moor.
 Then a form came from the dark, ghostly pallored, eerily stark,
 A shade which made Nogard remark, "hat dread awaits me, in my park?"
 He grabbed his cloak and staff and said, "There's only one way to be sure."
 And then he walked  upon the moor.
From the dark there came a grumble, a soft and low kind of rumble,
 Nogard almost took a stumble, out in the foggy moor.
 Nogard peered into the black, and what he saw took him aback,
 A hungry spectre dragon pack, to which he sighed and threw a snack.
 Nogard called out to the dragons as he walked back to the door,
 "That's all you get, and nothing more!

Ash.name: Ash
Ash.description: The strange expression all ash dragons have was caused by a loud magical boomstick going off near one of their ancestors. It's said the BOOM! was so loud it echoed through time and affected ash dragons throughout the generations. That seems almost as unlikely as the dead rising from their graves!

Knarr.name: Knarr
Knarr.description: The rare knarr dragon is so named for its resemblance to the ancient ships that once navigated the currents of The Surface's oceans. While those ancient ships were lost in The Cataclysm, the knarr dragon remains, a symbol of perseverence and strength. One of the most beautiful sights on The Surface is a fleet of knarr dragons floating off into the sunset!

Bilby.name: Bilby
Bilby.description: The seasons of Burcadia are very curious indeed - for they are the inverse of our seasons in the Vale! When the summer sun shines down on us, cold reigns in the lands of Burcadia and the curious bilby dragons hibernate with their families beneath the frost. Likewise, just as the air turns chilly for us, the thin layers of ice recede in Burcadia and the bilby dragons emerge - so many that a whole sea of tufted ears can be seen covering the hills!

Sand.name: Sand
Sand.description: An old family of wizards living near the dunes of the Sandara Desert heard rumors of a completely new type of dragon. Wallach, the head of the family, took a group out to search the dunes. Wallach's son Leto, a wizard-in-training, spotted the spindles of the sand dragon's back poking out from a nearby dune. Oddly enough, the spindles are softer than they appear.

Lunis.name: Lunis
Lunis.description: Someone once told the Valers that the lunis dragon is a great companion - it just loves being around others. Its origin is unknown, but it's known to be a creature of the night. It has a side of it that shows only to its own kind, and deep inside hides the spark of life. Maybe if you get close enough to it, you might be able to see all of its beauty, but no one has ever done it, as it is kind enough on the eyes from afar.

Coldforge.name: Coldforge
Coldforge.description: Wimbledrip Blunderpond is best known as the inventor of the water- and frost-resistant Wonder Wand, but his discovery of the coldforge dragon is nothing to sneeze at! The endearingly bumbling inventor was working on his latest idea--a levitating cauldron for mid-broomflight potion brewing--when he was interrupted by an alarming THUMP on the roof of his cottage. Wimbledrip ran to investigate what turned out to be a very disoriented dragon! Apparently, the resisted frost particles from Wimbledrip's wand invention had to coalesce somewhere, which happened to be Wimbledrip's roof. The coldforge dragon was drawn to this particulate pocket of freezy-chilly magic. No harm done to the dragon (or Wimbledrip's roof), but it looks like it's back to the drawing board for Wimbledrip's Wonder Wand.

Poshwing.name: Poshwing
Poshwing.description: The poshwing dragon is accustomed only to the finest lifestyle.  Most often you will find it attending the choicest galas or browsing the fanciest boutique merchants.  Many envy it for its style of living, but little do they know, that the "posh wing" is just a curious overgrowth of a pretty shrub.

Motley.name: Motley
Motley.description: It's the same old situation, the motley dragon is of unknown origin. A crew of six wizards has been studying them, but the results are not making them feel good. Some wizards have a theory, which is a bit on the wild side, that motley dragons are related to a rumored invisible dragon.

Flowerhop.name: Flowerhop
Flowerhop.description: As per tradition every year a bunch of nature loving wizards would go up to the Lavarza lake to celebrate the Summer Solstice. This little gathering often gets out of hand and some even spend weeks there, enjoying the nature, drinking up on that sweet sweet nectar and dancing around until sunrise. Everyone enjoyed going there because of the gorgeous flower-covered meadow and because it was just the perfect opportunity for a light physical activity after the long winter days. This year was no exception to the tradition, and a bunch of wizards headed towards the lake, but when they arrived an unusual picture unravelled before their eyes. The meadow with the flowers was looking very different. The grass was completely crushed, the flower stems broken in half, the bushes dried out without a single berry on them...The wizards couldn't believe their eyes as this was the territory of the flowerhop dragons, and they were usually taking extremely good care of the surrounding nature. It didn't take the wizards too much time to figure out what had happened, as they quickly focused on an oval flowerhop dragon laying under a now receding bush of zazzberries and eating with delight. Flowerhop dragons had a sweet tooth for zazzberries and started consuming them in enormous quantity this past year. Soon enough when they tried to hop onto the flowers, the stems would just break in half under the weight which resulted in a chonky dragon rolling down the meadow. Hopefully these wizards will help them out a bit, because otherwise we will have to go out and discover a treehop dragon...

Embossed.name: Embossed
Embossed.description: With the stars shining bright overhead, the young musician, Rella, decided to take some time on the anniversary of the Vale to ponder and celebrate the last seven years. She found a calm meadow and began to play her harp and became lost in the music. She played for several hours until she heard a harmony join her chorus. The young witch looked for the source of the sweet music and was awed to see an embossed dragon had joined her, using the strings strung on its tail to accompany the music. The song continued into the night -- witch and dragon celebrating not only past years, but bright ones to come.

Duskwing.name: Duskwing
Duskwing.description: Ancient scrolls tell the tail -- er, TALE -- of the duskwing dragon as the bearer of the night sky, flying over the Vale at every sunset with the dusk on its wings. The legend persisted for some time, but after further study, it looks like the duskwing dragon just likes flying at sunset. Hey, if you had wings, you'd probably like flying at sunset too.

Gryphus.name: Gryphus
Gryphus.description: A tale as old as the Vale claims that the gryphus dragons possess an invaluable treasure.  Another suggests that the gryphus dragons have the largest library in the center of their lair, that's said to contain the answer to everything Vale.  To settle the disagreement between the two claims, the bravest of the Valers decided to go and see for themselves.  Days and days of venturing into a deep valley passed, and our adventurers happened upon several gryphus dragons sleeping quite soundly.  In the middle there was an enormous pile of what looked to be letters and parcels.  Little did our Valers know, the gryphus kind were once trusted messengers, with maybe not so great habit of keeping their charge for themselves.  Thus, the legend of a vast hoard of knowledge was born.  Technically, it still is a source of information, just not the kind everyone thought of.

Lightning.name: Lightning
Lightning.description:
The lightning dragon lives amongst magic in the highest storm-ridden mountains of the world. Naturally a solitary creature, the lightning dragon does not fight for territory so much as stare down approachers until they back off and wander away, embarrassed. 
 The lightning dragon lives amongst magic in the highest storm-ridden mountains of the world. Naturally a solitary creature, the lightning dragon does not fight for territory so much as stare down approachers until they back off and wander away, embarrassed.

Frostfire.name: Frostfire
Frostfire.description:
While researching his forthcoming work, The Origins of Dragons, Professor Dravin happened upon the uncharted Palagos Islands and returned with a hatchling that astonished the wizards--the worlds first frostfire dragon. 
 While researching his forthcoming work, The Origins of Dragons, Professor Dravin happened upon the uncharted Palagos Islands and returned with a hatchling that astonished the wizards--the worlds first frostfire dragon.

Blightwing.name: Blightwing
Blightwing.description:
Little is known about the fascinating dragons that developed in the Rift, and the blightwing dragon is no exception. If only we could ask the dragon to tell us about its time in the Rift! ...actually, is there even time in the Rift? That's a timeless debate among Rift scholars. What might the blightwing dragon say if it could weigh in on the subject? Another unknowable to ponder! 
 Little is known about the fascinating dragons that developed in the Rift, and the blightwing dragon is no exception. If only we could ask the dragon to tell us about its time in the Rift! ...actually, is there even time in the Rift? That's a timeless debate among Rift scholars. What might the blightwing dragon say if it could weigh in on the subject? Another unknowable to ponder!

Faux.name: Faux
Faux.description:
A slumbering faux dragon lay still on a tree branch, snoring louder than a roar. CLANG! BANG! CLANG! BANG! The faux dragon was so startled by the sudden clatter that it fell from the tree and landed in a heap. It jumped to its feet and scowled in every directon. BANG! CLANG! The dragon marched off toward the boisterous disturbance. Little did the dour dragon know, the source of the sound was actually a wizard building a new patch into the untamed wilderness.
The faux dragon fanned its wings out to mimic a monstrous face and jumped through bushes to greet its newly found enemy. The construction connoisseur jumped back in fright and accidentally summoned a brown color cube behind him. THUNK!
The intimidating dragon saw the effect it had and quicly dropped its wings down and bowed. The wizard stood up straight, dispelled the brown cube behind him, and returned the bow. The faux dragon left the wizard to continue his work, but the sweaty Valer summoned a sign on the unfinished path that stated, "Under Construction", and shakily walked back home with wobbly knees.

Blue Fire.name: Blue Fire
Blue Fire.description:
We're not exactly sure where the blue fire dragon comes from. We didn't think it was possible. We're also not sure if their fire is cold or hot since no one has been brave enough to test it. 
 We're not exactly sure where the blue fire dragon comes from. We didn't think it was possible. We're also not sure if their fire is cold or hot since no one has been brave enough to test it.

Zilla.name: Zilla
Zilla.description: Frozen in the icebers of Seebear eons ago, these ancient dragons have made a ground-shaking return.  Their icy prisons, weakened by the coming of summer, have thawed and shattered, letting these living fossils loose upon the world.  Zilla dragons hail from a much different and fierce part of history, but even they can't help relaxing in the warm waters of paradise.  Just make sure they are nowhere near any yeti dragons.

Thunderbird.name: Thunderbird
Thunderbird.description: The thunderbird dragon's favorite type of food is one no treat farm produces: lightning! This dragon has been spotted gobbling up stray bolts and blasts, giving rise to questions as numerous as they are reasonable: Wait, what? Is that a Rift thing? Doesn't that hurt? How is that nutritious? Or even delicious? In fact, what does lightning taste like? How much lightning can a dragon eat? What if it ate ALL of the lightning ever? How rumbly would its tummy be? Thunderous implications! Well, at least we can answer the question of where this dragon gets its name.

Krampus.name: Krampus
Krampus.description: If little wizards and witchlings start to get too excited for the winter festivities, parents often use the krampus dragon to keep them in line. "You better behave, or the krampus dragon will gobble up all your iceberries!" is heard fairly often this time of year. Unfortunately, this gives the sweet krampus dragon an undeserved reputation. It would never eat your iceberries! That long sticky tongue is actually used to sip up sweet nectar from blossoms in the far north.

Dash.name: Dash
Dash.description:
The Secreat of Agility
THWIP. THWAP. SWISH. SWASH. A dash dragon, on two strong legs, sped through a thick forest breaking branches and mangling bushes. It emerged close to the edge of an islan and seamlessly jumpe dthrough the air to the next island. It careened toward the Bizarre Bazaar and stopped dead in its tracks.
It sniffed wildly around the perimeter of the market like a blood hound on a trail. It poked its head through the front doors. From inside, a voice screamed, "Ahhhh!" The dash dragon pulled itself out and shook its head as if trying to rid the noise from its ears.
It continued sniffing at the foundation and located a particularly strong scent. It dug frantically into the ground and kept digging until only its tail was sticking out. Snorts and sniffs echoed up from the hole, then silence set in. A young wizard emerged from the Bizarre Bazaar and looked down through the hole... it went right through the iland.
Floating through the sky, the dash dragon was encased in spellform energy with only its head poking free. The cloud carried it into the dark unknown, so the dragon pushed its legs through the energy and began pedaling midair. It managed to change the trajectory of the energy cloud and touched down safely on a desert land known to some historians and lorebrarians as Briar Flats.
The dash dragon took its first step on this strange land and noticed its legs had bright green and sleek black feathers. It instinctually took off at top speed and was at least twice as fast as its former self. It ran until it hit water, turned back, and ran another direction. It ran three more laps until it realized there was no dragon, witch, or wizard in sight.
It looked around and simply sat down with its head hung low...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Plateau.name: Plateau
Plateau.description:
One of the most docile dragons in the Vale is the plateau dragon. These slow-moving behemoths will often plop down for hours on end, flexing nary a scale as they soak up the sunshine. In fact, they're so un-botherable, they've been known to let little Valekins climb around on their heads. The kids call it "Summiting"--first one to the top wins! But don't worry--the magical markers of the hidden habitat will keep the kids at bay in your park. 
 One of the most docile dragons in the Vale is the plateau dragon. These slow-moving behemoths will often plop down for hours on end, flexing nary a scale as they soak up the sunshine. In fact, they're so un-botherable, they've been known to let little Valekins climb around on their heads. The kids call it "Summiting"--first one to the top wins! But don't worry--the magical markers of the hidden habitat will keep the kids at bay in your park.

Chromacorn.name: Chromacorn
Chromacorn.description: Once upon a time, in the far away kingdom of Whitedragon, there lived a fair princess named Eris who was said to have the purest of hearts. One day, Eris was in the woods collecting wildflowers when she came upon a peaceful clearing with a still crystal pond. A chromacorn dragon, previously thought to be a legend, stood gazing at its reflection in the waters; it appeared to be stuck in a trance, mesmerized by its own beauty! Eris spoke patiently to the dragon, being careful not to startle the creature, and eventually freed the chromacorn dragon from its trance. To thank the fair maiden, the dragon flew her back to the Whitedragon castle to astonished onlookers, and there they lived happily ever after as best friends.

Miasma.name: Miasma
Miasma.description: The miasma dragon gets its... unique... scent from the ability to absorb undesirable aromas from around its environment. The rest of the park, as a result, has never smelled better! Despite the noxious fumes surrounding it, visitors still manage to enjoy the dragon, albeit from a comfortable distance.

Redbeard.name: Redbeard
Redbeard.description:
A group of wizzlings set out into the forest to find and capture a redbeard dragon. An elaborate plan was cooked up to lure one and take all its gold to buy as much candy and treats as they could eat. The kids would practice and repeat their plan among themselves until perfection, before trying it on a real dragon. With each new test run, the dummy gold they would use as bait kept vanishing without a trace. Unbeknownst to them, a redbeard dragon was already onto their shemes and was sneakily snatching their would-be bait. With their instinct to find, keep and hoard gold, it isn't too absurd to suggest the redbeard and yarr dragons are related in some way. 
 A group of wizzlings set out into the forest to find and capture a redbeard dragon. An elaborate plan was cooked up to lure one and take all its gold to buy as much candy and treats as they could eat. The kids would practice and repeat their plan among themselves until perfection, before trying it on a real dragon. With each new test run, the dummy gold they would use as bait kept vanishing without a trace. Unbeknownst to them, a redbeard dragon was already onto their shemes and was sneakily snatching their would-be bait. With their instinct to find, keep and hoard gold, it isn't too absurd to suggest the redbeard and yarr dragons are related in some way.

Chomp.name: Chomp
Chomp.description: With their big feet they will stomp, with their big claws they will chop and with their big mouth they will chomp down on the best cuisine in the Vale. These dragons have a surprisingly developed taste for fine food and instinctively know when it is cooked and seasoned to perfection, making them a desired assistant by the wizard-chef Ramsee, with whom they share a soft spot for scuttle dragons. Intimidated at first, wizzlings and hatchlings quickly warm up to the chomp dragons. Friendly and gentle, they let Scouts sneak snacks to their tents for a late night munch.

Meteor.name: Meteor
Meteor.description: Meteor dragons rocket across the skies making them nearly impossible to study. The wizards hatched a plot to hide by a patch of Sarjin Peppers, meteor dragons' favorite treats. After much research and a fair share of failed experiments, the wizards have found a way to attract and keep a meteor dragon in your park. Fun fact: In the wild, the meteor dragon is often followed by a sonic dragon.

Chuck.name: Chuck
Chuck.description: As they get older and the aching in their hearts to get their claws busy and express themselves becomes stronger, these dragons will usually turn towards the fine craft of woodworking. Seemingly built perfectly to cut, hold and shape wood, chuck dragons will regularly make little statuettes of themselves or the wizards that brought them up. Having gone through so many logs and planks, they can identify and age any tree and stump they come across. Any scout wishing to earn the woodcarving badge will find chuck dragons to be more than suitable mentors. And yes, chuck would chuck as much wood as a chuck could chuck if a chuck could chuck wood.

Orchid.name: Orchid
Orchid.description: Often found resting with their tails wound around trees, the orchid dragon is a beautiful sight. The master plant wizard Aidan of Koo Hill cataloged over 200 varieties of these dragons in his exploration of the tropical forests beyond the Scar of the World, and he only meant to bring back paintings. A pair of these lovely dragons followed him home, though, and have been flourishing in parks ever since.

Wrath.name: Wrath
Wrath.description:
Love dragons enjoy company, but they have to travel all the way from Berrywhite Mountain and down to the Vale to satiate that strong need. Unfortunately, some dragons get lost on the journey. This happened to one particular love dragon and its burden of solitude had a dramatic effect. Its hide turned gray and its scales hardened, devolving into the newly discovered wrath dragon. It eventually made it to the Vale and was ecstatic to be amongst magicfolk, but the witches and wizards recoiled as it galloped in with a giant grin. As they do, a group of love dragons came to console their pal and surrounded it with pure compassion. This helped changed the Valers' perception of this uniquely unnerving creature.
*Collect and place 10 unique Tendrils to perform the ritual with a love dragon.

Seed.name: Seed
Seed.description: The seed dragons have proven to be a great boon for the forests of the world below. This dragon is perpetually dusted with tree seeds, which flitter far away with the wind when the dragon takes flight. Wizards have scried that new groves are appearing and even the ancient Great Forest is ringed by new saplings.

Peridot.name: Peridot
Peridot.description: Professor Olivine first discovered the peridot dragon while researching a thorny plant in the High Plains of Faridat. These proud and august creatures can be seen headbutting each other in the wild as a display of their strength and magnificence... or maybe they're just tired of being confused with emerald dragons. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Diamond.name: Diamond
Diamond.description: A helpless romantic, the wizard Adam Anteen always loved diamond dragons. Unfortunately, these beautiful creatures are hard headed and refuse to live anywhere outside the frozen highlands. Under a lot of pressure Anteen discovered a way these incredible dragons can live on the Gemstone Island. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Candlecrown.name: Candlecrown
Candlecrown.description: Candlecrown dragons tend to get their exercise in the crisp coolness of the night. For someone Valefolk, who work ‘round the clock, this dragon can be a startling sight. With this dragon’s green hide remaining hidden in the moonight, the adored phantasmal flames appear to float through the Vale without an owner. The busy witches and wizards, who never stop working, usually take this as a sign they should go home and rest.

Glitz.name: Glitz
Glitz.description:
Glitz dragons will turn any celebration into a spectacle with just a swish of their tail and a flash of sparkle!  Be it a birthday party where the wizzlings forgot the candles, a wedding with no confetti or meeting the coming of the new year.
Be mindful of nearby dragons when using fireworks!  Some may get startled, and funnily enough glitz dragons are no exception.

Midday.name: Midday
Midday.description: The midday dragon is naturally enchanted in a way that continuously forms the effects of the noonday sun directly overhead. As a result, the top of the dragon is perpetually warm and its shadow is always directly below it. This makes the dragon a popular source of shade in the summertime; younger dragons can be seen darting between its legs on especially hot days.

Vortex.name: Vortex
Vortex.description: Do you hear that ululating, high-pitched gurgling noise? We didn't think so. Human ears aren't capable of hearing the unusual cry of the vortex dragon. Its unique maw produces all sorts of interesting sounds--something that gravitational spell acoustics comingling with fluid dynamics. Really pulls visitors in.

Cyclamen.name: Cyclamen
Cyclamen.description:
Gardenia's Color Guard: Lightning
A giant phantom eyeball scanned the Vale in every direction above the treetops and buildings. It rotated all around, constantly surveying until it locked on a location. It then descended slowly toward the ground and melted into the raised wrinkly hand of the wizard Whitbee.
Whitbee opened his eyes and decidedly marched toward the spot his spell had marked. He hobbled through brambles and branches and arrived at a still pond. The grey water was an unlikely place to find Gardenia and when that observation sunk in, Whitbee sighed heavily. He heard gurgling and pounded his chest as if it were indigestion, but he soon looked up to see bubbles surfacing in the middle of the pond.
He pointed his gnarled staff at the water and summoned several lightning strikes around the perimeter. The water was instantly evaporated. Down at the bottom was a single gathering of cyclamen flowers. Whitbee dropped his staff to his side and muttered, "What did I expect?"
As he walked away, a raucous flapping deafened him and a wild blue blur landed in his path. Whitbee froze. As he gathered his wits, he determined it could only be a sullen cyclamen dragon. It stared at the wizard, but didn't blink.
Whitbee transmuted the head of his staff to represent Gardenia, pointed to it, and gestured all around them with a shrug. The cyclamen dragon's eyes watered and it walked away. Whitbee didn't understand and was left alone. he stumbled to keep up with the dragon and found it had stopped at a lake. The cyclamen dragon nodded toward the water. "I guess it's worth a shot," Whitbee mumbled. He blasted the lake with lightning, but there was nothing at the bottom.
The dragon led Whitbee to a river, then a stream, and even a puddle. But there was no point. Nothing was under these bodies of water. Whitbee sat on a log, exhausted. The cyclamen dragon lied down next to him and rested its head on his lap.

Manomano.name: Manomano
Manomano.description: The wizard Marty Sheill was fishing along the Armity Coast when he hooked the largest fish that ever existed. It took 12 hours to reel in the creature (although this number gets larger with each telling), when out of the roiling waters leaped an impossible sight -- a manomano dragon, not a fish, had been hooked! According to Marty the dragon was so huge it blotted out the sun, causing the very stars to be seen in its shadow. It seems the 12 hours was nothing but play for the dragon as it simply snapped the line and leapt back into the waves. Of course, not everyone believes Marty's tale;some say it's just a bunch of hoo ha.

Daydream.name: Daydream
Daydream.description: Do not be surprised to see your visitors gather near the Dream Habitat. It is easy to get lost in thought while gazing upon the Daydream Dragon. It is almost as if you can hear the quiet thrum of a distant ocean shore, the soft melodies of a stringed instrument, drifting off into a bit of a haze wondering...

Florea.name: Florea
Florea.description: Caregivers by nature, the florea dragons look up to gaia and will selflessly do whatever they can to aid the Vale.  They move around quickly and energetically, attending to things that a Legendary Dragon might not have the time to, like cozying up the nests of other dragons and making sure their eggs don't roll out.  And most important of all, making sure those pesky visitors keep their hands to themselves and don't go around touching what they aren't supposed to!  It is with pride and joy that they carry out their duty, doing the best they can to follow in their idol's steps.  Their task isn't as grand as Gaia's, and we cannot expect a small dragon to fill boots that big, but a small dragon can have a very large heart.

Fury.name: Fury
Fury.description:
During the calamitous incidents known as the Secrets of Spellform, there was a being that may have been the cause of it all. Deep in the Surface, a bundle of condensed energy became somewhat autonomous. Its sole purpose was to escape, but the pent-up energy could not break through to the open air above. It was deflected every time it came close to piercing through. After every attempt, the sentient energy mass dissipated and reappeared in another underground region of the Surface.
This unfortunate sould repeated the same cycle over and over, creating geysers of energy leaks across the Surface, until a massive amount of energy pooled around it. The entity pulsed and grew. It aimed upward once again and propelled through the earthy quagmire.
On the flat, desolate ground of the Briar Flats, a lone dash dragon sat sulking. The ground cracked. The dragon tilted its head. The crack grew slowly then spread wildly. The dash dragon perked up and ran in circles, trying to escaped the fierce fissue.
A vanguard dragon flew in and landed with a riptide dragon on its back. An outrider and sparkles dragon sped in and hovered. A quantum and psyche dragon levitated in alongside an armament dragon floating in a translucent force field bubble. They all surrounded the seismic event preparing to seal the largest energy leak on the Surface...
Before they could act, the subterranean energy burst through the ground. It appeared to survey the spellform dragons around it and began to change. The energy took the shape of a dragon with four legs, sharp talons, and dismal fur. It was indeed a dragon spawned from a furious inception. The psyche dragon approached it in the air and signaled with pink flared. The fury dragon snorted, turned away, and flew toward the Vale.

Fuefuego.name: Fuefuego
Fuefuego.description: Fuefuego dragons show incredible talent and prowess in acrobatics from the very moment they hatch.  Jumping and rolling around the place like pinballs.  This was quickly noticed by the wizard Havel Canevel, who took it upon himself to train them to even greater heights, performing head-spinning spins and intricate tricks.  He still hasn't managed to teach them how not to leave trails of soot on the carpet.

Clover.name: Clover
Clover.description: The mischievous and reclusive clover dragon can be found roaming the meadows of Ulster during a certain time of the year. Should you be lucky enough to have a clover dragon it is sure to make other park owners green with envy! These dragons delight at playing tricks on others and have been known to, um, "hide" things. Maybe it's best if your guests check their pockets before they leave.

Zero.name: Zero
Zero.description: The zero dragons were awakened from their seemingly endless slumber, when they were interrupted by the cold essence of the winter's magic.  Having spent so much time asleep, these dragons have kept their primal features over time, making them stand out like an exhibit come to life.  With resistance to cold, size isn't everything and even these giants shiver and freeze over at the slightest breeze, only being able to break free thanks to their immense strength.  And no, they don't think it's rude to use the leftover ice for a slushy.

Hidden Bolt.name: Hidden Bolt
Hidden Bolt.description: Look at that mischievous expression! The hidden bolt dragon is like the cat that swallowed the canary... if the canary were made of lightning, that is. It's easy to see where the mischief-makers of the House of the Hidden Bolt got their inspiration for impishness.

Bogberry.name: Bogberry
Bogberry.description: While traversing the dark Flame Swamp, adventurer Weston became stuck waist-deep in the thick mud. After several hours, a weary Weston saw a dragon of unusual size begin to take shape in the mists. A bogberry dragon eventually materialized, snagged Weston by the robes, and safely pulled him out of the muck. Most magicfolk still don't believe Weston's talk of being saved by a bogberry dragon while bogged down in a bog.

Sun.name: Sun
Sun.description:
Ancient tradition tells us that the first sun dragon existed before the world was formed, flying across the empty night sky until it met the first moon dragon. Together they created a world that they could share. Descendants of these original dragons are so rare they even require special conditions to be bred at all! 
 Ancient tradition tells us that the first sun dragon existed before the world was formed, flying across the empty night sky until it met the first moon dragon. Together they created a world that they could share. Descendants of these original dragons are so rare they even require special conditions to be bred at all!

Quicksand.name: Quicksand
Quicksand.description: The quicksand dragon is so named for its love of speed-burrowing into sandpits. In fact, its biology is specifically suited to the task of burrowing--just look at those chin spikes! There's no better way to speed-shovel sand than with a perfect set of scooping spikes. We should know; we tested the theory extensively.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.description: Gardenia was befuddled when treats started to go missing from her garden. After closer inspection, she discovered a Gargoyle dragon impersonating a statue among her zazzberry bushes! These sneaky dragons can stand still for long stretches of time, bolting to snatch a mouthful of treats while your back is turned and returning to their original positions as you turn to look. Don't blink; they move so fast you might miss it!

Cold Rift.name: Cold Rift
Cold Rift.description:
Sporting a dapper coat of furscales, the cold rift dragon has no problems keeping warm in the freezey-cold pockets of the Rift. Also handy are the eyes of this dragon, which dim the otherwise impassable glare of the Rift's icy chaos caves, and allow the cold rift dragon to take residence inside. Gwyddion the Great Nogard is amazed by this adaptability. "We could learn a thing or two from the development of these clever dragons!" 
 Sporting a dapper coat of furscales, the cold rift dragon has no problems keeping warm in the freezey-cold pockets of the Rift. Also handy are the eyes of this dragon, which dim the otherwise impassable glare of the Rift's icy chaos caves, and allow the cold rift dragon to take residence inside. Gwyddion the Great Nogard is amazed by this adaptability. "We could learn a thing or two from the development of these clever dragons!"

Wind.name: Wind
Wind.description: Swift and graceful, the wind dragon flows from place to place with a gentle rustle of feathery scales. A lucky omen to sailors and millers, these dragons are sure to bring a breath of fresh air to your park.

Aquacorn.name: Aquacorn
Aquacorn.description: Once upon a time, in the far away kingdom of Whitedragon, the beautiful princess Eris was collecting wildflowers again near the pond where she first saw her dearest chromacorn dragon.  Eris sat on a river stone and gazed at her reflection in the water, visualizing all the cherished memories she has had with her best friend.  Suddenly, Eris' reflection in the water started moving and a beautiful aquacorn dragon emerged from the water!  Its colors more beautiful than a magical sunset, gliding gracefully through the water and bathing in the sun rays, the aquacorn felt immediate connection to the princess and rushed to her.

Totem.name: Totem
Totem.description: Rumors abound when it comes to the epic totem dragons. Some people believe the totem dragon was first carved from wood, then brought to life by the world's most powerful ancient wizards. Others believe the totem dragon is no dragon at all, but in fact a spirit in disguise, biding its time until it can reveal its true form. As far as the wizards and witches can tell, the totem dragon is surely awesome-looking, but probably just a regular epic dragon. Probably.

Rayleian.name: Rayleian
Rayleian.description: The colorful spike on top of the rayleian dragon's head spurred something of a fashion trend in the Vale. Every witch and wizard with an iota of style started sporting a vertical coif to mimic this dragon's suave look. Anti-gravity spells really came in handy!

Auroch.name: Auroch
Auroch.description: The few magicfolk who have seen an auroch dragon, know full well to steer clear. These hefty creatures love to spend their unbridled energy running circles in dense fields of grass and wildflowers. With as many horns as it has, no witch or wizard would risk catching a glimpse of this ritual. When a meadow is mowed down to a single pile of vegetation, what's left for an auroch dragon to do? Jump in the mess, of course! This could be the only time these dragons smile, but no one is willing to walk into the bullseye of a mysterious crop circle to find out.

Tree.name: Tree
Tree.description: Few people are comfortable watching a tree flying in the sky, which is perhaps why this hybrid is misunderstood as ancient and unknowable. The older ones have been known to offer a helping hand to those lost in a forest, or a friendly conversation to those wandering alone.

Petunia.name: Petunia
Petunia.description:
Gardenia's Color Guard: Fire
Nogard was tromping through the woods looking all around for any smidgen of color. He was looking up to the grey sky when he heard a gravelly roar that nearly caused him to topple over in fright. He turned to see a pair of gleaming eyes in a bushel of petunias.
He steadily backed away, but the dragon leaped out to greet him. This time Nogard did fall. The petunia dragon snarled, stared, and then sniffed the wizard. The dragon backed up and let the wizard stand. Nogard unfurled a scroll with Gardenia's likeness inked on it and showed it to the creature. The petunia dragon looked and raised an eyebrow at Nogard.
The dragon looked around and pointed toward a cave with its snout. Nogard bowed as a sign of deferment and the petunia dragon led the way. At the mouth of the cave, the dragon waited for the wizard to catch up. It simply stared as Nogard looked into the dark void. The dragon tapped a talon and waited for the wizard to do something. Nogard realized the creature was waiting and drew his wand. "Oh, right. Sight might be useful." Nogard cast a spell and turned his wand into a torch. They ventured into the cave together.
The petunia dragon grunted and ran ahead of Nogard, but was consumed by darkness. It angrily roared which shook the cave, along with Nogard's sense of safely. The wise wizard took it as a sign and quickly conjured sheets of fire to cover the entired labyrinth of cavern walls. The petunia dragon was visible again and smirked.
Hours later, they emerged with heads hung low. Nogard flipped over the parchment with Gardenia on it and summoned a map to show all other cave locations. He marked an X on one and pointed to another. He and the petunia dragon looked at each other and nodded.

Clairvoyant.name: Clairvoyant
Clairvoyant.description: Clairvoyant dragons and their curious spheres have sparked a lot if interest in the Wizards. Despite their greatest efforts to study them, they have been unsuccessful in obtaining one, as the dragons and the spheres are inseparable from the moment they hatch. Could they be the source of clairvoyant dragon's magic? A tool for inter species communication? It may take years until we learn more and until then we can only marvel at the secrets of this dragon. Then again the sphere could just be a chew toy.

Candescent.name: Candescent
Candescent.description:
From the scrolls of Hy Koo:
Twisty shining tail, Eyes alight, fierce and blazing, A 'burnin within.

Willow.name: Willow
Willow.description:
Don't let the sullen look fool you, the willow dragon is probably just pining over the beauty of its environment. Those who spend any amount of time with it invariably feel an increased sense of calm. 
 Don't let the sullen look fool you, the willow dragon is probably just pining over the beauty of its environment. Those who spend any amount of time with it invariably feel an increased sense of calm.

Wyrmwood.name: Wyrmwood
Wyrmwood.description: The discovery of the wyrmwood dragon coincides with the fifth anniversary of the day magic first blossomed in the Vale. Supposedly, this dragon's tangled tail can only be untangled by the magic of a wizard called Vert. E. LaFée, but he hasn't been seen in years. The wyrmwood seems to have fun with it, though---just look at those awesome aerial acrobatics!

Ruin.name: Ruin
Ruin.description: Ruin dragons have developed clear membranes on their wings which make them look torn, hence their moniker. Despite their somber name, they're quite friendly dragons.

Ruckus.name: Ruckus
Ruckus.description:
A baby ruckus dragon woke up in a meadow and stumbled to its feet. As it lost its balance, it smacked up against an invisible barrier. The dragon shook its head and attempted to walk. It banged right into an apparent obstacle yet again...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The rambunctious ruckus dragon bounced around admiring a gathering of spellform dragons. It hopped to each one, surveyed their impressive stature, and flicked its tongue out. It arrived face to face with a quantum dragon and grinned ear to ear. The ruckus dragon pogoed and incessantly bugled its buzzing kazoo of a tongue. This went on far too long as evidenced by the dreary look on the quantum dragon's face. Soon, every dragon in the vicinity was staring at the obnoxious display.
The quantum dragon waved its wing in front of the ruckus dragon and the noise stopped instantly. When it jumped, the precocious dragon bopped its head on an invisible force field. It tried to escape the incomprehensible enclosure but could not. The quantum dragon relaxed and sighed, but the ruckus dragon was clearly not amused anymore and voiced its dissatisfaction even though no dragon could hear it.
PRESENT DAY
The quantum dragon woke up to see its bubble shield still intact. It gritted its teeth and winked. The invisible field dissipated and the ruckus baby was free. It looked around and spotted the guilty spellform dragon. The enraged baby trumpeted a furious buzz from its unfurling forked tongue. It sounded very different than the previous night.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Brass.name: Brass
Brass.description: For a long time it was thought that dragons with multiple heads were nothing more than a myth. Thanks to the discovery of the brass dragon, we now know that they aren't a myth at all! Brass dragons are extremely social, especially with themselves.

Hypnotic.name: Hypnotic
Hypnotic.description: The hypnotic dragon's appearance is jarring at first, but strangely soothing the longer you stare at it. If your visitors stare directly into one's eyes, they may feel very, very sleepy...

Scout.name: Scout
Scout.description:
For many many years Camp Dragonvale has been a place that all young dragons and wizards can go to test themselves and more importantly - form friendships.  Under the watchful eye of the scout dragon, the counselor of the camp, they learn and grow together.  The scout, once a young volunteer, has been a part of the camp for so long, that they are now almost as one.  The fire head keeps the camp fires going for the young adventurers, and the ice head keeps all the beverages cool and refreshing so that its campers never need anything.  Pretty cool, right? 
 For many many years Camp Dragonvale has been a place that all young dragons and wizards can go to test themselves and more importantly - form friendships.  Under the watchful eye of the scout dragon, the counselor of the camp, they learn and grow together.  The scout, once a young volunteer, has been a part of the camp for so long, that they are now almost as one.  The fire head keeps the camp fires going for the young adventurers, and the ice head keeps all the beverages cool and refreshing so that its campers never need anything.  Pretty cool, right?

Acid.name: Acid
Acid.description: The first acid dragon brought into the Vale was carried snugly in the jacket of the explorer Ellen O'Mortson, who found the egg in the derelict buildings of Geegur. This tiny dragon got an undeserved reputation for terror, when it hatched right through his jacket and onto the banquet table at O'Mortson's homecoming feast. That story still gets ripples of laughter.

Solarflare.name: Solarflare
Solarflare.description:
This dragon is gifted to all players who reach park level 100.
 A solarflare dragon?! Astonishing! These dragons only appear when a park proprietor reaches a magnificent milestone! Legend has it, one must showcase a near immeasurable amount of park prowess to obtain a solarflare dragon. According to the ancient and mysterious Book of Documents, were such an amount of prowess to be measurable, that number would be 100. "Ninety-nine," the Book of Documents reads, "one shall not measure excepting that one then proceeds to 100. 101 is right out." Clearly, that's no ordinary dragon.

Palladium.name: Palladium
Palladium.description: One day, one of the wizards leaned too close to the Rift while studying it and almost fell in! Lucky for him, a palladium dragon was nearby to whisk him to safety. These noble dragons seem to sense when a creature is in peril and instinctively rush to their aid.

Tidal.name: Tidal
Tidal.description: The ancient village of Kamgwa in the Shimmering Isles used to keep a shrine dedicated to the Great Wave. This enchanted tide would wash onto the island every summer, mysteriously bringing fresh water from the salty sea. This perennial event kept the villagers' farms watered and made permanent living on the island possible. We now know that this was likely the work of a migrating Tidal Dragon, which has been known to splash entire coastlines whilst playing. If only it knew that its annual playtime was responsible for an entire culture!

Shiver.name: Shiver
Shiver.description: Dancing atop frozen lakes is a sight Valefolk cherish: as far as the eye can see, herds of shiver dragons skate in snowy spirals along the ice. How are they able to achieve this magical movement? The key, according to experts, is in their talons. "The talons seem to produce a special oil that helps them slide on slipper surfaces," researchers wrote in numbers tomes. A recently found editorial scroll belabored the point, "Isn't it amazing? Quite cool, I would say."

Neoteric.name: Neoteric
Neoteric.description: This festive dragon is regarded as one of DragonVale's most jubilant breeds. Every neoteric dragon is born with its very own multifaceted magical mirror ball, which is powered by a spell of unwaning wubwub and ensures that this jovial dragon is always the life of the habitat. Witches and wizards often resolve to be more like the neoteric dragon, but the resolution doesn't always stick. Maybe next year?

Coal.name: Coal
Coal.description: It is said that before the discovery of magic, humans relied on far more crude ways of meeting their needs. They burned a black stone called coal, named for the coal dragons whose skin it so resembles. This time of year, the wizards exchange coal dragon eggs with each other to remember hardships endured by those who lacked the companionship of dragons.

Outrider.name: Outrider
Outrider.description:
The Secret of Flight
Bursting through cloud after cloud, an outrider dragon saw the poorly constructed island in the distance. A soft glow pulsed from it and the dragon sped up. As it flew through more purple fog, the dragon noticed its wings started changing; they thinned out and sharpened at the tips. Its head grew sleek adornments and the dragon tried to look up to see what was happening.
The outrider dragon accidentally barrel rolled while trying to view its new form and quickly realized its augmented flying proficiency. It created a sonic boom as it made an expedited trip to the pulsing island.
As soon as the outrider dragon approached the island, it saw a darcowl dragon waving its tail while alternating forms. The darcowl dragon pointed down with its tail and the outrider dragon looked. It shook its head and shouted. The darcowl dragon motioned again. The outrider dragon dove straight down piercing fog with increasing density until it popped through and saw the Zephyrlands, a region once categorized by ancient wizards from the Surface.
A giant cliff loomed over the land and was split down the center, violently spewing purple fog into the air. The outrider dragon sped to the leak and zoomed in circles near the source. The aimless energy was captured in a cyclone and was prevented from rising up. The outrider dragon stopped to stare at its accomplishment, but the cyclone quickly dissipated, and the energy continued to flow up. The dragon started back up and maintained its perpetual and circular flight pattern...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Dodo.name: Dodo
Dodo.description:
Cave drawings of the dodo dragon were first discovered on Mooretoss Island long ago by the great explorer Lewis Dodoson. They depict an ancient, flightless, and rather clumsy dragon. For centuries it was thought to be extinct, but we now know that while the dodo dragon may be rare, it is certainly not extinct! I wonder what other dragons have yet to be discovered! 
 Cave drawings of the dodo dragon were first discovered on Mooretoss Island long ago by the great explorer Lewis Dodoson. They depict an ancient, flightless, and rather clumsy dragon. For centuries it was thought to be extinct, but we now know that while the dodo dragon may be rare, it is certainly not extinct! I wonder what other dragons have yet to be discovered!

Frond.name: Frond
Frond.description: When spring arrives in the Vale and the snowy hills melt into shallow lagoons, the Frond dragons emerge from their hibernation. These permanently relaxed dragons like to soak in the cool pools and bask in the warm sunlight. They're so laid back that you could even join them for a dip if you wanted! Just don't cause a ruckus, or they might splash you with their mighty tails!

Abraxas.name: Abraxas
Abraxas.description: Abraxas dragons love treats as much as the next dragon, but sometimes they want an extra jolt. When dark clouds roll in, abraxas dragons gather side-by-side in open fields. When they're lucky, lightning strikes one dragon and electricity surges through the rest. Every dragon gets in on the surge of energy. Sometimes this tactic doesn't work, but only if a firefly dragon gets stuck in the grid. It bugs them a bit, but it's not too shocking.

Harmony.name: Harmony
Harmony.description:
The special properties of the harmony dragon really help it live up to its name.  It is said whenever there is conflict near a harmony dragon, it sings a magical melody that spreads peace and calm to all nearby.
This was especially helpful this year when the head House Wizards and Witches were arguing about how to best organize the Jolly Jubilee festivities.  The grand hall of the Dragonarium filled with racket of arguing voices.  Nogard and Whitbee were shouting over each other about decorations while Lumi stood on a table and yelled for attention.  Even the usually serene Kaleni was raising his voice about tables settings.  Fed up with all the fighting, Gardenia went out and brought back her harmony dragon.  Slowly, the tranquil tune from the dragon spread throughout the hall and, one by one, the arguing wizards were quieted.  The rest of the night was much more productive after that and, thanks to the harmony dragon, everyone was able to come up with the perfect plan for the holiday together.

Tempest.name: Tempest
Tempest.description: The majesty of the tempest dragon inspired one of DragonVale's great writers, W. Wiggleswand, to author a turbulent love story between a witch and wizard in which the tempest dragon plays a thunderous role. Of course, Wiggleswand took some artistic liberties; in reality, this fierce-looking dragon has a rather bubbly personality.

Air Rift.name: Air Rift
Air Rift.description:
There's something in the air... oh, it's an air rift dragon! That would make sense, wouldn't it? Unless the inside of the Rift is some sort of bizzaro would in which water dragons fly and air dragons float. But that's preposterous... isn't it? Is it? Question everything! Just don't expect the air rift dragon to answer. 
 There's something in the air... oh, it's an air rift dragon! That would make sense, wouldn't it? Unless the inside of the Rift is some sort of bizzaro would in which water dragons fly and air dragons float. But that's preposterous... isn't it? Is it? Question everything! Just don't expect the air rift dragon to answer.

Riptide.name: Riptide
Riptide.description:
The Secret of Fluidity
A baby riptide dragon swam in a lake, splashing about and chuckling to itself. The ground shook and a loud crack echoed. The baby dragon stopped and watched the water. It rippled and then another load CRACK startled the creature. The ground broke apart at the edge of the lake and water poured over the edge like a waterfall into nothingness.
The baby riptide dragon saw an outrider dragon dive down into the deep dark sky, followed shortly by a quantum dragon. The baby buoyed up and down giggling again and swam to the waterfall. Kai caught sight of the baby dragon about to swim off into the sky and he cast a grasping spell.
The spell couldn't hold it back and the dragon slipped off. As it fell, the falling water around it slowly turned purple. The grasping spell interacted with the now liquid energy and the baby riptide dragon was surrounded by a bright aura.
Giant teeth emerged and the aura shattered. A fully-grown riptide dragon with a strong jaw and ominous scales took form and roared with a deep belly laugh. It could now see the Surface and a gorge filled with water.
SPLISH! The dragon had a seamless entry and popped back up. It looked around Silverfalls Gorge, a wide expanse of fresh snow, dense forests, and crystal-clear waterways. Nearby, bubbles percolated, and smoky energy released with each pop. The riptide dragon dove down, looking for the source.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Chimneypuff.name: Chimneypuff
Chimneypuff.description: There's only one type of dragon that is drawn to the smell of a failed fire spell. When Valers can't complete a combustible conjuration, chimneypuff dragons congregate, Three or four... or even five of them will swoop down your chimney andplop out into the fireplace. Here they'll gather and cough tiny fireballs to help ignite the kindling. Once the blaze is burning bright, they bow their heads, shake off a bit of soot, and flutterto the next cottage. Some folk even reward these hearth-helpers with a spoonful of sugar.

Kroki.name: Kroki
Kroki.description: Kroki dragons sport these glowing vines that are not only aesthetically pleasing, but also function as a way to attract insects.  To keep them lit, however, they must eat a lot of fireflies.  Luckily, they are perfectly built just for that, buzzing around catching everything in sight.  And no, their eyes aren't big because an ancestor was spooked by a loud BOOM or anything like that, it just helps with insects.

Earth.name: Earth
Earth.description:
Despite the harshness of their habitat, the Earth Dragon is the least restless of all known breeds. They are supremely well adapted for their desert homes with thick skin and large bodies to store water. The spikes on their back offer protection from predators, but honestly, what animal in its right mind would think to take on one of these massive beasts? 
 Despite the harshness of their habitat, the Earth Dragon is the least restless of all known breeds. They are supremely well adapted for their desert homes with thick skin and large bodies to store water. The spikes on their back offer protection from predators, but honestly, what animal in its right mind would think to take on one of these massive beasts?

Meadow.name: Meadow
Meadow.description: While the witch Eliyse was researching the home of the clover dragons, a mischievous meadow dragon was playfully lying in wait and sprang upon the unsuspecting passerby. The wizards are currently uncertain if the growth on their backs is a natural part of the dragon, or the result of patiently waiting for people to play with.

Exandrew.name: Exandrew
Exandrew.description:
Class - Exandrew Dragon
Background - Orange
Experience points - yes, please
Strength, dexterity, constitution, intelligence, wisdom, charisma - occasionally
Personality traits - shy, clumsy
Family history - veeeery distant relative to tiamat and bahamut. But like so distant that it doesn't even count
Likes to - disguise self and sneak attack
Loves to - roll for initiative
Best at - comprehending languages
THAT NIGHT
The exandrew dragon was being what it would describe as extremely sneaky. It was hiding behind some bushes that most of the time were way too small, and was spying on Tiamat and Bahamut. They're distantly related, but exandrew was so behind on things and wanted to absorb some of the mythic dragons' manners. It would try to fly majestically in the sky, but would often fall and try to act like nothing happened. It would also go as far as painting the same dice pattern on its wings. The mythic dragons acknowledged its presence at some point and handed it a cup of nectar at the party. To this day, exandrew would go around and tell the story of how it partied hard with Tiamat and Bahamut, which was a tiny bit away from what actually happened.

Undau.name: Undau
Undau.description: Some wizards call these dragons undau collectively, others choose to call one head Un, the other Dau.  Some call them the opposite.  Either way, two heads will always be better than one, and most definitely better than none.  Undau dragon's heads form deep bonds, perhaps closer than those of siblings.  And they may not share the same brain, but they definitely share the same stomach, and this becomes evident as soon as they start eating, or rather... devouring.  No relation to scouts.

Gold Olympus.name: Gold Olympus
Gold Olympus.description: The majestic olympus dragon. Forged in the fires of Mount D...wait...that's the wrong scroll, sorry about that. The ancient breed of Olympus dragons are fierce competitors in the wild, although when teamwork is called for, no dragon is more focused than an Olympus dragon. The Gold variety is the largest and rarest form of this type of dragon.

Curlyleaf.name: Curlyleaf
Curlyleaf.description:
Baby curlyleaf dragons are some of the cutest in the Vale, but they avoid magicfolk regularly. An adult dragon can duck behind it's broad wings if it cares not to engage in social activities, but a baby is just a tuft of green with nowhere to hide. If a verdant ball is seen rolling down a hill, it's safe to assume it's a shy curlyleaf baby escaping an awkward situation. 
 Baby curlyleaf dragons are some of the cutest in the Vale, but they avoid magicfolk regularly. An adult dragon can duck behind it's broad wings if it cares not to engage in social activities, but a baby is just a tuft of green with nowhere to hide. If a verdant ball is seen rolling down a hill, it's safe to assume it's a shy curlyleaf baby escaping an awkward situation.

Azurite.name: Azurite
Azurite.description: When the ancients first happened upon a sleeping azurite dragon in the depths of the Geria Mines, they mistook its brilliant blue hue for a magical aura thought to signify a rift in spacetime. Spurred to action, the ancients quickly cast a freezing spell, hoping to stop the assumed rift from expanding---what a surprise for the azurite dragon! Fortunately, the freezing spell did little more to the dragon than deepen the azure shade of its scales. You might say it was pretty chill about the misunderstanding. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Celerulean.name: Celerulean
Celerulean.description: It's not easy to spot this dragon's astral namesake when gazing up into the cosmic abyss. The blue stars of the Celerulean cluster are so small and so far away, you would need a seriously-magically-tricked-out-telescope to catch a glimpse of their glimmer. Fortunately, having a celerulean dragon in your park is even better!

Nibwhip.name: Nibwhip
Nibwhip.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 1
On a cold blustery night, several Valers gathered to concoct a hot drink to warm the soul. It was chocolaty and scream and required constant stirring to keep the perfect consistency. A nibwhip dragon waddled out from behind a rock, sniffing and gulping the air. The witches and wizards welcomed it and promised a taste if it helped stir the delicate brew. The nibwhip dragon obliged and stirred through the night while the magicfolk went home to rest up for the festivities in the morrow. Little did the dragon know; there was something lurking in a nearby forest. The sounds of branches breaking and leaves scattering circled the cauldron and the tasty drink...

Arbor.name: Arbor
Arbor.description: The Arbor dragon was first discovered deep in the southern Forests of Schloss, using its tusks to root up mushrooms. Due to their magic affinity with plants, any forest or grove they live in is lush and healthy, just be careful of putting them too close to your garden, they love to dig for snacks.

Ember.name: Ember
Ember.description: Light and Fire come together in an amazing display in the ember dragon. The first time they were seen by a wizard, he mistakenly cast a dousing water spell because he thought the ember dragon's wings were actually on fire.

Vanguard.name: Vanguard
Vanguard.description:
The Secret of Invention
While the Vale became more engulfed in suffocating Surface energy, a vanguard dragon monitored the youth trying their best to stave off destruction. The dragon saw an airship detach from the dock and flail wildly in the turbulent wind. The vanguard dragon saw a young witch clinging to the mast and flew straight to her aid.
The dragon rose underneath the airship and clamped it between its massive wings. It escorted the ship back to the dock and locked it in place. The witch profusely thanked the dragon and ran off it to find a portal to safety. The vanguard dragon raised a wing to acknowledge the thanks and saw gold gleaming bright on the tips. The dragon looked back at the path it took and saw a hole punched through a giant energy cloud. The vanguard dragon smirked and took off, diving through as many clouds as possible with its wings spread out.
The dragon could see the gold glow emanating from its entire body. It looked around and realized it had flown so low the Surface was in sight. The vanguard dragon could see Silverfalls Gorge with such clarity that something was visibly splashing around a lake.
The vanguard dragon sped toward the mysterious being in distress and saw a riptide dragon porpoising up a mountain, only to fail and slide back down into the lake. The vanguard dragon saw a small pond nestled high in the mountain that was spewing energy out from the water. The riptide dragon yelped at the hovering vanguard dragon and nodded its head toward the pond.
The vanguard dragon flapped over to the mountain and stood firmly between the lake and the pond. The riptide dragon dipped under water and swam away. The vanguard dragon watched intently as its new partner turned around and torpedoed as fast as it could toward the edge of the lake. It leaped out of the water and sailed through the air straight toward the vanguard dragon. The gilded creatur compressed its wings on its back and when the riptide dragon came flying down on it, the vanguard dragon's wings sprung up, catapulting its swimming companion back into the air. The riptide dragon dove seamlessly into the pond, unleashed a high pitch frequency, and sealed the energy leak under water.
The riptide dragon emerged and laughed. The vanguard dragon saw the energy geyser sputter to a stop and joined in the laughter. Silverfalls Gorge echoed with their uproarious satisfaction.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.
