Reminiscence.name: Reminiscence
Reminiscence.description:
Travelling far into unknown tundra, Lumi looked for an ancient dragon that would know of lost Jolly Jubilee traditions.  Though the snowy wilderness was lonely, memories of hot zazzberry cider, the game bazaar, and the Winter Wizard Ball kept her warm.  Lost in thought, she practiced her waltz across an icy lake, and with each dance step a mysterious glow below her grew brighter and brigher.  With a wind spell she blew the snow away and revealed a glittery dragon frozen beneath the ice!  In its shiny wings she could see her happiest memories.  After breaking it free they became fast friends, flying back to the Jubilee together.
The reminiscence dragon shared everyone's memories they had of the Vale, growing more warm, sweet, and rich with the passage of time.

Enfis.name: Enfis
Enfis.description: Invited or not, enfis dragons often end up as companions to crew-mates and captains aboard ships. Their unassuming appearance, along with their friendly and curious nature would bring any unsuspecting sailor's guard down. By the time the ship's crew notices the slime trails left behind by the dragon, it has already made its home below deck and the sailors have already slipped more times than they can count, broken more barrels than they can repair and spilled more beanstalk juice than their hearts can bear. You might think a "Wet Floor" sign might be pointless on a seaworthy ship, but you would be surprised.

Daffadowndilly.name: Daffadowndilly
Daffadowndilly.description:
Gardenia's Coloar Guard: Earth
After the color had been sucked out of the Vale, Kaleni wandered around in disbelief. He had never seen such a drastic hex take hold. Gardenia was one of the most powerful witches and if this magical force expelled her, how would they ever fix it?
While Kaleni was lost in thought, he saw a flower that was green, yellow, and purple. He walked closer with mouth agape. As he reached down to touch the plant, a part of it popped up from the ground. It wasn't a flower at all, but a dragon's head!
At that moment, Kaleni knew there was hope. If a dragon could hold on to its color, maybe it could help fix the whole Vale. The dragon sniffed and looked around, confused and out of place. Kaleni didn't recognize it. It looked like a daffodil but didn't respond to the name. Kaleni tried several variations until arriving at daffadowndilly. The dragon excitedly ran around him in circles.
After having figured out its proper name, Kaleni showed the dragon a scroll with Gardenia's picture. The daffadowndilly dragon jumped up and down and ran back to where its head was stuck. It tried digging into the ground, but all it found was dirt.
Kaleni contacted other House Witches and Wizards and spread the word that these undiscovered flower dragons may hold the key to Gardenia's disappearance.

Holly.name: Holly
Holly.description: Witches and wizards have long admired the festive appearance of the holly dragon. Given its preference for sleeping curled up in a circle, this docile dragon is often mistaken for a decorative winter wreath. Once, Dragonvale's resident expert in magical shrubs and herbs, Andi Eyevee, mistook a pile of sleeping holly dragons for a wreath delivery. She got quite a surprise when she tried to lift the snoozing dragons into her wheelbarrow!

Tidepool.name: Tidepool
Tidepool.description:
The idea of an ocean is lost on many Valers living in the sky, but there is  group that analyzed this murky myth. Their fascination led to experiments which led to the questions: "Would it be dangerous to attempt a manifestation of such a large body of water?"  They reduced the power of the incantation and safely conjured a small pool of ocean water. The spell needed hours to finish so the group came back after a long meal.
When they returned, they were delighted to see bright vegetation and moving marine life.  As soon as a witch dipped her hand in to confirm the spell, everything moved and a face popped out. It was a dragon! The magicfolk didn't know if they had attracted the unknown creature or created it from thin air. They archived that mystery for later reflection and spread the news of the miraculous tidepool dragon.

Sumi.name: Sumi
Sumi.description: A most peculiar thing happened when the witch Sora Terasu was tasked with studying the sakura dragon. The day seemed ordinary enough--the scent of blossoms on the breeze, a herd of plains dragons making its way across a distant field, the sounds of magical explosions from the Great Nogard's workshop--as she set off on the path to Cherry Heights. What Sora saw along her route stopped her in her tracks: writing in the sky, as if inked of clouds! She stood gaping at the sight of these unfamiliar runes, wondering what magical artist was behind the apparition. Suddenly, a brush-tailed dragon rocketed through the air, leaving a spellbinding trail of inkblots in its wake. "Sumi," Sora mused to herself as she watched, recalling a variety of ink used in the timeless art of wand wash painting. "I shall call you sumi!"

Ambrosia.name: Ambrosia
Ambrosia.description: Ancient scrolls hint toward a connection between the ambrosia dragon and Olympus dragons, suggesting a mythical friendship, but modern scrolls scholars have yet to decipher the legend. But that's not only the unusual thing about the ambrosia dragon--it's also one of the few dragons to have its own scent! Fortunately, unlike the sulfur dragon, the ambrosia dragon smells of honey, flowers, and all things sublimely sweet. Which begs the question: If you were to put a sulfur dragon in an Omnitat with an ambrosia dragon, which scent would be more powerful?

Plant Rift.name: Plant Rift
Plant Rift.description:
Rift-brushed dragons like the plant rift are unique in that their development occurred from contact with low-grade chaotic magic. It's an enchanting idea, isn't it? Though effort to contain the Rift caused a great deal of panic in the Vale, great innovations came out of the chaos. One could apply the same theory to life! 
 Rift-brushed dragons like the plant rift are unique in that their development occurred from contact with low-grade chaotic magic. It's an enchanting idea, isn't it? Though effort to contain the Rift caused a great deal of panic in the Vale, great innovations came out of the chaos. One could apply the same theory to life!

Zumi.name: Zumi
Zumi.description: Lumi was most excited of all to see the winter's magical essence return, and for being such a good sport, the Wizards of the Vale decided to give her a very special present.  A small and cute dragon, much like herself, that she could call her own.  Zumi, they would call it.  With eyes closed and arms stretched out, she was handed the little rascal.  Realizing what it was, she opened her eyes in excitement and instantly gave it a big ol' hug.  The dragon was happy as well to have met its new best friend, likcing her face and wagging its tail.  In this magical moment, filled with joy and happiness, the winter's essence manifested into a giant orb of ice, gently floating above the dragon.  The Wizards could sense great magical energy emanating from it, while the zumi dragon didn't seem to pay it much attention, almost as if it was always there.  It had immense power at its disposal, but it seemed more interested in making small snow sculptures with it instead.

Glare.name: Glare
Glare.description: Between the Frozen Highlands and the Garita Volcano is a bland and icy wasteland. The explorer Addison willed himself to travel on foot and find the fabled Caves of Ramora. Stranded and lost, in an exhausted and phobic haze, he was led to the Caves by a wandering glare dragon.

Sakura.name: Sakura
Sakura.description: Sakura dragons, also sometimes called Cherry Blossom dragons, appear in the springtime when they bask in the beauty of spring's new growth. Villages where Sakura dragons visit will hold celebrations and picnics beneath these docile dragons' flowered wings in honor of the season.

Barite.name: Barite
Barite.description: Not one of DragonVale's great dancers, the barite dragon. As a baby, its feet are almost as large as its head, making this adorably disproportionate dragon prone to tripping over itself. Fortunately, the clumsiness of the barite dragon improves with age; as a flightless dragon, it helps to have a leg up on coordination. Still, if you see a dancing barite dragon, you may want to give some space. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Saccharine.name: Saccharine
breeding: Collect all ten Gumdrops to transform a Gift dragon
Saccharine.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 7
If there's one dragon that will help magicfolk make delectable edibles, it's the saccharine dragon. Some say its breath has amazing powers to sweeten anything on a plate. Other say it only needs to be in the vicinity of food for flavors to be enhanced. But on this magical night, the famous Confection Coven needed all the help they could get. They sent up a gumdrop flare to signal any nearby saccharine dragons and luckily one came to the rescue. When it arrived, it took one look at a table filled with burned cookies, melted candies, and drooping cakes. It exhaled a single blast of magic that exploded in a shower of sprinkles and icing. When the sugar cleared, the table was bursting with perfect desserts that now almost looked too good to eat. The coven gazed at the miracle, but was suddenly startled by a loud thud under the table. It bumped again and they all scattered in fear the saccharine dragon's power was about backfire...

Abyss.name: Abyss
Abyss.description: The depths beyond the Rift can be dark. Luckily, the abyss dragon has developed a way of coping with this obstacle. It carries a magical light on its head, which helps it to see. Unfortunately, this has led to some incidents where explorers, attracted to the warm glow of this light, bump into the dragon!

Icebound.name: Icebound
Icebound.description: Ah, ze hidden depths of ze icebound dragon," writes Henre Zerwog in his famous scroll, Encounters on ze Ice. "Zere are many cold dragons, but none such as zis- a true behemoth of ze ice, like somezing from a long-ago era. Zee how ze coat of icescales on its back protects ze delicate liquidscales beneath- magnificent magic. We are truly fortunate to witness a dragon of such substance.

Char.name: Char
Char.description: From the homework scrolls of the House of Hidden Bolt:

Stygian.name: Stygian
Stygian.description: From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Stygian Dragon:

Terracotta.name: Terracotta
Terracotta.description: On the eighth anniversary of the first visitor in DragonVale, an unusual dragon came to pay homage. The terracotta dragon, which seemed to be molded out of earthen clay, was spotted shuffling in a definitive pattern. The ever balanced and determined dragon kept at it until one wizard claimed it was drawing the symbol for infinity. He went on to say it was a declaration of permanence for the bond between magicfolk and dragonkind. Others said it was a sideways eight. Either way, it marked the anniversary in an unmistakable and memorable fashion.

Pixie.name: Pixie
Pixie.description: You thought the last pink monolith dragon is a crazy monolith color… Check out this one! On first glance, it looks like pixie’s first date was in a spring garden, but surely this wasn’t the case. This dragon was recently discovered by the Burcadians, and they liked its looks so much, that even started believing it has magical powers. Everyone started putting flowers in close proximity to it, thinking it’s working similar to a wishing well - you put a flower and your dream comes true. Well, I don’t know about that, but surely the pink monolith brought the spring to the Vale! Magic or just normal passage of time - it’s up to you to decide.

Cuddlewing.name: Cuddlewing
Cuddlewing.description: Don't you just adore this cuddlewing dragon? Its unique patterning of heart scales makes magicfolk "ooh" and "aww" (but mostly "aww.") Even its horns and wings are heart-shaped! You could say this dragon has a lot of heart... but the Preternatural Parliament for the Prevention of Painful Puns recommends that you don't.

Spellmason.name: Spellmason
Spellmason.description:
It was three nights before the Jolly Jubilee and Whitbee couldn't figure out what gift he would bring.  He locked himself away n the highest tower of his castle, surrounded by snow and dragon gargoyles, to craft a spell for summoning a new dragon.
No matter what perilous potions or magical mutterings he tried, he had no luck.  Through the window he could see the first aurora borealis of the season and decided to take a break.  Soon after he opened the window and snuggled up with a good blanket, a frightening shape flew into the room!  It was one of the gargoyle dragons brought to life by hearing all his magic spells from the nights before!  The dark creature flapped its vibrant wings and revealed a myriad of shapes, sharing all the creative colors hidden from the winter season.
The spellmason dragon is now here, inspiring everyone in times of darkness to keep creating what they love for years to come!

Bloom.name: Bloom
Bloom.description: The bloom dragon is found roaming the Cadberry Meadows near the beginning of Spring. These dragons have been known to hide their ornate eggs in some unusual places to protect them from Spring-time showers. Unfortunately it seems to have had the opposite effect because children have made a game out of finding them!

Tusk.name: Tusk
Tusk.description: If the tusk dragon could speak, one might imagine it to have the voice of a droopy-faced dog with long, floppy ears. Despite looking morose, however, this dragon seems to be perfectly content to waddle through its habitat, patiently awaiting feeding time. If it ever uses its tusks for anything, it's a mystery to magicfolk, the tusk dragon is one gentle giant.

Ghostly Cold.name: Ghostly Cold
Ghostly Cold.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The cold dragon is revered in the northern countries where people will often worship them and offer them food in exchange for protection. Some tribes refer to them as the grandfathers of the north because of the signature fur that grows near the front of their mouths. This is the most intelligent of all the common dragon breeds known.

Nectar.name: Nectar
Nectar.description: Wandering the lower slopes of Mount Oly, the witch Tantalia discovered Nectar dragons drinking in the sunlight on the banks of the River Ambrosia -- literally. These gentle creatures actually consume nothing but sunlight and pure water, and it shows in both their radiance and good nature. There are those who will tell you that the dew they carry on their tails will bring immortality to any who drink it,  but those are usually people selling little bottles of oil behind the roasted corn tent at the fair.

Arid.name: Arid
Arid.description: When you're an itty bitty thing like the arid dragon, it helps to have some extra armor on your side. It seems these dragons employ a magical exoskeleton to avoid being tromped on by their bigger brethren. If ever you're wandering Sandara Desert and see these empty exoskeletons lying about, fear not! Like little Valers outgrowing their school robes, sometimes the arid dragon needs to upgrade its duds.

Minchi.name: Minchi
Minchi.description:
Evolution is a remarkable thing! A never-ending race to perfection and this dragon is one step closer. With the Wizards and other dragons catching on to the stoneshell’s camouflage it was only a matter of time before evolution kicked in! The minchi dragon cleverly disguises itself as a cracked egg, not so much to avoid detection as much as to avoid interest in itself.
A fresh, seemingly abandoned egg is far more interesting to passersby than a broken mystery egg. And the lighter eggshell wings are a boon as well. 
 Evolution is a remarkable thing! A never-ending race to perfection and this dragon is one step closer. With the Wizards and other dragons catching on to the stoneshell’s camouflage it was only a matter of time before evolution kicked in! The minchi dragon cleverly disguises itself as a cracked egg, not so much to avoid detection as much as to avoid interest in itself.
A fresh, seemingly abandoned egg is far more interesting to passersby than a broken mystery egg. And the lighter eggshell wings are a boon as well.

Carnival.name: Carnival
Carnival.description: The first known Carnival dragon emerged from hibernation near the end of a particularly long and bitter winter. Spied from the ivory tower of the great wizard Orlon, its brilliant colors and high energy snapped him out of the gloom he'd been lost in, contemplating the nature of Wizardkind. In that instant, he cast off his Master's robes, throwing his rings and charms and gold to the crowds who gathered to cheer him as he danced after the dragon out of town. When he returned, the people hardly recognized the cheerful, boisterous, and much rounder wizard as the same gloomy Master Wizard they had known. It was said that the old Orlon had gone forever, and the new Orlon was full of life and joy -- using his powerful magic now only for the creation of world class food and drink. New Orlon's is the most popular place to celebrate to this very day!

Scorn.name: Scorn
Scorn.description: The enchantress, Jolene, was researching love dragons in the Berrywhite Mountains when she discovered a scorn dragon amidst the herd. This sweet dragon happily accepted some treats from her, but as soon as the enchantress moved to offer treats to another dragon, the scorn dragon displayed...um... a different side. Apparently this dragon insists on being the center of attention and gets a little jealous it it catches you fawning over another dragon.

Leap Year.name: Leap Year
Leap Year.description: The exceptionally rare leap year dragon can only be seen in the wild once every four years near Bridget's Pass. Getting one of these in your park is sure to make your visitors over the rainbow! Or is it over the moon? I can never remember...

Lokilure.name: Lokilure
Lokilure.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 3
High in the treetops is where lokilure dragons love to perch. They tend to prefer a view of everyone and everything. No one knows the reason why, but one example has helped to clarify this questions. On the eve of the first great celebration, a lokilure dragon spotted a gulletail dragon inches away from gulping down an entire batch of chocolate brew. It had seen magicfolk and even a nibwhip dragon working on it all night, so it decided to trick the thieving creature and preserve the dedication invested in the work. It shook its horns and tail to mimic a dinner bell Valers often used. The gulletail dragon perked up with stomach grumbling, and sped off toward the sound of the bell. The lokilure dragon snickered as it watched from above. As the nibwhip dragon returned from a fruitless search to continue its task, the lokilure dragon puffed out its chest and raised its beak with pure pride.

Plant.name: Plant
Plant.description:
People will love to come see your plant dragons play in their beautiful green habitat. They are the friendliest of all the dragon breeds and make great pets! 
 People will love to come see your plant dragons play in their beautiful green habitat. They are the friendliest of all the dragon breeds and make great pets!

Rigel.name: Rigel
Rigel.description:
Of all the wizards in the Vale, Tolzar was probably the luckiest in recent times. While hanging out in his Optical Oracle, he saw a dragon egg punch through the Rift Gate and fly through the air.
Tolzar thought his goggles trapped a bug so he cleaned them hastily then put them back on, but it was indeed an egg. He stumbled up and kicked his flying vehicle into gear. He flew it around the Cooperative Breeding Cave and saw the egg was hurtling toward a Galaxy Island. He parked in the egg's path and stood at the edge with arms wide open. Unfortunately, the egg cracked and started hatching mid-flight.
Tolzar's eyes widened and he quickly rummaged through a chest of inventions. He heard a loud CRACK and popped up holding a giant net. He saw a baby rigel dragon emerge from the broken shell. Tolzar cackled with glee, but the baby dragon saw the net and zipped over to the Galaxy Island. It eagerly scooped up a mouthful of Dragon Treats as it continued to tumble through the air.
It instantly grew into a juvenile but still couldn't control its newly discovered wings. Tolzar was determined to save this lost, haphazard soul so he raced his vehicle in the dragon's path yet again. Right before the rigel juvenile hit Tolzar's net, the dragon created a portal and disappeared into it. ZAP! There was no sign of it.
Tolzar shrugged and flew away. He was disappointed he couldn't save the dragon from such a random fate. ZAP! A portal opened back up and the shockwave sent Tolzar's Optical Oracle spiraling out of control. Tozar yelped with panic until a fully grown adult rigel dragon flew in front of him and gently stopped his careening contraption.
The now confident rigel dragon winked at the strange wizard who had offered futile help earlier in its life.

Narcis.name: Narcis
Narcis.description: The narcis dragons spend far too much time looking at themselves in the reflections of their tails.  They often walk around entranced by their own mirror image, bumping left and right into dragons and buildings.  Legend says sometimes they stare so intensely at their tails, that their reflections start moving as if with a mind of their own.  Until the sun goes down, and they can no longer be seen.

Razortail.name: Razortail
Razortail.description: The nurses of the Vale are well familiar with this dragons and its razor-like thorns.  As well as the wails of those unfortunate enough to blindly stumble on their thorny tails.  I think you can see where the name came from.  The dragons aren't bothered by people stepping on their tails, though; they like to poke fun at those who do.  Anyone else have a feeling of déjà vu all of a sudden?

Punk.name: Punk
Punk.description: Punk dragons are often mistaken for a metal dragon, and whenever that happens, they let out a screeching roar in frustration.  Some Wizards don't see the difference really, and some just don't care.  Having crawled out of the Pit of Despair, the punk dragons came to do one thing and one thing only... to make a Pit of Mosh... a mosh pit.  They wanted a friendly mosh pit, okay?

Feast.name: Feast
Feast.description: When visiting the feast dragon in its habitat, it's wise to bring a snack, or even an entire picnic. The aura that wafts from this dragon strikes people with a nearly insatiable hunger. Smart park-planners place a DragINN nearby to help any voracious visitors. It might also be wise to stock up on some stretchy wizard robes.

Scarab.name: Scarab
Scarab.description: This gold-scaled dragon has a special affinity for trinkets and baubles that it finds in its natural surroundings. Scarab dragons have been known to carry their trinkets with them for long distances just to feel at home. Unsurpisingly, this dragon is happiest when kept in a shiny, treasure-laden habitat.

Bog.name: Bog
Bog.description: The bog dragon, discovered on a log in the fog, is something of a sea dog, spending most of its time floating amongst frogs. The wizard to discover this characteristic was so agog, he gave a monologue over some eggnog grog, hoping to start a dialogue and turn some cogs. Unfortunately, his speech was a slog.

Ghast.name: Ghast
Ghast.description:
The great Vale poet Hy Koo was so taken with the ghast dragon, he couldn't help but pen a stanza:
Skull-horn'ed drago
A phantasm in the Rift
Drifts upon the gales

Firefly.name: Firefly
Firefly.description:
The magical glow from their tails can be seen in the skies for miles around. They look like stars at night. Their insect-like shape tends to scare people away, but I think they're kind of cute! 
 The magical glow from their tails can be seen in the skies for miles around. They look like stars at night. Their insect-like shape tends to scare people away, but I think they're kind of cute! 
 The magical glow from their tails can be seen in the skies for miles around. They look like stars at night. Their insect-like shape tends to scare people away, but I think they're kind of cute!

Electrum.name: Electrum
Electrum.description: While experimenting with lightning magic, three wizard brothers from the Stater family attracted the attention of an electrum dragon. Shocked at the discovery of a new Treasure dragon, they quickly dispatched in all directions to inform everyone of this new, epic breed.

Solstice.name: Solstice
Solstice.description: Twice each year, near the longest and shortest days of the year, the Solstice Dragons come out of hiding. Their arrival - along with lighting of the Sun Stones of Surya - signals the beginning of grand festivals throughout much of the land. Because it has two heads, one favoring summer, the other winter, the Solstice Dragon is nearly always of two minds on any issue. Despite this conflict, most dragon experts take solace in the idea that two heads are better than one..

Yeti.name: Yeti
Yeti.description: A group of exploring Wizards had stumbled upon a cave that was said to be inhabited by a yeti dragon, and ventured deep into the cave system. One of the novices had to reignite their torch soon after, and by accident conjured a fireball instead of a spark, sending it flying far into the cave. The group waited for the fireball to land before proceeding, but instead of the fireball landing, what they heard was the sound of the eldest Wizard slapping the novice by the neck. Further down they started to smell something strange, something like burnt hair. By the time the realization hit them, one of the Wizards had bumped into something steady and fuzzy in the darkness. Looking up they saw a yawning yeti dragon, towering above them with charred brows and hair. The lonely dragon, thrilled to see it had visitors, smiled from horn to horn, exposing a big toothy grin. Thinking it was about to turn them into tonight's meal, the Wizards quickly dropped everything and ran to the exit, arms flailing in the air. Still sleepy, the yeti dragon went after its new friends to hug and play with them. These dragons had adapted perfectly to their environment, thick fur to keep them warm, strength to push over boulders and snow out of their way, and they had no need for wings in these tight spaces so it was quickly catching up to them. The eldest Wizard hastily conjured a teleportation spell to get them out of there, sending them all directly back to the Vale. They only had a second to celebrate and cheer when they realized, the teleportation spell that supposedly saved them also took the yeti with them to the Vale, which gave them all a group hug with a smug smile on its face.

Liberty.name: Liberty
Liberty.description: A magnificent, but elusive beauty, the liberty dragon is a rare treasure. The liberty dragon remains a beacon to those who choose to pursue it. If you're fortunate enough to have one, display it proudly!

Fushi.name: Fushi
Fushi.description: Spring brings not only a pleasant change in the weather, but also a change in the whole scenery.  Everything is greener, with soothing sounds and smells filling the air.  On such a morning exactly, Gerhadr woke up in a great mood and had the perfect idea - to create a magnificent and colorful dragon companion.  After trying the whole day to blend different types of herbs, plants and other unknown substances, and with each attempt being somehow less successful than the last, he threw everything in an old planter in frustration, promising himself to clean it up in the morning.  However, the next morning he was awoken not by the pleasant sounds of chirping, but by a loud thud, so he quickly jumped out of bed to investigate.  He hurried to the room where he experimented the previous day and noticed the planter he was planning on throwing away was gone.  He wondered for a moment if he misplaced it without remembering, but upon closer inspection found it shattered on the ground.  And the reason for it - a fushi dragon.  A dragon created from a bunch of random ingredients put in a bit of dirt overnight.  You might think it's a recipe for disaster, but that fushi dragon rolling in the dirt with such joy surely can't be trouble.  R-right?

Violetta.name: Violetta
Violetta.description:
A wonderful wand-making witch was transporting her wares when her weighted wagon toppled over. Hundreds of freshly crafted spell-makers spilled everywhere. Unfortunately, one wand splintered and cast a cracking spell. it split another wand and that one cracked another, and so on and so forth until random spells were firing off in every direction.
A calm violetta draogn saw the fireworks in the distance and flew straight for the calamity. It saw the witch taking cover behind her wagon and quicly started picking up malfunctioning wands with its mounth. It dropped them in a nearby pond and dodged more aimless magic to continue the clean-up. Busby, rhinotorch, dittoglide, gildamane, and even faux dragons started helping after catching sight of the uproarious scene and the righteous violetta dragon.
In no time at all, every busted wand was floating in the pond. The witch peeked out over the wagon and cast a freezing spell. The water froze into a single block of ice, encasing the lot of damaged wands. The witch thanked the dragon helpers and they happily roared back in acknowledgement.

Celtic.name: Celtic
Celtic.description: Nestled somewhere between the Shimmering Isles and the edge of the Skyie Meadows lives an ultra rare breed, the celtic dragon. O'Hara the Stout, a brewer of magical potions, and Wizard Brezhoneg were inspired by a celtic dragon's golden knotted horns and worked some magic to allow these dragons to come and live at the end of the rainbow habitat. Unfortunately, that magic will unravel soon and the celtic dragon will be gone.

Bizurian.name: Bizurian
Bizurian.description: The Bizurian constellation is often regarded as the symbol of new beginnings and fresh starts. Its twin heads represent the branching paths at the outset of a journey and guide young travelers who have lost their way in the night. It seemed fitting, then, that the bizurian eggs found after the Star Fall should be given to the newest dragon breeders in the Vale.

Apocalypse.name: Apocalypse
Apocalypse.description: When the mythic volcano Garita erupted, wizards feared the end of the world. Luckily the only thing that emerged from those ash clouds were these incredible dragons. Be careful with teething young Apocalypse dragons as they love to gnaw on wizard footwear. You wouldn't want one to swallow your sole.

Nesting.name: Nesting
Nesting.description: Now here's an unusual dragon! Or shall we say, set of dragons! Currently being studied by Matryona Starling, the nesting dragon seems to be equipped with a pouch in which it carries its little dragonling friends. Which begs the question: do those dragonlings, too, have their own pouches containing yet smaller dragons within? And yet smaller dragons *also* have pouches with yet even *smaller* dragons inside? Is it just nesting dragons all the way down? Are we ALL inside the pouch of a giant nesting dragon at this very moment?

Regift.name: Regift
Regift.description: Contrary to its festive resemblance to the gift dragon, the regift dragon is actually an entirely separate breed hailing from the northwest. Gift dragons, as every witch and wizards knows, hail from the northeast. Completely different, you see. No relation whatsoever. Just a happy coincidence.

Ketu.name: Ketu
Ketu.description: Out in the cold tundral wilderness, the Wizard Atten Burrow was looking for the elusive ketu dragons. He had tried everything to lure them out, from mimicking their calls with magical items, to trying to bait them out with illusions, and everything in between. He had seen only mere glimpses of them, they were either too fast for him or he would somehow alert and scare them away. One night at his camp, Atten thought he would try out these "iceberries" everyone was talking about, only to grimace like a child eating a sarjin pepper before throwing them into the distance. He went to bed frustrated and hungry that night, but he awoke to a pleasant surprise. Several ketu dragons had found the iceberries he threw away and were looking around for more. Lucky for him, he had plenty of those to go around, and soon, the ketu dragons were around him like starwing dragons to a lamp.

Gawk.name: Gawk
Gawk.description: A friend to any wizard, captain or wizard-captain, the gawk dragons make for life-long companions. They are well-known for their speed, loyalty, intelligence and tendency to screeeam for no reason in the middle of the night. Not to mention how seamlessly they join in whenever sea shanties are sung. Just be mindful of their presence when having a private conversation, they will hear the most inappropriate part and will repeat it at the most awkward moment.

Eldritch.name: Eldritch
Eldritch.description:
The Hunt Begins
As old wizard Whitbee put the finishing touches on the Airship of Ghouls late at night, a dark mass materialized in a blue portal behind him. This was the same blue portal he had made every year as part of his themed décor, but it was never functional.
The mass propelled from the portal, creating a rush of wind that blew Whitbee's hat off. He bent down to pick it up and saw the mysterious entity rush into a forest before losing sight of it. He nervously twisted his hat.
Whitbee decided to research this phenomenon in the Dragonarium and while browsing bookshelves from floor to ceiling, he stopped dead in his tracks as one tome pulsed. He retrieved it with a levitation spell and quickly thumbed through the pages. He arrived at a depiction of a shadowy figure debbed the Eldritch Dragon. Upon reading more, he found that after escaping its home realm, only the Shrouded Cavalry could usher it back to its proper plane of existence. A dragon's shadow spread across the wall behind Whitbee, unbeknownst to him as he pondered the implications of the text.
Just outside the Dragonarium, Gardenia, Nogard, Kaleni, and Lumi were searching for a lost baby lycan dragon. Everyone had their wands set with torch light. As soon as they discovered the wandering baby, it began to howl. "Well, that's one heck of a howl, little one," Nogard declared.
Lumi looked up at the full moon and said, "It must be a natural reaction."
Gardenia chimed in, "It's so cute! It sounds like it's saying 'looooo.'"
"Like, let's name it Moony-Loo, then," Kaleni announced. Before anyone could agree, the eldritch dragon flew past them with a gusty force. "Yikes!" yelped Kaleni.
The gang hid behind a tree, including Moony-Loo. They saw Whitbee follow in the creepy dragon's wake with a book tucked under his arm. Nogard deduced, "I've got a feeling, Whitbee might be planning something a bit too scary for some of the Valefolk this year."
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Shroud
