Ghostly Spirit.name: Ghostly Spirit
Ghostly Spirit.description: Some might say spirit dragons are the pinnacle of paranormal perception. Other Valefolk don't realize the truth is still out there. Ghostly spirit dragons do exist, but you must want to see them to experience ethereal enlightment.

Yanghis.name: Yanghis
Yanghis.description: If Pi Roh couldn't pull off a firework show so beautiful that it would blow everyone's minds, he would instead bring a dragon that could.  Introducing... the yanghis dragons.  Less showy-offy and more hissy-clawy than their relatives - the ignis dragons.  They are constantly together as if inseparable and in constant synergy, one would think they are two halves of the same entity.

Kite.name: Kite
Kite.description: Kite dragons get their name from both how they look as well as how they move. When the winds from the High Plains of Faridat are at their peak, the children of the area construct kites to look like dragons. One spring morning, much to the surprise of a then-young Wizard named Franklin Mozi, as their kites reached the highest heights, two soaring dragons joined the fun and began mimicking the flight pattern of the kites.

Ghostly Obsidian.name: Ghostly Obsidian
Ghostly Obsidian.description: This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond. Found in the volcanic regions of Wrothmoore, the obsidian dragon's iridescent horns are sure to make it one of your visitors' favorite new dragons!

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.description: The forge dragon's molten glow is not just for the show; an intense heat radiates from them. Forge dragons have been known to become so hot that they melt their footprints into solid metal, which makes tracking them extremely easy. Unfortunately, their tracks usually lead to the heart of large volcanoes which makes following them... less than desirable.

Shadow.name: Shadow
Shadow.description: The shadow dragon is very misunderstood. Contrary to popular belief, it is not named for its shadowy countenance, but rather for its habit of following others around. Though this may seem unsettling to some, the wizards have discovered that the dragon is just remarkably curious.

Tumblethorn.name: Tumblethorn
Tumblethorn.description: Eons ago, tumblethorn dragons utilized their unique adaptations to glide between the harsh Sandara desert and the Mud Flats. When the Cataclysm opened the Scar of the World, it was one of the first dragons that disappeared in that event. Thank fully, it seems that at least a few tumbled into the Rift!

Dawn.name: Dawn
Dawn.description: Majestic as the rising sun, the dawn dragon is a sight to behold. Normally, Epic Dragons avoid the breeding cave, but tales exist of two such dragons following some of the rare Fireflies into the cave and the next morning, with the rising of the sun came the dawn dragon.

Jadice.name: Jadice
Jadice.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 10
It was almost midnight and the Vale was quite quiet. A jadice dragon perched high on a mountaintop, looked at the moon, then down to the blank venue that should have been fully decorated by this time. It could see by the faintest of sight, a trepak dragon had gathered a somewhat peculiar group of dragons in the center of town. The jadice dragon swooped in, right in the middle of an apparent stare-down. The jadice dragon approached the trepak dragon and intercepted the glare. Avarice, gulletail, lokilure, and burglehoo dragons all stepped back with reverence when the jadice dragon separated the group. Just then, the jolliest of wizards interrupted. It was Sandakloz and he wanted to set things straight. Witches and wizards gathered to hear him speak.
He explained how no dragon is wholly bad and no dragon is purely good, much like the witches and wizards they lived with. Sandakloz gave each dragon a medal with the letter "N" emblazoned upon it and said, "Remember, each day we have the option to be naughty or nice. But no one except ourselves, can be the bearer of that change."
From that moment on, dragons of all kinds and magicfolk from around the Vale worked together to revive the Vale. As dawn snuck up, a winter wonderland was revealed! That night forged a tradition that still thrives to this very day. The festival may have a different name from time to time, but the spirit remains the same.

Soriak.name: Soriak
Soriak.description: On his travels through time and space, Kairos stumbled upon a familiar looking whelpling, the runt of its spawn. Sharing many similarities with Kairos, it reminded him of his youth and he quickly grew to adore the little bugger. Not wanting to leave the whelpling to the whims of fate, Kairos saved it from its timeline and brought it to the Vale, handing it over to the Wizards to be looked after. They were disappointed to see that it did not share any of Kairos' time warping abilities, but he still loves the soriak dragon, his little brother from another broodmother.

Cerberus.name: Cerberus
Cerberus.description:
Triple the heads, triple the cute, triple the love of Dragon Fruit!
Some say its eyes are little bit freaky, but the cerberus dragon isn't mean---just cheeky!
Its breath is worse than its bite, it's said, but yours would be, too, with that many heads!

Festive.name: Festive
Festive.description: Valefolk youth can't quite wrap their heads around the festive dragon. "How does its tail work?!" they exclaim when they see the bouncy, bell-tailed baby. "Magic," Nogard always replies with a wink, despite others' insistence that such an answer is no answer at all. Sure, he's right, but what KIND of magic? And how does that magic work? It seems like only young ones are concerned; the rest of the Valers are completely delighted by this aptly named dragon. Ribboned and baubled and bearded, to boot—it doesn't get much more festive than that! ...or does it? Just wait until you see this dragon's happy dance!

Blazing Gale.name: Blazing Gale
Blazing Gale.description: Pi Roh, firework magic expert, took inspiration from the colorful plumage of the blazing gale dragon for his latest sky display. The blazing gale dragon, true to the House motto it inspired, seemed completely unfazed by this homage--it flew through Pi Roh's technics, cool as a Kraken Kabbage, paying no attention to its noisy firework lookalikes.

Opulent.name: Opulent
Opulent.description: It's said that opulent dragons were once the guardians of the mythical treasure city of Seebolah. Because of this, they were long thought to be a portent of prosperity and good fortune. Though Seebolah has long since been buried by time, opulent dragons still possess quite the preference for guarding piles of treasure.

Pearlescent.name: Pearlescent
Pearlescent.description:
No one had ever seen a pearlescent dragon, up until the day chrysalis dragons were sidled with the challenge of saving spring.
While nine newly discovered chrysalis dragons were battling the heat hex of the Burcadian Breeding Cave, a glittery and colorful bubble descended from the clouds. Across the Vale, every dragon, witch, and wizard stopped to watch this technicolor anomaly.
As the apparent bubble pierced through a low hanging cloud, it split into the magnificent wings of a pearlescent dragon. Some say, they heard a collective gasp escape from every living creature. The pearlescent dragon stretched out like a rainbow sail and craned its head downward. It unleashed a single blast of glitter and colors that inundated the cave with unmatched force. A glowing orange sphere was illuminated around the cave.
On an adjacent island, Kaleni could see the orange sphere materialize while peeking between blocking trilobite dragons. His jaw dropped, "I don't believe it", he blurted out.
"Believe what?", the young witch, Ellie, replied.
Kaleni simply said, "It WAS my fault."
The pearlescent dragon fired off another sparkling blast. It made contact with the glowing orange sphere and amplified it to a searing red. It pulsed hotter and brighter until it shattered into a thousand pieces.
The trilobite dragons dropped their guard, the pearlescent dragon landed, and all the chrysalis dragons stood on the ground together. They looked at each other with grins and sighed. They instantly tensed up again when they heard a rustling from inside the cave. The pearlescent dragon opened its mouth again ready to unleash beauteous fury. Before more magic breath was loosed, Kaleni came running out. The dragons relaxed.
"My friends, I'm so sorry this happened. Next spring will be different. I promise. If you ever get hungry, just stop by my treat farm. No questions asked."

Cactus.name: Cactus
Cactus.description: Despite its rather prickly appearance the cactus dragon is one of the gentlest of all the dragons. It loves to pounce and play with people. Kind of like a great big cat. With sharp spikes instead of fur. Maybe it's best if your guests keep a safe distance from it.

Current.name: Current
Current.description:
Though current dragons are mostly known for making people's hair stand on end, it has been said that when no one's looking these rare dragons put on flashy, electrical displays for each other. Maybe if your guests hide they'll be able to see the show! 
 Though current dragons are mostly known for making people's hair stand on end, it has been said that when no one's looking these rare dragons put on flashy, electrical displays for each other. Maybe if your guests hide they'll be able to see the show!

Shining.name: Shining
Shining.description: While traveling through the mountainous region of Setse, the wizard Torrance Jaxxon stumbled upon a set of twin omen dragons cavorting through the woods. "Come and play with us!" they seemed to say with their adorable antics. Intrigued, Torrance followed them through the labyrinthian corridors of trees until he found himself in a clearing. There, illuminated by the glow of the moon, stood the most unusual dragon Torrance had ever seen! Like an ethereal conjuring from the pages of a storyscroll, the dragon stood in an almost kingly posture, emitting a brilliant shine. Alas, when Torrance reached into his pockets for a Dragon Treat, he found only a flask of orange juice. The shining dragon must have had other interests, for it quickly fled into the frozen night.

Fungus.name: Fungus
Fungus.description: The fungus dragons have an interesting trait. They have gills that allow their mouth to expand to fit an impressive number of treats! Reading the notes of the Witch Hyphae, "They're also very friendly and have been known to like people." Wait.. does that say 'lick people'?

Iron Blossom.name: Iron Blossom
Iron Blossom.description: In the spirit of its Vale-renowned cleverness, the iron blossom dragon is the answer to a popular riddle told to young Valekins:

Lunar Eclipse.name: Lunar Eclipse
Lunar Eclipse.description: The rare lunar eclipse dragon only ventures from its habitat on the dark side of the moon during lunar eclipses, when it is shielded from the sun's rays. Living in the frigid, sunless, blackness, this dragon is graced with a thick layer of blubber to keep it warm. Although, some wizards have suggested they're just big boned.

Hail.name: Hail
Hail.description: Wizards have been noticing, and repairing, dents to their decorations for some time. The cause... hail dragons. The damage was unintentional. Hail dragons simply wag their tails enthusiastically when they see cool decorations. Now that they live in cold and lightning habitats, rest assured your decorations are safe.

Ocular.name: Ocular
Ocular.description: The ocular dragons are born with a singular eye that sees not only color, but allows it to see through the most convincing of illusions, past the most concealing of spells and through the most broken of timelines.  The spectrum of colors ocular dragons can see is incomprehensible, but if you can imagine a color you have never seen before, that would be it.  And that... is what the ocular dragon sees.  But, as you can imagine, having one eye hinders their depth-perception, and that is where the spiky protrusions on their bodies come into play.  If they slam into something, it might be painful, but nowhere near as much as it would be for whatever they ran into.

Lunk.name: Lunk
Lunk.description: Having to rely on their hands and tails to move around, by the time these dragons grow up, they have built up immense strength. So much so, that some wizards have even documented them in a study called "Lunk dragons: Pumping Metal". If you ever need a hand or two moving a house, these dragons are the ones to call. Just don't bring a unicycle, drives them mad.

Scryer.name: Scryer
Scryer.description: Mysterious and nomadic dragons, scryers are always heeding the call of  their eerily glowing orb, leading them to places unknown.  This time, they were led to the vale and immediately caught the curiosity and attention of the Valers.  Especially Jerrsy, that little devil.  Imagine this, Wizards fighting a dragon for a mysterious purple orb.  You would think they learnt their lesson after the clairvoyant dragons.

Faire.name: Faire
Faire.description: Step right up, step right up! Feast your eyes on the fabulous faire dragon! Fleet in flight, though never fleeting, it's faithful to friends for whom it fervently fends, without ever fearing or fleeting. But first and foremost, folks will find, festivals and feasts are its favorite pastime.

Ahoy.name: Ahoy
Ahoy.description: Ahoy! - a signal word, often used to call to a ship or a boat, which are a regular sight in the Vale, especially the flying kind.  But did you know the origin story of that owrd?  Well, it all began with a brave Wizard-explorer by the name of Esesh.  He loved to travel and visited a lot of known and unknown places, but as the years passed, his vision started to let him down a bit.  On one of his trips to yet another exotic island, a long-tailed dragon grabbed his attention.  He didn't know what to call it at first, but took it along on his voyages and trained it how to drive the tip of its tail on the ground, launched itself and balance on top of it in order to keep an eye for other ships and land.  Esesh even tried giving it his spyglass to help it spot things easier, but the dragon, not knowing what to do with it simply threw it overboard.  With time, more and more wizards started taking such a dragon on their trips, because it really seemed to enjoy balancing on its sturdy tail and being on the lookout for potentially approaching difficulties.  Nowadays, almost all ships and boats have it onboard.  And hence when brave wizards would shout "Ahoy!" to call on a ship or a boat, the dragon would respond to that instead, as if they're calling its name.  Next time you're thinking of using this exact signal word, remember that you're calling to a dragon, not a vessel.

Ghostly Mountain.name: Ghostly Mountain
Ghostly Mountain.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The mountain dragon is a solitary beast, found wandering the frozen highlands to the north. Its long horns and shielded back protect it from, well, everything. Since nothing threatens it, it is one of the calmest dragons around.

Sorarian.name: Sorarian
Sorarian.description: An old tale from the Shimmering Isles describes a starry dragon that ferries travelers from one side of the sky to the other. It was long assumed that these stories were inspired by the Sorarian star, which traces a curvy path across the night, heedless of the other stars’ motions. With the coming of the Sorarian dragon, however, many have begun to wonder whether the subject of those stories was the star, or the dragon.

Wilderness.name: Wilderness
Wilderness.description:
No need for a tent with this one, the sky above, the horizon around and the ground below is all shelter this dragon needs to survive in the wild.  A friend to all things wild, they require so few nutrients to survive, that some wizards believe these dragons feed on the energies of the wilderness itself.  Nowhere in the world is too far away from home, as the entire world and every dragon lover's heart is their home. 
 No need for a tent with this one, the sky above, the horizon around and the ground below is all shelter this dragon needs to survive in the wild.  A friend to all things wild, they require so few nutrients to survive, that some wizards believe these dragons feed on the energies of the wilderness itself.  Nowhere in the world is too far away from home, as the entire world and every dragon lover's heart is their home.

Magnolia.name: Magnolia
Magnolia.description: It is widely known that magnolia dragons come from a very big and ancient, and especially difficult to pronounce family.  There are scrolls reporting sightings even before the discovery of busby and flowerhop dragons. We guess they must have hid very well until now, because it's really hard to miss their huge, fluffy, pink tails.

Umbra.name: Umbra
Umbra.description:
Little campers and wizzlings tell the creepiest stories around the fire, and this one is no different.  Rumor has it that you can summon a dragon if you sit alone in your tent at night, you need just a lantern and a mirror.  If you start chanting the dragon's true name and turn off your lantern, just as you chant it the fifth time, a shadowy figure will then claw its way out of the mirror, possess the tent, spit you out and take the form of a spooky dragon.  The true name of the dragon is a closely kept secret, but campers call it umbra for its shadowy appearance. 
 Little campers and wizzlings tell the creepiest stories around the fire, and this one is no different.  Rumor has it that you can summon a dragon if you sit alone in your tent at night, you need just a lantern and a mirror.  If you start chanting the dragon's true name and turn off your lantern, just as you chant it the fifth time, a shadowy figure will then claw its way out of the mirror, possess the tent, spit you out and take the form of a spooky dragon.  The true name of the dragon is a closely kept secret, but campers call it umbra for its shadowy appearance.

Plasma.name: Plasma
Plasma.description:
The story of the plasma dragon is a strange one. Years ago the brilliant wizard Franklin Dogood was caught in a terrible storm when a bolt of lightning struck a nearby pond, instantly evaporating it. Ever the scholar, Franklin went to investigate and discovered something incredible -- a baby dragon where the pond once stood! 
 The story of the plasma dragon is a strange one. Years ago the brilliant wizard Franklin Dogood was caught in a terrible storm when a bolt of lightning struck a nearby pond, instantly evaporating it. Ever the scholar, Franklin went to investigate and discovered something incredible -- a baby dragon where the pond once stood!

Tulip.name: Tulip
Tulip.description:
Ah, the tulip dragon. The witch nicknamed Miniscule Minerva was the first to stumble over this dragon--quite literally, as the dragon was napping in a tulip field. Blended right in! That's where magicfolk get the old cautionary phrase "It's better to tiptoe through the tulips." Especially handy advice in the garden in the moonlight. 
 Ah, the tulip dragon. The witch nicknamed Miniscule Minerva was the first to stumble over this dragon--quite literally, as the dragon was napping in a tulip field. Blended right in! That's where magicfolk get the old cautionary phrase "It's better to tiptoe through the tulips." Especially handy advice in the garden in the moonlight.

Rainbow.name: Rainbow
Rainbow.description: Normal words cannot begin to describe the resplendence of this, rarest type of all dragons. The first person to ever witness one stared for hours before running home to send a poet to describe the beast. When the poet arrived, the dragon had left without a trace, leading many to believe that the explorer made up the whole story. Only years later do we now realize that he wasn't crazy at all!

Flash.name: Flash
Flash.description: The Lightning Dragon Master was experimenting with a major spell to improve the Lightning Boost at the exact moment Light Magic reentered the world of DragonVale. His favorite irksome lightning dragon, Wally, seemed to have been transformed into a new breed, the flash dragon. Capable of darting around at unnatural speeds, flash dragons have been nicknamed 'scarlet speedsters'.

Ghostly Decay.name: Ghostly Decay
Ghostly Decay.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The decay dragon is the star of spooky bedtime story in the Vale, giving it somewhat of an unfair reputation. Parents tell their children not to play tricks, or else the decay dragon will drag them from their beds and bring them to a horrible land without candy! In reality, though, the decay dragon's interests are more about eating treats, and less about dragging little witches and wizards off into the night.

Lightmatter.name: Lightmatter
Lightmatter.description: Although the lightmatter dragon appears to disperse the rainbow over the Vale and be active during the day, it often interacts with its counterpart dragon - darkmatter. This creates a precedent as usually dark and light are allergic elements. Still, their love for each other is phenomenal.

Jasper.name: Jasper
Jasper.description: When a baby jasper dragon followed Esme Treen home one day, the witch had no idea what to make of the especially social, bouncy creature. The magical similarities to gemstone dragons seemed clear, but this breed exhibited unique social behaviors. Esme hypothesized that a single population of gemstone dragons became separated in ancient times, resulting in two distinct classes of dragon. It may be that even more crystalline dragons are waiting to discover unassuming wizards! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Thunderbolt.name: Thunderbolt
Thunderbolt.description:
From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Thunderbolt Dragon:
In honor of the Arcane Pentournament and the return of dragons thought to have disappeared after the Cataclysm, Valefolk young and old takes time to study poem scrolls recovered from the Scar of the World. The ancient authors of the arcane believed that these dragons ruled over all physical and mystical elements, as reflected in the ode above.

Tinsel.name: Tinsel
Tinsel.description: The witch to first discover the tinsel dragon would prefer to remain anonymous. This may or may not have something to do with the slightly embarrassing way in which she discovered the dragon, but can you blame a witch for mistaking the tinsel dragon for a tinsel bush? She didn't mean to pluck so hard, nor frighten the dragon into a frenzied flight through the Vale's freshly finished Frosty Jubilee decorations. Everyone's best cleanup spells got a wand workout that day! The tinsel dragon is fine, albeit less likely to lounge in a patch of tinsel bushes again.

Avarice.name: Avarice
Avarice.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 5
In a deep dark cave, an avarice dragon lay tossing and turning on a bed of DragonCash. It appeared that slumbering comfort was greatly out of reach for this poor bedraggled being. Finally, it had found the perfect spot and its eyelids slowly closed. As soon as a genuine snore bellowed out of its snout, the loudest squawk in the Vale echoed everywhere. The avarice dragon's eyes popped open; it stood straight up, and banged its head on a low-hanging stalactite. It groaned and snarled with hackles standing on end. It marched toward the mouth of the cave to find the cause of its unpleasant awakening, yet there was nothing there. It took flight and soared over the Vale until it spotted a boisterous choir and a contributing libretto dragon. It let out a giant roar that scattered the singers and even emade the libretto dragon hide. Satisfied, the avarice dragon flew back home to its cave...

Wavelyte.name: Wavelyte
Wavelyte.description: Don't pet the wavelyte dragon for at least 30 minutes after eating. Wait sorry, wrong scroll-that's the rule for swimming in the ocean. Waves, wavelyte... you understand the mixup. Anyway, the wavelyte dragon likes visitors to pay it attention anytime, especially if they share whatever they're eating. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Dungeon.name: Dungeon
Dungeon.description: The wizard Guy Gacks, son of Arne, was the first person to discover the dungeon dragon deep in an ancient network of catacombs. The entrance to the catacombs is near a keep on the borderlands between the Sandara Desert and the Drag Marshes.

Midnight.name: Midnight
Midnight.description: The midnight dragon has been observed to stay up all hours to practice breathing its magical fire; the first dragon on record to be shown actually attempting to get better at this natural phenomenon. The magical breath temporarily leaves behind a rare and potent oil secreted only by midnight dragons. The light this oil produces is soft and soothing - some have even claimed that the oil helps them to keep working effectively through the night

Sprout.name: Sprout
Sprout.description: The Sprout dragon is truly one of nature's mysteries! These little dragons are so full of the energy of new life, that instead of getting very large as they grow, they actually multiply into a small group over time! It's possible that given centuries, these groups would grow up, but for now we'll just enjoy their playful youth!

Ivy.name: Ivy
Ivy.description: The wizard to discover the ivy dragon wishes to remain nameless, as the whole incident was apparently something an embarrassment. He'd like the record to show that he didn't, as Valefolk reported, "shriek like a baby dragon with its tail in a tangle." But, hey, you would (allegedly) shriek too if you went to repair your cottage and discovered your ivy-covered rooftop was actually an ivy dragon sunning itself!

Harvest.name: Harvest
Harvest.description: The harvest dragon has a peculiar penchant for pulling plants from the ground. Long ago, clever farmers would line up their fields with the harvest dragon's migratory paths. This would save them days of labor and the harvest dragons would be rewarded with piles of treats. The farmers would have to take care to send the dragons on their way eventually, lest any stragglers stayed to 'harvest' freshly planted crops!

Fulgurite.name: Fulgurite
Fulgurite.description:
Fulgurite dragons have a disputed origin amongst argumentative magicfolk.  Some say they are mud dragons that have gotten into a physical kerfuffle with lightning dragons; permanently altering their scale structure from an electrical current.  Others say they are sand sculptures, made by wizarding youth, that have been animated by natural lightning strikes.  And there's one ornery, strange wizard that swears it's a dragon with rock-like scales and a foul mouth.  No one really talks to him much anymore.
It is very likely that none of these theories are correct.  If you're lucky enough to spot a baby fulgurite dragon, you'll see they possess earth and lightning magic from the very beginning of their cloistered lives.

Stella.name: Stella
Stella.description: Stella dragons are extremely stealthy, but only during the night. When darkness triumphs in the Vale, they often fly out and merge with the night sky thanks to their unique coloring. Their whole body is covered in beautiful sparkly stars on a clear summer sky, and that's a real pretty picture to look at. During the day though, things are different as these same sparkly bits are so bright that you wouldn't need  a seriously-magically-tricked-out-telescope to catch a glimpse of their glimmer.

Arctic.name: Arctic
Arctic.description: Hailing from the far South, the arctic dragon is a rare sight in climates comfortable for wizards. The warrior-witch Hildegard Drakkenfjord is said to have walked across the Sea of Kizmar with two arctic dragons by her side, freezing the water beneath them as they went. This feat got her an epic poem written in her honor, but it's said her feet were never warm again.

Steel.name: Steel
Steel.description: The steel dragon likes to parade back and forth showing off its fearsome horns. As other dragons pass, the steel dragon will turn over its right shoulder to flash a cold, steely gaze, stopping them in their tracks. It is a matter of curiosity that no steel dragon has ever been observed to turn left before flashing its gaze.

Entwined.name: Entwined
Entwined.description: While researching these dragons, there was a great debate amongst the wizards if they should be categorized separately.  Attempts to separate the entwined dragons by force have left many wizards with charred eyebrows, and clever use of magic has made both dragons sad and lonely after spending time apart from their partner.  The dispute was then quickly ended, as they appear to be seemingly inseparable, since they find partners as soon as they hatch, with their tails and fates forever entwined.

Thicket.name: Thicket
Thicket.description: Baby thicket dragons learn quickly that their little dangling vines aren't toys - or food, for that matter. One nibble is all it takes to teach them that those vines are attached! Gardenia has a theory  about why these dragons grow vines, but the rest of the Vale is content to appreciate the aesthetic value of "total cuteness."

Fog.name: Fog
Fog.description: Very little has ever been recorded about this gentle beast. Something about being in the presence of a fog dragon is so relaxing that any person who set out to observe them up-close wound up forgetting to write anything down. Our oldest records recount one person's memory of his encounter as 'a little hazy'.

Gold.name: Gold
Gold.description: The world famous treasure hunter, Thatche, was finding some of his spoils disappearing at night; with no sign of thieves he decided to pretend sleep in order to find out what was causing his treasure to vanish. To Thatche's surprise, he witnessed a massive golden dragon swoop in and fly off with as much as it could carry! The wizards found later that gold dragons steal because they sleep on piles of gold for pillows.

Giddle.name: Giddle
Giddle.description:
The giddle dragons love to prank wizards whenever presents are being exchanged, regardless of the occassion.  Unattended presents quickly becomes snacks, as they devour the contents and hide in ambush inside the boxes.  Later, when the wizards open their gift, instead they find a cuddly dragon blowing raspberries in their face and running off giggling. 
 The giddle dragons love to prank wizards whenever presents are being exchanged, regardless of the occassion.  Unattended presents quickly becomes snacks, as they devour the contents and hide in ambush inside the boxes.  Later, when the wizards open their gift, instead they find a cuddly dragon blowing raspberries in their face and running off giggling.

Plains.name: Plains
Plains.description: "DRAAAAGONVAAAALAAA.. GONNAHATCHAAAAAAA DRAGOOOOOON!" ...is what many visitors like to sing to the plains dragon, for some reason. As the plains dragon startles easily, maybe shouting song lyrics at it isn't the best for park business.

Firework.name: Firework
Firework.description: Wizards often use firework spells to light up the sky for celebrations. One year, a young wizard named Vander Horck, determined to create the most magnificent firework display in history, decided to change the spell. Upon its casting, the spell burst high in the air with a bright red glare more splendid than anyone could have imagined. In response to the magnificent display, thousands of colorful firework dragons poured into the night sky and to this day are only seen during grand celebrations.

Barbarous.name: Barbarous
Barbarous.description:
The Hunt is Imperiled
The team of wizards raced back to the portal where they left Kaleni, following the glow of the flare in the sky.
They found their companion ducking behind a bush and joined him in hiding. Gazing up, they saw that the light in the sky was no flare, but a fearsom-looking dragon, wreathed in metal and flames. It was then joined by a dark shape circling in the air - it appeared that the eldritch dragon had followed them back.
As they whirled together in the dark sky, the eldritch dragon suddenly burst alight and took on a flame-filled form, causing the shadows in the square to dance and flicker wildly. The eldritch dragon drew its now burning wings together and, with a blinding flash, rocketed away.
Just then, Whitbee emerged from the darkness and pointed his wand at the fire-lit trail left by the eldritch dragon. The armored, fiery dragon seemed to heed the order and darted away across the landscape, a cantering, conflagratious countenance. Whitbee took off after it, and the other wizards followed, sticking to the shadows.

Masque.name: Masque
Masque.description: Always there to steal the show at a party, the masque dragon flaunts and struts its way into the spotlight.  Everyone cheering and clapping, thinking this is just another dragon in a fancy costume, but they don't know that the fancy costume itself is the dragon.  Another glittery mystery for the researchers - who is behind the masque?

Molten.name: Molten
Molten.description: Surprisingly, famed fire magic expert Pi Roh was NOT the first wizard to discover the molten dragon. That honor belongs to  metal magic expert Shi Nee, who was hovering over a magma flow one day while hunting for rare volcanic metals. Instead of rare metals, she found something even better: the molten dragon! Or, really, the molten dragon found her -- it sneezed and set her broomstick on fire. Whoops!

Weaver.name: Weaver
Weaver.description: Originating from the Ice-Risen Vault caves, weavers are very social dragons and often form close bonds with others of their kind by bringing each other gifts and tokens of appreciation.  A particularly shiny rock, some tasty treats or perhaps a pretty colorful feather.  Each gift, neatly wrapped in soft silky threads, very hard to open these presents.  They were drawn to the Vale by the overflowing essence of magic, maybe they could wrap that as well?  Who knows... But it seems that by observing the Wizards exchanging gifts, the dragons figured that these T-shaped bags Valers put on must be greatly appreciated presents, if they gift them so often.  That's how they got into the habit of making sweaters for the Wizards, occasionally making socks as well, seeing that the humans need tiny sweaters for their feet as well.

Cumulus.name: Cumulus
Cumulus.description:
If ever you've looked up and thought you've spotted a dragon in the clouds, you weren't just imagining things--there actually ARE dragons up there! At least the cumulus dragon is up there wearing a satisfied smirk due to its penchant for tricking cloud-gazers. Then again, maybe it's daydreaming of Kraken Kabbage... *wistful sigh* 
 If ever you've looked up and thought you've spotted a dragon in the clouds, you weren't just imagining things--there actually ARE dragons up there! At least the cumulus dragon is up there wearing a satisfied smirk due to its penchant for tricking cloud-gazers. Then again, maybe it's daydreaming of Kraken Kabbage... *wistful sigh*

Glimmerwing.name: Glimmerwing
Glimmerwing.description: While performing late night crystal scrying in her observatory, the astronomancer Valentina heard a curious sound coming from outside. There she saw a wondrous sight: a glimmerwing dragon had become enthralled by one of the many crystal globes placed about the observatory. Cooing and awing at its own reflection, the dragon hardly noticed as Valentina recorded all she could before the dragon departed into the night. Since then, wizards and witches have always lit up at the chance to see these rare nighttime wonders.

Luck.name: Luck
Luck.description: These dragons often have their naps interrupted by Wizards and wizzlings who think they have stumbled upon their lucky charm. And a pretty massive lucky charn at that. Only it's not a four-leaf clover, it has only three leaves! And it's not even a clover, it's a dragon's tail! Maybe the luck dragon don't count themseves as lucky in that regard.

Corrupticorn.name: Corrupticorn
Corrupticorn.description: During a midnight stroll searching for firefly dragons, princess Eris thought she left her chromacorn dragon friend at home. She didn't realize her clingy companion followed her into the woods until she caught sight of it rummaging in a blushroom patch. When the chromacorn dragon couldn't find any bright blue snacks, it reared up and roared. Under the full moon, a dark purple shimmer spread over the dragon and transformed it into something new... the corrupticorn dragon! Eris said aloud, "I never knew dragons could get hangry"

Zaffer.name: Zaffer
Zaffer.description: What gives Rift-touched dragons like the zaffer such unusual pulsating patterns? Excellet question! Gwyddion is doing his best to figure out, with the help of the Vale's brightest magical minds. The short answer is "chaos magic", but Gwyddion isn't quite sure why or how. Prehaps the Etherium powering the Rift Breeding Cave have something to do with it. Additional alchemical analysis is advised.

Snootroot.name: Snootroot
Snootroot.description: It's a wonder it took so long to discover the Snootroot dragon, considering how it loves to flaunt its fluff. Known to spend half of its day preening, and the other half brandishing its pompous coiffure, researchers still aren't sure when this dragon actually sleeps. Then again, the wizards may have been too mesmerized by the Snootroot's fancy flairs to actually do any research.

Eve.name: Eve
Eve.description:
The even dragon has an almost ethereal air to it, showing off an impressive set of wing colors that resemble winter sunrises o'er the crystalline valleys of Silverfalls Gorge. In fact, ancient legend suggests it was the eve dragon that broke the long dark of the first winter.
So it goes, after weeks of winter darkness, a beam of light descended from the sky to illuminate the highest peak of the mountains surrounding Silverfalls Gorge. There in the beam was an eve dragon, who spreat its magnificent wings in welcome of the sleepy sun as it peeked above the horizon.
Today, Valefolk attribute such stories to old witches' tales, but nevertheless find themselves in a state of quiet awe when in the presence of this alluring dragon.

Double Rainbow.name: Double Rainbow
Double Rainbow.description: Dismissed as wild speculation, muddled magic or the mad ravings of the witch Zamora, the rarest of the rare dragons, the double rainbow dragon is a  magical marvel. After glimpsing one as a child, Zamora devoted the rest of her life searching for this most elusive dragon. She has finally succeeded and worked a complex spell to allow them to be bred.

Trilobite.name: Trilobite
Trilobite.description:
While hundreds of morpho dragons were trying to cool down the Burcadian Breeding Cave, the ground of the island's spire began to crack with the drastic shifts in temperature. From these cracks, certain sections mysteriously writhed.
Several massive trilobite dragons broke loose from the ground and stretched their ancient wings, crackling and groaning in unison. They flew up high and observed the entire Vale as if for the very first time. Every newly discovered chrysalis dragon observed the awakening of the trilobite dragons and instinctually travelled to their location. With the innate understanding that danger was lurking, the trilobite dragons chased the remaining Valers to an overgrown magic portal. After the magicfolk were safe on other islands, the trilobite dragons formed a shield with their bodies while floating in midair and blocked the Vale from potential rogue effects.
The other eight dragon types unleashed their varied breath magic at the Burcadian Breeding Cave... but nothing happened. The trilobite dragons stayed vigilant with their guard even though progress was not made. The dragons kept firing their breath at the cave until all became winded. At that moment, something sparkled high above them...

Cocoahollow.name: Cocoahollow
Cocoahollow.description: This velvety brown dragon hails from the hollow dens of the Theobroma hills. Its color is thought to originate from its affinity for a local rich tuber treat growing in the vicinity of the hollows. Once the wizards learned they could by coaxed out of their dens with dragon treats instead, the cocoahollow dragons have been hopping with delight ever since.

Sulfur.name: Sulfur
Sulfur.description: The sulfur dragon is often found near volcanoes and the hottest geysers. Their bright coloring makes them hard to miss, but it's their strong smell that your park visitors are most likely to remember. Friendly as they are, you don't want one of these dragons to lick you--their slobber can burn holes in your robes.

Opal.name: Opal
Opal.description: Opal dragons are said to be capable of displaying every color in the visible spectrum. In fact they're even supposed to be able to exhibit some invisible ones as well! Some say that invisible dragons are really just opal dragons parading around in these...harder to see colors. Our wizards can neither confirm nor deny this rumor. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Glacier.name: Glacier
Glacier.description: Tremendous eaters, glacier dragons follow the first rule of geography, never get separated from your lunch. Trails of excess water in your habitat?  We assure you that's meltwater, not an accident.

Wolper.name: Wolper
Wolper.description:
With a hip and a hop, in the Vale the wolper dragons decided to stop.
They wave at others to say hi, and they flap their ears to fly high in the sky.
It is either colorful flowers or eggs they are after, and with their arrival they bring joy and laughter.
How they came to be - nobody knows, too fast to catch and study I suppose.

Chrysalis.name: Chrysalis
Chrysalis.description: Springtime seems to be this dragon's favorite time of year. As a baby, the chrysalis dragon will happily wriggle along in its habitat, charming visitors with its cuteness. Once it grows up a bit, the chrysalis dragon blossoms some sweet plumage. Who needs wings when you have a spike beard?

Luminous.name: Luminous
Luminous.description: Shortly after the return of Light Magic, the luminous dragons were discovered high in the Berrywhite Mountains. An apprentice of the wizard Mohs was researching a rare geological formation of rock chalk and happened upon an aerie of the majestic dragons.

Mesmer.name: Mesmer
Mesmer.description: With the arrival of the mesmer dragons, everyone affected by the hypnosis mysteriously awoke from their slumber, as if by the snap of a finger.  Although no one could snese any malice in the actions of these odd dragons, it was clear they were behind the exodus of dragons from the dreamland.  They are so in tune with their home-world's laws and properties, that they were able to not only open a way between our worlds, but to also hypnotize the wizards without having to even set foot here.  Why they did it and why the Wizards had to be asleep we may never find out, but at least the dragons are happy to have more lovely friends around.  Curiously, everyone that went under their spell later awoke with a vague memory of a place called "Lemnos".  No one seems to know where it is, only that it's somewhere in the dreamland.

Ghost.name: Ghost
Ghost.description: Often mistaken as the spirit of an ancient and benevolent dragon, the ghost dragon remains somewhat of a mystery. Reading the notes of the wizard Sam Hain, "The ghost dragon only shows up in the middle of the Fall, usually in conjunction with the bone dragon. My advice? Don't be afraid of no ghosts!"

Ghostly Gift.name: Ghostly Gift
Ghostly Gift.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
These crafty creatures snuck into the bag of holding of the magical toymaker Sandakloz. After being studied over the holidays, the wizards have found a way to counteract the singularity magic that prevented more than one existing in the same place at the same time. Clever wizards.

Hakahaka.name: Hakahaka
Hakahaka.description: Legend tells of the Warrior Witch Malina and her beloved hakahaka dragon. The two were always seen together until the events of The Cataclysm separated them. Determined to find her missing friend, Malina scoured The Surface - the wild magics of The Cataclysm swirling about her - traversing landscapes filled with volcanic eruptions, sailing across deadly seas, and battling never-before-seen magical enchantments. After several weeks Malina nearly gave into despair while fending off an army of enchanted coconuts, when her hakahaka dragon, like a rock crashing down a mountain, appeared by her side and plowed through the coconuts. To this day it is said that the swirling pattern of the hakahaka dragon's hide is a result of the swirling wild magics that it encountered during The Cataclysm. To this day it's also known that hakahaka dragons love coconuts.

Bouquet.name: Bouquet
Bouquet.description: Bouquet dragons have very nurturing instincts. They make sure every dragon that shares their habitat is taken care of and bouquet dragons are the first dragon known to exhibit a behavior of cleaning up after other dragons, especially hatchling and juvenile dragons.

Spectre.name: Spectre
Spectre.description:
Once upon a dark night foggy, Nogard awoke, worn and groggy,
 And looked about at scrolls and tomes of ancient dragon lore.
 Wile he drifted, nearly sleeping, came a sound, the sound of creaking,
 A sound as if some thing were sneaking, sneaking near his tower door.
 "Tis some visitor", he mumbled, "creeping in the foggy moor-
 Only this, and nothing more."
Gath'ring his courage (and his beard) Nogard stood to see what neared,
 And looked out his tower window at the distant foggy moor.
 Then a form came from the dark, ghostly pallored, eerily stark,
 A shade which made Nogard remark, "hat dread awaits me, in my park?"
 He grabbed his cloak and staff and said, "There's only one way to be sure."
 And then he walked  upon the moor.
From the dark there came a grumble, a soft and low kind of rumble,
 Nogard almost took a stumble, out in the foggy moor.
 Nogard peered into the black, and what he saw took him aback,
 A hungry spectre dragon pack, to which he sighed and threw a snack.
 Nogard called out to the dragons as he walked back to the door,
 "That's all you get, and nothing more!

Nova.name: Nova
Nova.description: Brilliant through the astromancer Noel dePlante may be, it took the help of light experts Shi Nee and Ylyse Draagg to discover the nova dragon. In the roiling cauldron that is the cosmos, only a specific set of complex spells can reveal this elusive galaxy dragon. This magical detection technique is known as Draagg's Divination!

Jingle.name: Jingle
Jingle.description: These jolly and helpful dragons have been known to be great at hiding in surprising locations. It wasn't until Sandakloz checked his cartload of gifts -- twice -- that the sounds of the jingle dragon gave itself away! Now wizards and witches everywhere can enjoy this jolly, helpful dragon.

Dazzling.name: Dazzling
Dazzling.description: One starry eve, astromancer Noel dePlante was gazing up through his telescope when he saw something in the sky that was so bright, he was temporarily blinded and had to look away. Compelled to discover what space sight could be so bright, Noel magicked up a way to dim dazzle shining through his telescope. And so was the first observation of the Dazzling Dragon since Vinturfjordian legend, flying through the night sky with its signature glow as if one with the stars.

Icy Torrent.name: Icy Torrent
Icy Torrent.description: This dragon doesn't quit for ANYTHING, especially when it comes to sussing out of stray Dragon Treats. Some Valefolk report having seen this dragon burrow into the center of a glacier when Zazzberries were at stake. No one knows how Zazzberries ended up in the center of a glacier, but rest assured, the icy torrent dragon took care of it.

Ice.name: Ice
Ice.description: This is one cold-blooded creature. Literally. The ice dragon is so cold that water condenses and freezes on its wings and webbed ears so that it looks like it is almost made of ice.

Nightshade.name: Nightshade
Nightshade.description: The great wizard Garriott often uses rare plants as reagents in his complex spells. While gathering a batch of the nightshade plant at midnight on a full moon, he happened upon a new type of dark dragon. He promptly named them nightshade dragons due to the resemblance of their wings to the plant of the same name.

Howl.name: Howl
Howl.description: Since the return of Dark Magic, the impossibly steep Allengin Mountain range has echoed with bone chilling howls at night. Sleep deprived and irascible, the wizards of the neighboring valley hastily organized an expedition via flying carpet to discover what all the ruckus was about. There they made a surprising realization. Howl dragons have bad night vision, and use their screams to navigate at night. Since then, howl dragons have been relocated to well lit habitats.

Wick.name: Wick
Wick.description:
From Fire and Light this dragon came forth.
Its secrets Wizards and Witches tried to unfold.
From youth to adult they studied it all.
Only in mysteries and puzzles to fall.
To bother the Wick they wanted no more.
Some tales are better to stay forever untold.

Herald.name: Herald
Herald.description: From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Herald Dragon:

Double Leap Year.name: Double Leap Year
Double Leap Year.description: Double leap year, double dragon heads! Truly, two heads are better than none, because how would you feed a dragon without a head? Of course, with two heads come other pertinent questions: Which head controls the feet? What happens if they get into a staring contest? Can they communicate telepathically? Don't you wish you had a second head, too?

Woven.name: Woven
Woven.description: Every witch and wizard was preparing for the ninth anniversary of the Vale. Everyone had a different task, and Kliff Moore volunteered to go collect some Dragon Treats. While looking for blushrooms the morning of the celebration, he heard an unusual sound coming from behind the nearest bush. He walked slowly to it and slowly moved its branches to uncover a bunch of playful woven dragons. No one has ever seen them before, which is weird considering how weird of a sound they make when moving. But now, they're a preferred company in the Vale, because of their personality. They're so transparent that you can see right through them. But in a good sense, of course.

Niamh.name: Niamh
Niamh.description: Elegant and peaceful, blooming and beautiful, a near incarnation of spring itself. The appearance of these dragons is a telltale sign of the seasons changing. And you can tell it's springtime when the birds are chirping, the flora is sprouting and the allergies are annoying. Niamh dragons are so intertwined with nature, that some Wizards think they just sprout out of the ground when spring comes around.

Tansy.name: Tansy
Tansy.description:
Inspiration for the famous Burcadian Egg Hunt carol, this dragon makes all the little Valekins sing:
Here comes big ol' fluffy tail,
Flying down the racing trails,
Flappity flappity, wings are making way!
Bringin' all the visitors,
Breath-blash tricks and Egg Hunt roars,
Give tansy a Burcadian hooray! 
 Inspiration for the famous Burcadian Egg Hunt carol, this dragon makes all the little Valekins sing:
Here comes big ol' fluffy tail,
Flying down the racing trails,
Flappity flappity, wings are making way!
Bringin' all the visitors,
Breath-blash tricks and Egg Hunt roars,
Give tansy a Burcadian hooray!

Trinket.name: Trinket
Trinket.description: A longheld wintertime tradition around the Vale is for witches and wizards to gift each other trinket dragon eggs. Supposedly, the trinket dragon is rumored to have a magical aura that brings good luck when it comes to receiving gifts. The jury is out on whether this dragon really brings good luck, but it certainly brings joy and adorable companionship!

Quantum.name: Quantum
Quantum.description:
The Secret of Physics
While the skies darkened and sporadic energy formed clouds, a quantum dragon lay asleep on a chunk of land floating up toward the Vale. The purple fog around this dragon floated closer and closer, converging on the slumbering creature. The fog clung to the land, then rolled along the sod. The quantum dragon slowly awoke and saw something fuzzy crawling on its tail. As soon as the dragon leapt up and and shook incessantly, it glimpsed the open chaotic skies while floating on a tiny island... and fainted.
The perturbed dragon awoke yet again, but this time there was no chunk of land under it. It was levitating without any support. The dragon spun in all directions looking for solid ground. It looked up and saw a huge island; it scrambled in the air to stop levitating. After managing to avoid a collision, the quantum dragon saw a gray figure lean over the edge of the island. It smoothly moved closer to the edge, then suddenly fell. It toppled toward the quantum dragon and an invisible shot of energy reflexively emanated from the creature.
The dragon furrowed its brow and saw the object coming back down. The quantum dragon let out another wave of unseen force and followed the figure in flight. With one last blast, it landed the statue safely to the ground. Staring back at the dragon, was the face of Nogard; he was petrified... encased in stone.
The quantum dragon wiped a smattering of purple energy off Nogard's face and took off with a loud screech toward the Surface...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

The quantum dragon wiped a smattering of purple energy off Nogard's face and took off with a loud screech toward the Surface...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Ghostly Krampus.name: Ghostly Krampus
Ghostly Krampus.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
If little wizards and witchlings start to get too excited for the winter festivities, parents often use the krampus dragon to keep them in line. "You better behave, or the krampus dragon will gobble up all your iceberries!" is heard fairly often this time of year. Unfortunately, this gives the sweet krampus dragon an undeserved reputation. It would never eat your iceberries! That long sticky tongue is actually used to sip up sweet nectar from blossoms in the far north.

Armament.name: Armament
Armament.description:
The Secret of Strength
A giant metal slab rumbled on the kid-conjured island, created to combat rogue spellform energy. The metallic formation shook again. A crack split open, sending splinters in all directions. An armament dragon's head emerged and roared with great power. A darcowl dragon's tail slapped over the shouting dragon's mouth. The armament dragon furrowed its brow as the darcowl dragon reveald itself and slowly removed its tail.
The darcowl dragon broadened its stance and morphed into its organic spellform, creating a veil in front of its newfound friend. Seconds later, Kai walked by to collect the Parade Gardens' Magic accrual. The armament dragon broke out of its immovable trap and roared in triumph. The darcowl dragon again muzzled the loud-mouth dragon with its tail.
After Kai moved on to check Gardenia's Gamery, the darcowl dragon attempted to usher its friend to hidden safety, but it wouldn't follow. The armament dragon peered off into the dark purple sky and wandered closer and closer to the island's edge. It was if the dragon was following a call no dragon or wizard could hear.
The darcowl dragon tried to grapple the wandering dragon's legs. The armament dragon was too strong and kept lumbering toward imminent calamity...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform. 
 The Secret of Strength
