The darcowl dragon tried to grapple the wandering dragon's legs. The armament dragon was too strong and kept lumbering toward imminent calamity...
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Ortreat.name: Ortreat
Ortreat.description: The most delicious candies in all of DragonVale were once made by the confectioner Ortreat, who only shared them with his special pack of hybrid dragons. One day, some clever kids hatched a plan to get the coveted confections with a set of baby dragon costumes. When Ortreat saw the shoddily sewn dragonlings ambling about, his heart softened and he played along, sharing his treats with the ingenious little 'dragons'. Even long after Ortreat moved on, the tradition of costumes and candy remained. To this day, young witches and wizards wait all year for the autumn night when they can go out and 'trick Ortreat'.

Fates.name: Fates
Fates.description:
Triple, triple wings a-ripple, breaths a-blast and tails a-wriggle,
three as one, a woven pack, each believed to have a knack:
one for spinning, one for spanning,
one for chomping---fateful planning!

Pyrite.name: Pyrite
Pyrite.description: When first observed, the pyrite dragon was thought to be a gold dragon because of the magnificent luster of its wings and horns. Closer inspection revealed this was a foolish assumption, since the gold dragon is notoriously heavier than its pyrite cousin. Nevertheless, many witches and wizards believe this dragon to bring good fortune to any upon whom the shadow of its flying form falls. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Buttercup.name: Buttercup
Buttercup.description: To impress the love of his life, a Wizard of the Vale traveled far and wide around the world in search of the perfect gift. Eventually, his adventures brought him to the Sandara Desert, where he hoped to find the shiniest gold and most brilliant lapis! To bring home a trinket of immeasurable quality, brandishing his beloved's favorite colors. He scoured nearly every stand of every merchant at the bazaar, when he noticed an intriguing item, resting on a fluffy blanket. He reached for it to have a closer look, only to realize he had grabbed the horn of a beautiful sleeping buttercup dragon. First he was scared, but his fear quickly turned to excitement, when he realized he had stumbled upon the perfect gift. And so, the buttercup dragons were introduced to the Vale.

Dartwing.name: Dartwing
Dartwing.description: Baby dartwing dragons almost never settle down. They zip around checking brightly colored hats for sweet nectar, but will sometimes knock one to the ground amid their zealous efforts. Wizards with dirty hats consistently mistake this for a mischievous spell and young Valers usually catch the blame. A slight hum that accompanies the ruckus is the only clue to the identity of the true culprit.

Yarr.name: Yarr
Yarr.description: Yarr dragons first got thar sea legs thanks t' the Wizard-Cap'n Reefheart. Nah t' be outdone by his nemesis Esesh, Reefheart brought along yarr dragons on his ship fer thar ability t' read the night sky 'n find thar way home by way o' stars 'n constellations. Natural leaders 'n tacticians, these dragons smartly climb thar way up the hierarchical chaos that be a pirate crew, t' become First Mates, sometimes even Captains o' ships. Occasionally they might step in the barrels o' grog or lemons, which ain't a problem as long as thar aren't any ikatako dragons hidin' inside.

Okenite.name: Okenite
Okenite.description: The okenite dragon is not to be confused with the cotton dragon, although both share characteristic fluffy white tails. In fact, if you were to pet an okenite dragon, you might be surprised to find it isn't fluffy at all! It's pointy, crystalline skin makes it closer in texture to a cactus dragon -- which doesn't stop the okenite dragon from trying to nuzzle visitors. Better to admire from a distance. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Glowwing.name: Glowwing
Glowwing.description: Have you ever visited the magical everflowering flower fields of the Burcadian Highlands? It's quite a sight! Chrysalis dragons far and wide flock to the fields to swoop and dive amidst the blossoms. The colorful glowwing dragon often leads the charge to frolicking! Being neon-hued has its beacon-like perks.

Delicia.name: Delicia
Delicia.description:
THAT NIGHT
The delicia dragon lived very close to the beach party, but still came in late because it spent a lot of time making itself prettier and preparing to look its best. When it arrived, an epic dance off was happening, and it decided to sign up. Delicia dragons are known for their beauty inside and out,  with valuable personality traits, such as kindness, compassion, optimism, sympathy, and confidence. When the time came, the delicia dragon was called on the stage and faced its opponent. Loud music started playing, the crowd was cheering, and some very interesting dancing was happening. The delicia dragon was on fire, dancing like crazy and the more intricate moves it did, more eyes were glued to it. It was having the best performance of its life. But the reason why so many were looking at it was because it was just flailing its wings and tail around and twirling all over the place. It still won, though.

Equinox.name: Equinox
Equinox.description: Two times each year, when night and day become equals, equinox dragons reveal themselves. Celebrations for the arrival of these dragons vary greatly, but villages graced with their presence are said to have an especially bountiful harvest. Wizards have since proven this tale to be untrue, but the festivals are so fun, they keep that little secret.

Rose.name: Rose
Rose.description: The witch Nadia of Cadberry Meadows is renowned for having the greatest flower nursery in all the land. The day after creating the Rose Topiary, she found a new dragon in her nursery, the rose dragon. After all the effort she put into creating the greatest topiary in the land, it was as if the flowers themselves rewarded her for her labors. Is there a better way to say I love you than a dragon? Probably.

Mirage.name: Mirage
Mirage.description: The witch Fatima Fata discovered the mirage dragon when she noticed its big eyes poking out of the sand in the Sandara Desert. Thinking it was a stranded water dragon, she dug it out, only to realize it was the rare offspring of light and dark, waiting out the heat of the day.

Sapphire.name: Sapphire
Sapphire.description: The wizard Mohs went to the Shimmering Isles looking for unique gem to craft into a ring for Yogo, a witch he fancied. Reaching to grab a star sapphire, he grabbed the horn of a sapphire dragon. Mohs might need a spell to correct his vision. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Karroot.name: Karroot
Karroot.description:
If you've ever gardened or tended to a farm, you're probably aware of the vigilant karroot dragon. They tend to travel in large groups and offer farmers a service to guard their crops. Their keen eyesight hones in on any suspicious behavior. This creates quite the scene when a sneaky Vale youth tries to steal a fresh snack. Never has anyone seen such a flurry of orange and green, unless they're still feeling the effects of Whibee's Candy Bash. 
 If you've ever gardened or tended to a farm, you're probably aware of the vigilant karroot dragon. They tend to travel in large groups and offer farmers a service to guard their crops. Their keen eyesight hones in on any suspicious behavior. This creates quite the scene when a sneaky Vale youth tries to steal a fresh snack. Never has anyone seen such a flurry of orange and green, unless they're still feeling the effects of Whibee's Candy Bash.

Starwing.name: Starwing
Starwing.description: According to Burcadian legend, the stars on the wings of the aptly named starwing dragon form the map to a great and mysterious galaxy, potentially leading Noel DePlante to discover a new galaxy dragon sometime in the future...

Macabre.name: Macabre
Macabre.description:
The Hunt is Ending
As the gang watched Whitbee teleport to follow the flaming streak left by the ignited eldritch dragon, the portal behind them began to change color to a silver-flecked sickly green. A pale, decaying dragon with enormous scythe-like horns emerged from it and sensing its brethren and the escaped dragon they sought, it darted into the dark sky, to head off its target and direct it back to the portal.
The macabre dragon rounded an enormous colosseum, banking North and acut off its prey. Seeing the black and red streak of the eldritch dragon turn sharply in its direction, it rocketed past and as it did so, the eldritch dragon's colors changed yet again, now resembling the pale and sickly green of the macabre dragon.
At the Bizarre Bazaar, Nogard surmised that they should start to clean up the mess that had been created in order to help Whitbee. Using their wands to repair and clean, Kaleni conjured up some snacks so that no one would go hungry.
Whitbee reappeared just in time to see the eldritch dragon land in the clearing in front of the portal as the other dragons followed suit. Sensing that the ordeal would soon be over, Whitbee sighed in relief, until Lumi, visibly exasperated by now, exclaimed, "you accidentally summoned that dragon didn't you!? Then you summoned the four apocalyptic hunters to assist you right"? Sheepishly, Whitbee replied, "yes, I did, but I wouldn't have gotten away with it if it weren't for you meddling wizards, and for that I thank you".
The shrounds that covered the eldritch dragon began to phase in and out of view blinking faster and faster until they disappeared entirely leaving a very awkward eldritch dragon standing there. "You know, this poor dragon didn't really do any harm to the Vale, and could stay if it likes", said Gardenia. "It can leave any time it wants as can these four hunters!" In an attempt to lighten the mood, Kaleni declared, "I'd make an apocalypse pun right now, but armageddon the feeling it wouldn't go over well". Kaleni laughed, the gang groaned, and Moony-Loo let forth a "Moony-loony LOOOOOOOO"!

Honuhonu.name: Honuhonu
Honuhonu.description: Valefolk were surprised when the young wizard, Warren, came home from swimming one day with a never-before-seen dragon in tow. Curious as to how Warren befriended this Honuhonu Dragon, an interview was set up with the young wizard to hear his story. The poor kid had such a bad case of stage fright, the only thing he could say throughout the entire 1-hour interview was "I like Honuhonus."

Trimera.name: Trimera
Trimera.description:
So it is told, Every 300 years, the trimera dragon appears.
Thrice in heads, thrice in bite, have you ever seen such a wondrous sight?
Yet, a philosophical quandary trickles the Vale: Can a trimera dragon chase its own tail?

Bronze Olympus.name: Bronze Olympus
Bronze Olympus.description: The majestic olympus dragon. These rare dragons were discovered at the top of Mount Oly and three distinct types are known to exist. This bronze variation is said to be the most common.

Spirit.name: Spirit
Spirit.description: Folkloric takes of this dragon echo through time and tradition. As it's told, the first spirit dragon appeared before a witch who was lost in the fogs of the Drag Marshes. The spirit dragon tried to use its breath to show the wayward witch which way to go, but its exhalations can only be seen by those in tune with the dragon's ethereal nature. With some clever conjuring, the lost witch was able to give the dragon a special runewand through which it could blast its beautiful blue breath for all to behold. To this day, some say spirit dragons still inhabit places where people are likely to get lost, using their benevolent breaths to guide home wayward wanderers.

Murano.name: Murano
Murano.description: Taking inspiration from the Butterfly Pavilion's magic-imbued stained glass, the wizards set out to try other enchantments on the glass.  Light imbued glass simply made the interior way too bright, and the water imbuement simply made all the glass drip to the floor.  It is when living flame was used on the glass that the murano dragon came to be, as the glass started to melt in a bright flash of light, making everyone turn their gaze away.  When the light dimmed down, they were shocked to see that imbuing the glass with living flame had actually turned it into a living dragon.

Cumberpatch.name: Cumberpatch
Cumberpatch.description:
If you don't look closely, you might miss the cumberpatch dragon entirely. The dragon likes to play a clever imitation game with nearby foliage, and is easily passed over. That's why it took sleuthing wizard Benedict Holmes to originally discover this hidden dragon! 
 If you don't look closely, you might miss the cumberpatch dragon entirely. The dragon likes to play a clever imitation game with nearby foliage, and is easily passed over. That's why it took sleuthing wizard Benedict Holmes to originally discover this hidden dragon!

Triple Rainbow.name: Triple Rainbow
Triple Rainbow.description: Much to the surprise of Zamora, triple rainbow dragons do exist, as it appears nature has indeed found a way. And although thought to be pretty tough to find, there have been plenty of sightings of this curious dragon recently. After seeing it with her own eyes, Zamora has spent most of her time in her study pondering upon this discovery. For if we assume that one is chance, two is coincidence, and three is a pattern.. what would the fourth be?

Satin.name: Satin
Satin.description: The satin dragon's smooth scales create the illusion that it is draped in smooth and beautiful silks. Don't be fooled though, dragons don't wear clothes--they have no use for them!

Root.name: Root
Root.description: Root dragons are quickly becoming known for their love of questing. Making these dragons available to park owners was originally difficult due to their disdain for being transplanted from their original habitat.

Teidian.name: Teidian
Teidian.description: The teidian dragon is nicknamed "little bull" for its small stature and origin within the Constellation of the Bull. Coincidentally, when Noel DePlante first observed this dragon cavorting in the night sky, it seemed to be playfully head-butting its fellow galaxy dragons.

Darkmatter.name: Darkmatter
Darkmatter.description: The darkmatter dragon is believed to account for approximately 85 percent of the matter in the Vale. Though many have seen its beauty, some astronomers are hesitant to admit its existence. But in the end, it doesn't really matter, does it.

Malefice.name: Malefice
Malefice.description: Not originally from the Vale, these dragons made their way here accompanied by a caravan of travelling Wizards and Merchants from faraway lands.  Intrigued by their look, our Wizards inquired about the nature of these insectoid dragons.  Their hair stood up when the travelers spoke the dragon's name... malefice.  Not to appear like cowardly fools in front of their visitors, our Wizards struck a deal with them to keep some malefice dragons at the Vale.  Now these dragons roam around freely, probably plotting the doom of the Vale and rubbing their claw thingies together... menacingly.

Orlena.name: Orlena
Orlena.description: The venerable orlena dragons are thrilled to get acquainted with their new subjects in this material-plane.  Having spent most of their time in the bizarre land of dreams surrounded by dreamy, floaty, cloudy dragons, they probably feel more at home here in the Vale.  And with them they bring the overwhelming power and emboldening force of love.  Able to bring forth the kind and gentle touch of a rose petal, as well as the sharp pain of its thorns.

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.description: A rare and misunderstood dragon, the zombie dragon is a reliable crowd pleaser. Just be sure to heed the wizard's stern warning to only feed them Dragon Treats. Lest they develop other ... appetites.

Sweetheart.name: Sweetheart
Sweetheart.description: Sweeter than sugar and zazzier than spice, the sweetheart dragon is the epitome of everything nice! These dragons always make sure their habitat-mates get dragon treats before they do, give up the best napping spots to others, and take time to play with the little ones. They are so kind hearted, in-fact, that you might want to make sure you donn't accidentally step on any fae-bugs while walking by their habitat. It would break their sweet little hearts!

Lace.name: Lace
Lace.description: This dragon is always dressed to the nines, thanks to the gossamer finery of its features. Once a year, the lace dragon renews its flowing lace and the remnants are collected by expert tailors. The resulting robes are some of the most exquisite in DragonVale; witches and wizards from all over bring bags of DragonCash for the privilege to wear them. The lace dragon doesn't seem to mind - after all, imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.

Country.name: Country
Country.description: Originating from the swamps of Valouisiana, these dragons have gone mostly unnoticed until the other Melody dragons started rollin' on to the Vale.  There always has been a community of wizards and witches that appreciates country dragons, like the great Wizard John Dragoncash being one of them, but now it was time for a wider audience.  For if you come down to the Vale, you don't have to worry, people in the Vale are happy to welcome you.

Chimmit.name: Chimmit
Chimmit.description: One day, a grumpy and disgruntled dragon made its way to the camp through the water, mud and sand, offended by the foolish and silly way in which the Scouts were trying to fish. So ineffective were the Scouts then, that the aquatic dragon thought it might as well teach them. If they are going to do it, might as well do it properly! Ever since then, Scouts have earned their fly-fishing badges in droves, and the chimmit dragon has been recognized as the best angler! On this side of the world at least.

Iridescent.name: Iridescent
Iridescent.description: Nominative determinism at work: The aptly-named Iris Chroma just so happens to be an expert in Light magic color theory! Her work with interferomagic and chromolumination spells culminated in a method of unveiling certain dragons that appear to be invisible in all but direct sunlight. Thanks to Iris' clever charmwork, the iridescent dragon's beauty is now in the eye of every beholder, no matter the weather!

Charlatan.name: Charlatan
Charlatan.description:
The Hunt has Hope
Nogard, Lumi, Gardenia, Kaleni, and Moony-Loo followed Whitbee back to the blue portal near the Airship of Ghouls. "You know, I've been thinking. We need a name," Lumi proposed.
"A name for what?" Kaleni blurted.
Lumi continued her thought, "For this. What we're doing right now. It's quite the mystery we're chasing."
"How about... Magical Mystery Team?" Norgard suggested.
"Loooooo!" the baby lycan dragon howled.
Gardenia piped up, "Sounds like a winner!" Just then, a deafening whirlwind was unleashed. The team stumbled behind a large rock and peeked around it. Whitbee was holding a book and recited an incantation.
The only word they could hear was "... charlatan!" As soon as it was uttered, a broad winged dragon shot out of the portal. It looped around and hovered in front of Whitbee. The whirlwind died down.
"Find the Eldritch," Whitbee commanded. The charlatan dragon took off in a streak of blue and gold. It majestically searched the land from high above. Moony-Loo ran after it.
Kaleni followed and cried "Wait up, Moony!"
In a bustling neighborhood, the charlatan dragon circled while witches and wizards decorated their homes with jack-o-lanterns and cauldrons. Kaleni and Moony arrived just when everyone collectively witnessed the charlatan dragon. They oohed and aahed at the aerial display.
Moony-Loo caught sight of the eldritch dragon on the outskirts of the neighborhood and chased it. The charlatan dragon saw the same thing Moony did and dove straight down in the midst of gawking magicfolk. It weaved in and out of homes, dodged innocent bystanders, and went straight afte rits target.
Kaleni busted through a bush just in time to see the charlatan dragon sweep over the Eldritch with its wing. Moony watched intently as blue, gold, and white took root on the eldritch dragon's tail and hind legs.
L-L-Let's get outta here!" Kaleni stammered to Moony-Loo.

Thorn.name: Thorn
Thorn.description: As the thorn protects the rose, so does the thorn dragon protect its companions. Fiercely loyal, this dragon will never leave the side of those it considers to be friends. Those friends, however, have learned to be cautious when receiving embraces.

Flurry.name: Flurry
Flurry.description: You can thank Lumi, the lovely little winter witch, for the discovery of the flurry dragon. While creating her patented cauldron-to-sky snowflakes one particularly blustery winter, a dragon came careering out of the sky and plopped right in the cauldron! It seemed the flurry dragon couldn't resist the allure of a fresh batch of snow--so much so that it wouldn't leave. Lumi had to suspend snowfall that day, but it was worth it for a fellow flurry-fanatical friend.

Drifter.name: Drifter
Drifter.description:
There was once a great songsmith name Aubrey The Bard and one of his favorite pastimes was to write songs from the perspective of dragons. The following text was found on tattered parchment and is believed to be an excerpt from a ballad titled, "The Drifter Dragon":
... They say I'm a loner, a floater,
I'm a vortext of misnomers.
But what they don't know is, I'm none of those.
I'm a drifter, baby!
Go my own way, make my own waves,
Just don't call me a knave or brave.
I come and go as I please.
I drift and drift and drift away...
Let it be known, this was most likely performed with an iron-made guitar.

Glyph.name: Glyph
Glyph.description: One beautiful day, Kaleni was helping around with yet another Egg Hunt. The hunt was so eggxausting that he decided to take a quick nap onto something that looked like a comfy rock with some moss on it. You know, when you’re tired even a rock looks good enough for a quick rest, don’t judge! Few seconds into a light nap, and the rock behind Kaleni’s back started moving! He promptly got up and started investigating the movement. And you know, curiosity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought it back - to his surprise, that “rock” was actually a long lost monolith dragon. The Burcadian lore was full of stories about a special breed of dragons that are so lethargic that they curl up and sleep throughout the winter. This one seems to have gotten quite the snooze if moss and other stuff started growing on its back...

Rain.name: Rain
Rain.description: While commonly found in large bodies of water throughout the southern tropics, on occasion the rain dragon has been mistaken for a gigantic flying fish when it takes to the skies. In the wild they have been observed precipitating a large amount of water while in flight. Hopefully guests will remember to bring their umbrellas.

Ornamental.name: Ornamental
Ornamental.description: On bright snowy nights in the far northern town of Vinturfjord, you might hear a jolly jingling in the distance. If you're lucky, it might be an ornamental dragon dashing over the snow. Nobody knows how the ornamental dragons grow their colorful spheres, but oh what fun they bring to the Vale!

Smoulderbrush.name: Smoulderbrush
Smoulderbrush.description: Some witches have seen smoulderbrush dragons pushing herbs and flowers around with their snouts. Most of the time, these creatures are left alone to pursue their somewhat blind and peculiar wandering. One witch needed specific foliage for a complicated potion, yet all she could find were bare plants. After venturing into a deep valley, she saw several smoulderbrush dragons sleeping quite soundly. In the middle of the gathering was a dwindling, crude campfire. She tiptoed to grab a few untouched plants, but stumbled and bumped her knee on a log. She let out a yell than stifled herself, but no dragons stirred. She shrugged and gathered her desired ingredients without disturbing a single sleepy soul.

Zipzap.name: Zipzap
Zipzap.description: Having studied the aperture dragons obsessively, the genius-wizard Teslan created a machine in his tower to mimic their portals. After successfully teleporting objects and plants, he felt he was ready to move on to actual dragons. The first few attempts were a flop, as he needed way more power to teleport something that big, so a couple lightning dragons aided him by supercharging the machine. The complex machinery could not take the heat and in a blinding flash, the machine was no more, but from the rubble arose a dragon infused with pure electricity and power. With their innate ability to generate electrical current, zipzap dragons quickly became Teslan's new favorite. They get a kick out of using their tails to discharge into the ground, think of it as the dragon equivalent of cracking your back.

Mylio.name: Mylio
Mylio.description:
Everyone in the Vale knows that if you're feeling a little down, you go to the Oreze lake where some mylio dragons live. Despite their gloomy appearance, their favorite thing to do is make you laugh. All you have to do is just put a nice little picnic blanket on the grass next to the lake and watch. You will see a mylio dragon's weird, but rather funny, mixture of dancing, acrobatics and other movements that no wizard can do. Shortly after, a wave of calmness and serenity (and maybe some splashed lake water) will embrace you. Surely, mylio dragons would give great calming hugs. But they don't have any limbs. Sadly. 
P.S. Oh, and it's pronounced "my lee oh".

Alffa.name: Alffa
Alffa.description:
THE OTHER NIGHT
The alffa dragon was sitting on a log bench in front of the fire and was listening to the stories of its friends.  Its age is unknown, but wizards guess it's been around for quite some time.  Its interesting name doesn't stand for leadership, but for wisdom and timelessness.  Many would look up to it and ask for advice on different occasions, because this dragon is said to be all-seeing.  There isn't a single Valer, witch or wizard it doesn't know or hasn't heard of.  For that reason everyone loved it and invited it to multiple different gatherings.  And that night was no exception.  Alffa met with its friends oaris, exandrew, hanno, grove, delicia and tebori on the beach and they ended up chatting all evening.  They met up on the same beach last year's party was, so they can all talk about their sweet Memories of Paradise.
The alffa dragon didn't speak much at first, but was patiently listening to its friends' stories.  One by one, all of them shared their most amazing memory of the night of the party, and when everyone turned to alffa dragon to ask for its best memory, it just let out a small laugh.  As it was all-seeing and witnessed everything that happened as they remembered it.  First turning to oaris dragon, alffa explained that the big party was already planned and it never approached razzle and dazzle for a talk.  Then, turning to the exandrew dragon - the mythic dragons turned its direction because of the loud thud that followed one of his attempts to fly.  Hanno's hair prevented it from seeing how good frond's handstand was.  Grove's friends were a little bit annoyed with how slow it was moving.  Delicia's dance was not as good as it remembered it.  And tebori - everyone was looking at it, but because they were in awe of the beautiful patterns.  Still, everyone had a great time that night and even the other night, and some new memories of paradise were created.

Sanguinite.name: Sanguinite
Sanguinite.description: Mt. Mashe - known as the the Bleeding Mountain to locals - is home to many undiscovered wonders beyond it intimidating walls. A fluid like a dark, cold magma seeps from the mountain's crags and is collected by the sanguinite dragons that live in its caves. This fluid then hardens into solid 'bubbles' along the dragon's head and back. Deposits have been found in the caves that resemble the dragon's shape, leading the wizards to believe that it shares some sort of symbiotic life cycle with the mountain itself. We're stumped by the specifies, but luckily we've transplanted the effects to our crystalline habitats, allowing this strange and wonderful dragon to join your park! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Shockproof.name: Shockproof
Shockproof.description: It is SHOCKing how blinding lightning is proven to be... Luckily, shockproof is in the Vale to protect the wizards!  What made it shock proof you may ask?  According to Whitbee, it all started with a bang!  Up there in the Frozen Highlands of the North mountains, snowy storms at high altitudes were making everything so appalling for Whitbee..  All of a sudden the deafening crackle of thunder stunned him.  With the blink of an eye, an apocalyptic picture unravelled!  Lightnings everywhere, piles of snow covering the ground..... it was scary!  With its little legs, Shockproof rushed into the open and was Hit by, Struck by a smooth... Lightning Strike.  This resulted in unique appearance and got it this amazing name.  Shocking, right?

Burglehoo.name: Burglehoo
Burglehoo.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 8
When wizards speak about burglehoo dragons, it always has a sharp tone. No one knows what to expect with these creatures, but they have been seen slinking and stalking with the intention of remaining hidden. There is a family that will attest that these dragons have hearts that grow three times bigger than any magicfolk. This family was hungry and their fireplace had grown cold. They couldn't get a flame lit with magic nor muscle. A burgleboo dragon just happened to pass and saw that these folks needed more than a little help. BOOM! Just then, a gumdrop flare fanned in the sky and this dragon knew just what to do. It snuck its way through the Vale until it saw an entire table filled with goodies. While a sugary plume clouded the confections, the burglehoo dragon slithered on its belly and snuck under the table undetected.
Only a few moments later, the hungry family heard a knock on their door. When they opened it, they saw a sweet feast waiting for them on a large table. They also saw the table had been dragged in the snow for some distance, accompanied by dragon tracks.

Snow.name: Snow
Snow.description: Some enthusiasts will mistake the rare snow dragon for a more common cold dragon. You can tell by the curly horns and the sleek frame that this dragon was made for flight more than land. Snow dragons almost never land, preferring to journey slowly through the northern skies, observing from a distance.

Spark.name: Spark
Spark.description: When dark and lightning met in the form of the spark dragon, it was electrically epic. Scattering energy in all directions, your visitors are sure to have a shockingly good time seeing these dragons!

Harvest Moon.name: Harvest Moon
Harvest Moon.description: The outrageously orange harvest moon is a rare sighting in the Vale, usually occurring in the late summer or early autumn--but yet more rare is the harvest moon dragon! This shy sweetie seems to be smitten with its namesake, generally appearing when the lunar orb is cast in harvest hues. You might consider decorating your park in shades of orange to make this dragon feel right at home!

Light Rift.name: Light Rift
Light Rift.description:
When Light Magic was returned to the world, rift dragons emerged, suffused with the brilliant magical energy of Light. If you look through the dragon's wings, you can catch a glimpse of the mysteries beyond the Rift. 
 When Light Magic was returned to the world, rift dragons emerged, suffused with the brilliant magical energy of Light. If you look through the dragon's wings, you can catch a glimpse of the mysteries beyond the Rift.

Morpho.name: Morpho
Morpho.description:
Morpho dragons love to keep their extremities cool in thick, sticky mud, preferably on a mountainside where the breeze stays constant. Sometimes hundreds of them will cling to the same patch, though it's difficult to spot such an occurrence as they blend so completely with the canvas of dirt. This was exactly the scene not too far from Kaleni's Burcadian Breeding Cave, when the growing heat hex began to liquefy their beloved mud pad.
The gigantic group lost their footing and began to cascade down the mountain. They all flapped their wings to pull away from the mudslide and suddenly the mountain shimmered with brilliant blue flashes all over. The aimless morpho dragons caught sight of Kaleni casting wind spell after wind spell at the baking breeding cave. They flew to his aid and surrounded the afflicted area. Kaleni didn't know what to expect. He had never seen so many morpho dragons in his life. They formed a giant cylinder, held their wings outstretched , then simultaneously flapped. They sent a cyclone of air spinning around the Burcadian Breeding Cave and it pushed Kaleni somersaulting into the back of the cave.
Kaleni vanished with his own spell and appeared on a nearby island, next to a wishing well, panting and sweaty. Ellie skipped by with an egg in her arms and saw the determined dragon display. "Are they okay?", she asked innocently.
Kaleni said, trying to catch his breath, "Yeah, they're just blowing off some steam."

Hanno.name: Hanno
Hanno.description:
THAT NIGHT
The hanno dragon was invited to the party by multiple Valers, because of its interesting persona. It spent the whole day partying by the beach with a beverage in hand, jokingly teasing everyone around it and asking passers-by to dare it to do something weird. Later, it was observed in its natural habitat, walking a bit weird and swimming in the water like a pro. It doesn't fly, but as the wizards say, it's not a bird of paradise, but a dragon of paradise. When nighttime came, the hanno dragon finally met with the frond dragon that dared it to do a handstand. Everyone gathered in a circle around them and the show began. There was some teasing and taunting between the two but they gave it their best. Hanno claimed til the end it's gonna win, because frond couldn't do the handstand at all. In reality it just couldn't see well what was happening because of its haircut. It is still unclear who had won that day, as both insist they beat the other.

Silver Olympus.name: Silver Olympus
Silver Olympus.description: The majestic olympus dragon. These rare dragons were discovered at the top of Mount Oly and three distinct types are known to exist. This silver variation is said to be slightly more common than the gold.

Jumpiplop.name: Jumpiplop
Jumpiplop.description: How jumpiplops made it to the Vale, you ask? Well, while exploring the swamps of Catchafaya in search for new weird and curious dragons, Wizard-Dragonologist Jeremy would every now and then hear splashes in the otherwise eerily still and quiet waters. By the time he'd turned around to see what creature broke the silence, only the remaining ripples could be seen, dancing in the water. Some splashes were more daring, being seen a second too late right next or behind him. Frustrated by this, the moment he heard a splash nearby he leapt into the water to grab at the creature. He was astonished to see a dragon unknown to him quickly swim away, climb up a tree and jump back into the water, making the splashes. This also might explain the name he chose for it.

Darkling.name: Darkling
Darkling.description: The High Plains of Faridat were visited by a frightening phenomenon that saw lightning bursts fly up from the ground and into the sky. The dwellers there named them "Darkling" strikes and would run indoors when the shocks came. That is, until Professor Olivine discovered a sneaky group of hybrid dragons were the source. The good professor gathered them in DragonVale, where their talents could be used to amaze rather than terrify.

Dark Rift.name: Dark Rift
Dark Rift.description:
What? Another rift dragon? The wizards thought only the first magic would imbue rift eggs, but so much Dark Magic was cast through the rift that a new type of rift dragon was made possible. 
 What? Another rift dragon? The wizards thought only the first magic would imbue rift eggs, but so much Dark Magic was cast through the rift that a new type of rift dragon was made possible.

Venture.name: Venture
Venture.description:
Winter in the Vale is not time for wandering or exploring, unless you're the venture dragon.
This dragon loves to ramble far and wide, searching for rare, forgotten sights and relics.  A big part of the Jolly Jubilee celebration every year is the moment when all the wizards and witches come together to hand out and share the rare items collected by the venture dragon's intrepid travels.
It's said that Nogard's own walking stick is an ancient, powerful artifact brought to him by a venture dragon many years ago.  In fact, many of the head wizards possess items of power found by these brave exploring dragons.  Though not all of the trinkets brought back possess magical properties, each is special in its own right and a prizes possession of whichever witch or wizard it was given to.  The venture dragon is so known for these wondrous gifts it brings, that the some wizards have taken to calling it the "Secret Sandakloz".

Amber.name: Amber
Amber.description: First discovered in the Drakar Forest, the amber dragon is one of the oldest specimens of dragonkind. The amber dragon's skin slowly hardens as the dragon ages, sometimes trapping remnants from the ancient world. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Cupido.name: Cupido
Cupido.description: Love is a strong force in ours and in the dream world, and if any other force comes close to that, it would be the willpower, or rather lack of it, to get out of one's bed after a good night's sleep.  Cupido dragons have come up with a simple solution - bring your bed everywhere with you.  That way you never have to get out of bed to play your role, and what an important role they have!  For it is said that when someone falls in love, they have been blessed by a cupido dragon with a bolt of love.  How sweet!

Bismuth.name: Bismuth
Bismuth.description: The Wizard Dayleeon sought the Fountain of Youth not only to cure the infirmities of old age, but also to banish the constant stomach pains that plagued him. It was eventually discovered that the Fountain's properties only applied to dragons, but Dayleeon found something much more valuable during his adventure: the bismuth dragon. This crystalline dragon's geometric adornments project a soothing aura that can cure the most upset of tummies. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Grace.name: Grace
Grace.description: Elegant swimmers and gentle creatures, the grace dragons can make any pool of water seem serene.  While one head eats, the other keeps a watchful eye.  While one head sleeps, the other stands vigil.  While Tolzar dangles the keys to one of his contraptions, both heads follow as if hypnotized.

Autumn.name: Autumn
Autumn.description: Autumn dragons can be found roaming the Crane Forest. Autumn dragons normally shed prodigiously, which translates into a huge habitat maintenance problem. Thankfully, the alchemist Keats created a magical salve to prevent shedding.

Ikatako.name: Ikatako
Ikatako.description: From the depths of the oceans these dragons swim up to stalk their unsuspecting prey.  Staying submerged beneath the waves, ikatako dragons wait for their moment to strike and... tickle the soles of any unfortunate swimmers with their tentacles.  On land, when they are out of the water for a while they can get a bit squidgy, so whenever they see a barrel of water, they jump right in to keep themselves in shape.  Whatever shape that may be.

Paper.name: Paper
Paper.description: The paper dragon was found on the anniversary of the wizards discovering the magic that makes DragonVale possible. The paper dragon isn't actually made out of paper, but derives its name from its resemblance to paper dragons children make. Your guests are sure to do backflips with one of these in your park.

Ghostly Bone.name: Ghostly Bone
Ghostly Bone.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Bone dragons can only be found for a couple weeks during the year. The rest of the year it is believed that they burrow underground near cemeteries to be around other bones. But I bet if you breed one and put it in a habitat with other bones, it would stick around. Or perhaps near a heat source to keep away the bone-chilling winter cold?

Aurora.name: Aurora
Aurora.description: On a stargazing expedition to the far side of the world, the witch Zoria looked up to the sky one night and it dawned on her that something was very different. What originally appeared to be a wisp of cloud against the night sky very quickly drew into view as an aurora dragon! Though these dragons are a rare observance, they love to show off their luminescent colors to any wizard, witch, and visitor alike!

Lightning Rift.name: Lightning Rift
Lightning Rift.description:
Lightning magic doesn't behave in the Rift as we're used to seeing in the Vale. Rather than conducting through metal, the lightning appears to merely bounce off of everything it encounters. Good news for the lightning rift dragon--no need to worry about crashing into things mid-flight when you bounce right back. 
 Lightning magic doesn't behave in the Rift as we're used to seeing in the Vale. Rather than conducting through metal, the lightning appears to merely bounce off of everything it encounters. Good news for the lightning rift dragon--no need to worry about crashing into things mid-flight when you bounce right back.

Snowball.name: Snowball
Snowball.description:
One day, two little Wizzlings were greatly enjoying the Winter season and the abundance of snow, and they had done everything there was to do: snow angels, snowmen, fortresses, you name it.  The two best friends sat down together to think of what to do next.  One of them had the idea of building their own snow dragon-friend and both jumped with excitement to gather all the twigs, rocks, snow and coal they could get their hands on.  Once it was complete, with a bit of wizardry they animated the snow sculpture and there before them stood their new dragon-friend, who they decided to name Snowball.  With the spell being done by novices, the snow would start melting to slush during the day, but there was plenty of snow around for it to eat and get back into shape at night.

The two best friends sat down together to think of what to do next.  One of them had the idea of building their own snow dragon-friend and both jumped with excitement to gather all the twigs, rocks, snow and coal they could get their hands on.  Once it was complete, with a bit of wizardry they animated the snow sculpture and there before them stood their new dragon-friend, who they decided to name Snowball.  With the spell being done by novices, the snow would start melting to slush during the day, but there was plenty of snow around for it to eat and get back into shape at night.

The two best friends sat down together to think of what to do next.  One of them had the idea of building their own snow dragon-friend and both jumped with excitement to gather all the twigs, rocks, snow and coal they could get their hands on.  Once it was complete, with a bit of wizardry they animated the snow sculpture and there before them stood their new dragon-friend, who they decided to name Snowball.  With the spell being done by novices, the snow would start melting to slush during the day, but there was plenty of snow around for it to eat and get back into shape at night.

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: Wizzlings love stage dragons for their colorful look and friendly demeanor.  Always cheerful greeting and waving to everyone as they pass by.  Even if you are the absolute biggest, baddest and scariest dragon out there, stage dragons will wave hello if you walk by them.  They will even wave if you walk by a second time.  And even the third time.  Okay, maybe waving doesn't actually mean the same thing to them, or they simply forget immediately who they just passed.  Either way, they are perfect candidates for welcoming guests to any event.

Brilliant.name: Brilliant
Brilliant.description: Magicfolk are usually responsible for beautifying the Vale, but brilliant dragons like to share the care. At first, Valers thought their neighbors were responsible for ornate shrubbery sculptures that seemed to appear overnight. This perception was dashed when one teenage witch stayed up late to keep watch over her lawn. Sure enough, a jittery brilliant dragon snuck over and scanned its surroundings for witnesses. When it was clear, the dragon used its unique spikes to shave and shape a large bush. In no time at all, the plant was transofrmed into a statue of a longhaired wizard. The young witch was shocked and muttered "Genius..." under her breath. It's pretty clear how these dragons got their name.

Wisp.name: Wisp
Wisp.description: Even the bravest adventurers are wary of tracking the wisp dragon in its native bogs and fens. These small dragons like to sleep curled up on the luminous balls on their tails. From a distance, wizards and witches hunting swamp gas for their potions often follow the drifting dragons by mistake, finding themselves safe and dry in the woods after a long night's walk.

Grove.name: Grove
Grove.description:
THAT NIGHT
The grove dragon was dragged to the party by its friends. It's not usually a party dragon (despite being very good friends with the party dragon), but after hearing it was an outdoor party, it happily agreed to go. The grove dragon loves nature and being outdoors. It wants everyone to go out and enjoy the beautiful nature, so you'll often see it trying to convince a group of friends to go do something outside or go explore somewhere. It is super chill, wise and connected with its environment. And doesn't take life too fast, so on the way to the party it would constantly stop and smell every flower the group passed by. By the time they reached the beach, the party was over, but the grove dragon was happy - it got to spend all evening surrounded by nature and shared that with its friends.

Amaryllis.name: Amaryllis
Amaryllis.description:
Gardenia's Color Guard: Plant
Noel DePlante knew Kaleni was scouring the soil, Nogard was embroiled in spelunking, Lumi was scanning from the sky, and Whitbee was searching for sunken secrets. So Noel decided to go back to where it all started, Gardenia's fractured island.
He spotted a vibrant mass sticking out from the broken ground. He cast a spell to dissect the rock and what emerged made his jaw drop. A pristine and fully-grown amaryllis dragon levitated in between the two island halves.
Soon, a flood of roses poured out from the hole where the dragon was stuck. They were red, bright red! Against the vast starkness, this was monumental. The amaryllis dragon, with eyes closed, flew in circles and created a vortex that lifted the roses up. Noel acted quickly and cast an entanglement spell that bridged the two halves of the island with vines. It caught the falling roses and carried them safely to solid ground.
The amaryllis dragon flew next to the wizard and laid out its wing to direct Noel's attention to the pile of red roses. On the ground, browns and greens were growing brighter! Noel picked up a few blossoms and threw them around. Everwhere a rose fell, color spread.
The amaryllis dragon, still sightless with eyes shut, gestured to the entire colorless Vale. Noel smiled and conjured a sack made of leaves. He tied it to the dragon's back and filled it with roses. He tore the bottom open and waved to the dragon.
The dragon took off flying around all the islands of the Vale. Roses fell one by one. When they touched the ground, color was restored. Noel watched with glee as his home returned to its natural state: bright and full of energy.
Noel laughed with glee then squinted to see something in the distance. It looked like a green hat with a purple sash atop blonde hair...

Serket.name: Serket
Serket.description:
A baby serket dragon with a rumbling stomach found a robust tree bursting with bright red berries. It was too short to pluck the succulent treat from the branches, even whilst standing up on its hind legs. Since it had not grown wings yet, the hungry hatchling resorted to utilizing its top-heavy tail; the creative creature thumped the stump and looked up. The branches swayed but no fruit fell. THWACK! It took a second try and this time a few rained down. One berry split open and red juice leaked out. It sizzled and disintegrated blades of grass underneath it.
The starving serket dragon licked the volatile berry juice. It grinned with delight and devoured the other felled berries. With a palpable taste for the unreachable treat, the serket baby unleashed a flurry of a tail-strikes. In no time at all, a deluge of fruit came pouring down. The baby tried to gobble it all as fast as it could, but there was too much.
The cascade of poisonous berries rolled down a long hill while the serket dragon ran to keep up with it, snatching up snacks as it ran. In the midst of its unbridled joy, the dragon saw a group of Vale youth playing at the bottom of the hill. The dragon trampled a few berries while it was distracted and saw the corrosive effect once more.
It curled its tail, formed a circle, and rolled faster than it could run. When it came to the bottom, it spun around and opened its mouth as wide as possible. Every berry tumbled down and into its mounth until all were captured. The wizardlings cheered and laughed at the sight of a serket dragon. The baby chewed and swallowed the sudden feast. It turned and smiled at the children but was surprised by a spicy and fiery belch.

Verdigris.name: Verdigris
Verdigris.description: Though bearing the unusual appearance of being rusted, the verdigris dragon is nevertheless quite popular! Its unusual coloring is not rust at all, but rather a scale condition known as Elphabaitis. Don't worry--it's harmless, and doesn't stop this dragon from defying gravity. Fortunately, none of the other dragons seem to mind the verdigris dragon's appearance. No de-greenifying necessary here!

Spring.name: Spring
Spring.description: The wizard Akitu helped form the magical energies in the Seasonal Habitat. When he went out to study his work, he discovered another rare and lively dragon had joined the habitat. Having never seen this breed before, he decided to commemorate the first day of Spring and called it a spring dragon. Akitu is fairly certain they follow patterns of the Northern hemisphere and won't be here forever.

Combustion.name: Combustion
Combustion.description: There's a rumor that the combustion dragon had a heated argument with the air dragon, but that's not confirmed.  A wizard went to its best buddy - the heat dragon - to ask what the combustion dragon is like.  And for an hour, heat couldn't stop explaining how warm and good of a dragon combustion is.  Let's take its word for it, as getting close to any of these dragons is not recommended.

Ghostly Trinket.name: Ghostly Trinket
Ghostly Trinket.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
A longheld wintertime tradition around the Vale is for witches and wizards to gift each other trinket dragon eggs.
Supposedly, the trinket dragon is rumored to have a magical aura that brings good luck when it comes to receiving gifts. The jury is out on whether this dragon really brings good luck, but it certainly brings joy and adorable companionship!

Nosferatu.name: Nosferatu
Nosferatu.description: Originally discovered by the powerful wizard Whitbee, the nosferatu dragon possesses an impressive pair of sweet teeth! However, there is no need to be frightened, as their propensity to bite can be satisfied by dragon treats!

Rosegold.name: Rosegold
Rosegold.description: Metal magic expert Shi Nee is just fascinated by the rosegold dragon's tail and wings. Made of a delicate metal scalework, the twisting tail and whimsical wings are as light as flower petals, allowing the rosegold dragon to soar in style, unencumbered. That explains the wizard saying "I feel as light as a fleet of rosegold dragons!"

Derecho.name: Derecho
Derecho.description: On a crisp and clear day, the ambitious wizard Volell was dreaming up new ideas for island architecture. He looked to the clouds for inspiration and saw one moving at an incredible speed. It was a peculiar sight as he had spent most of his work expanding the Vale further into the skies and had never seen such a thing. He was just about to cast a remedy spell on himself to alleviate what must had been a hallucination hex, but he dropped his wand when the cloud came roaring toward him. It came to a sudden stop right in front of him, and that's when it became clear: this was a derecho dragon getting its kicks from surfing the hight winds. The dragon winked and rocketed off. It continued its thrill-seeking routine as Volell stood there dazed and confused.

Apex.name: Apex
Apex.description:
The apex dragon might not exactly be "Strong and Shining", but it is without a doubt a great addition to the Mountain Sun House.  And that is exactly why it was chosen to represent its house on Camp DragonVale.  It is not as calm as its distant cousin, the mountain dragon, but since it also lives in a very peaceful environment, wizards say it's pretty... chill. 
 The apex dragon might not exactly be "Strong and Shining", but it is without a doubt a great addition to the Mountain Sun House.  And that is exactly why it was chosen to represent it house on Camp DragonVale.  It is not as calm as its distant cousin, the mountain dragon, but since it also lives in a very peaceful environment, wizards say it's pretty... chill.

Cold.name: Cold
Cold.description:
The cold dragon is revered in the northern countries where people will often worship them and offer them food in exchange for protection. Some tribes refer to them as the grandfathers of the North because of the signature fur that grows near the front of their mouths. This is the most intelligent of all the common dragon breeds known. 
 The cold dragon is revered in the northern countries where people will often worship them and offer them food in exchange for protection. Some tribes refer to them as the grandfathers of the North because of the signature fur that grows near the front of their mouths. This is the most intelligent of all the common dragon breeds known.

Oaris.name: Oaris
Oaris.description:
THAT NIGHT
The oaris dragon isn't usually very social, but the night of the party it decided it's time to go to and meet someone special. Wizards tell you that you should never meet your idols, but oaris really wanted to meet the dazzle dragon, who famously overcame its shyness. Oaris was also very shy in nature, very quiet and would prefer to hide behind a tree or stay at home, but the amazing performance that dazzle gave in the Colosseum inspired it to come out of its shell. When it approached dazzle, it saw it talking to razzle and, with its huge ears, overheard them discussing how this party is a little boring. Summoning all it's courage, oaris decided to speak up and suggest we take this party to the next level by givin' it the ol' razzle dazzle treatment. What proceeded can only be described as EPIC. Few hours later, oaris was still covering its head with wings, but was beaming with excitement that the party had livened up again thanks to it speaking up. But let's not burst some dragons' bubbles by telling them they imagined the whole conversation.

Tranquil.name: Tranquil
Tranquil.description: In the quiet and serene expanse of space countless stars exist. Countless more come into existence in the blink of an eye. And in a very time consuming process, they will also leave existence, to be scattered across space after their final phase. With a bit of magical knowhow and a pinch of luck, however, these stars can instead be reborn as proud and majestic tranquil dragons. Attracted by the cosmic and magical energies of the Vale, they have chosen to call it their new home.

Gildamane.name: Gildamane
Gildamane.description:
A cluster of gildamane dragons was growing too large for its cozy valley and needed more wing-room. The oldest and wisest gildamane dragon saw the plight of its community and ventured out to look for more fruitful land. It soared and surveyed for several days until it finally discovered a luscious green oasis.
After the senior's return, it gestured for every gildamane dragon to follow it. When the adults started flying out in droves, the hatchlings crawled at an unbelievably slow pace. The old leader saw the aimless babies and corralled them into a single file. He marched and they followed.
Some magicfolk say they saw this journey take pace, but no one would believe that the wizened old gildamane dragon played leapfrog with a parade of babies.

Crystal.name: Crystal
Crystal.description:
The crystal dragon hoards shiny things. So as long as you don't look too greedy around it, this dragon will be quite content to let you hang around. 
 The crystal dragon hoards shiny things. So as long as you don't look too greedy around it, this dragon will be quite content to let you hang around.

Ignite.name: Ignite
Ignite.description: An ignite dragon is a curious friend that appears to pursue a calling not many would assume. These dragons can be observed observing muse dragons while they are in observance of magicfolk inspiration. With quite a different skillset comprised of fire and lightning magic, these fledgling motivators try their best at helping Valers reach their full potential. Unfortunately, ignite dragons' tactics normally result in a sudden burst of heat and light that startle witches and wizards into action. Maybe someday ignite dragons will learn the power of subtlety, but for now they can't hold a candle to their idols.

Smoke.name: Smoke
Smoke.description: The smoke dragon is a misunderstood beast. The Ancients mistook them for spirits and offered them messages to carry to the Other Side. Unfortunately the only ‘other side’ these creatures cross to is whatever side of the campfire you move to.

Psyche.name: Psyche
Psyche.description:
The Secret of Telepathy
Ellie stood on the island she and Kai summoned and watched the creeping energy consume the perimetre. She gripped her wand tight and closed her eyes. Light pink tendrils appeared around her wand, then her entire body. Ellie was so focused she didn't see the curious psyche dragon floating down above her to catch a closer look. Suddenly, the pink tendrils shot out in all direction and decimated the creeping energy. It also consumed the psyche dragon above her head.
The dragon had instantly transformed into a mesmerizing array of green and white scales with geometric pink flare. It scanned the island intently and spotted a rambunctious armament dragon ignoring a darcowl dragon. The psyche dragon's stare intensified and quicly thereafter, the armament dragon walked off the island's edge. As it fell through the sky, panic took hold of the flightless being... until the psyche dragon flew alongside it.
While they both descended at an incredible rate, they saw the Surface's Glimmerverse come into focus. It was a vast, shimmering expanse filled with crystalline formations, rainbows, glittery meadows, and even more energy leaks. The psyche dragon locked eyes with the armament dragon and they leaned left simultaneously. The non-flying friend curled up into a ball and targeted a crystal ramp below it. The armament dragon hit the ramp and rolled speedily onto solid ground. The psyche dragon caught up with it. As soon as the armament dragon came out of its tucked position, it ran at full speed toward a giant crystal with energy spewing out from its base. CRASH! The behemoth creature demolished it and sealed the leak. It kept pace, trample a field of toadstools, and ran toward another crystal. The psyche dragon floated to several more leaks and the armament dragon sealed each one in succession with deliberate destruction.
The two of them continued until no leak was left in the Glimmerverse. There were few crystals that survived the demolition derby, but order was restored... or at least it appeared so.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform."

Bouldershock.name: Bouldershock
Bouldershock.description: The bouldershock dragon is known for being able to channel latent static energy into the ground. The resulting tremors often follow the dragon's moods and can be pretty potent when the dragon is upset. A moody bouldershock can even trigger small earthquakes on a local scale, so you don't want to miss this dragon's feeding time! After a few close calls with the hatchery, we try to house this dragon well away from any fragile items.

Ghostly Fire.name: Ghostly Fire
Ghostly Fire.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
When you think of dragons, the fierce fire dragon is probably at the forefront of your thoughts. It is true that these beasts get cranky when they get cold. All you have to do is keep them in a warm place and they become as harmless as the ground beneath their feet! Never mind that their feet are typically found above active volcanoes.

Techno.name: Techno
Techno.description: Techno dragons feel a rhythm in nearly everything, including life itself, and following the rhythm of life has brought them to the Vale.  As soon as they heard of the parties that take place here annually, they knew they had to make it over.  Hitching a ride on Whitbee's boat successfully led them here, despite being surrounded by ghouls, monsters and creepy crawlies through the entire trip.  Something tells me they won't be going back home the same way they came.

Ruby.name: Ruby
Ruby.description: The ruby dragon was discovered deep in the Mogok Caves by an old wizard who simply went by the name Mohs. He quickly learned the error of reaching for rubies when they are attached to the tail of a dragon. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Coral.name: Coral
Coral.description: Formations in the shallow areas of the Crimson Sea have always appeared hazardous, so everyone sailed safely around them. Magical treat expert and excellent witch, Jayme the Cook noticed that charts of the regions always contained discrepancies in the shape and location of these formations, so she decided to investigate the phenomenon. Sailing close and examining carefully, she discovered that it was a new type of dragon, the coral dragon.

Bubble.name: Bubble
Bubble.description: Valefolk almost equivocally agree that the bubble dragon is one of the cutest dragons ever discovered. In fact, it's so cute, grown witches and wizards will find themselves helpless to do anything more than babble in baby-talk every time they encounter one of these adorable creatures. There's even a name for the phenomenon: Bubble Babble!

Panlong.name: Panlong
Panlong.description: The majestic panlong dragon originates from the Far East and it's said to only come out of hiding once every twelve years. Though it prefers to be near water, they have occasionally been seen in many other types of habitats. Rumor has it that these dragons are not only a distant cousin of the rainbow dragon, but they're almost as rare too! I wonder if it's a coincidence that they only seem to show up during the year of the dragon.

Inferno.name: Inferno
Inferno.description: Don't have a meltdown if you happen to ignite this dragon's fiery gaze. The inferno dragon might look hot under the collar, but it's actually rather warm-hearted. In fact, fire magic expert Pi Roh once kindled a public campaign to douse the stereotypes engulfing the inferno dragon. "Blaze the trail: visit the inferno dragon!" Initial reception was lukewarm, but visitors' curiosity eventually boiled over.

Frostbite.name: Frostbite
Frostbite.description: Wizards with especially chilly islands all agree the frostbite dragon is the best discovery since the return of the dark dragons. Their peculiar talent for gobbling up massive quantities of snow is what earned them this appreciation and their name.

Libretto.name: Libretto
Libretto.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 4
Meanwhile in the Vale, a crooning chorus walked down a snowy path, giving houses and the families inside a sample of their jolly carols. Their angelic voices rang throughout the town and intrigued a nearby libretto dragon. It peeked and saw the travelling singers, but didn't want to be left out. The curious creature followed the tunes, but stayed a few steps behind to remain unseen. When the group hit a high note, the libretto dragon couldn't restrain its enthusiasm and let out a squawk for the ages. The troop of troubadours spun around hastily to see a bashful dragon wanting to be included. They welcomed it with kind gestures and invited it to join as they kept on spreading cheer...

Summer.name: Summer
Summer.description: While researching seasonal magic in the far off Forests of Farn, the wizard Shamash discovered the summer dragon one evening by tripping over it. Thankfully, the dragon didn't mind or even bother to wake up. Since then, summer dragons have been famed as the hardest sleeping dragons, probably because they are some of the most active dragons during the day!

Ribbon.name: Ribbon
Ribbon.description: From the homework scrolls of the House of the Icy Torrent

Quake.name: Quake
Quake.description:
The regal quake dragon commands respect everywhere it goes. Though its sharp horns and thunderous footsteps instill fear in most everyone nearby, it is one of the most gentle dragons known. Their true intelligence is unknown, but many experts suspect that they could hold their own even against some of the smartest people alive. 
 The regal quake dragon commands respect everywhere it goes. Though its sharp horns and thunderous footsteps instill fear in most everyone nearby, it is one of the most gentle dragons known. Their true intelligence is unknown, but many experts suspect that they could hold their own even against some of the smartest people alive.

Nimbus.name: Nimbus
Nimbus.description: The wizard Pi Roh had a vision of the Nimbus dragon floating on clouds of miasma. Not sure what to make of this, he thought it was simply too amazing to be real. He recorded his dream in a scroll and set it away, forgetting all about the nimbus dragon. Once the rift stabilized, the nimbus dragon reappeared to Pi Roh, this time in person! This dragon loves to float in clouds, and for ages it has called the miasma of the Rift home. Now it can float nimbly around parks everywhere!

Sow.name: Sow
Sow.description: Standing in the field as a boring scarelokilure one day, walking and roaring as a dragon the next.  Sow dragons were made manifest all around the fields of the Vale when the horrors and nightmares of Into the Dark eceded.  With the overwhelming darkness enveloping them, they no longer just stand still, they also instill... fear.  Albeit in their own slightly goofy way.

Earth Rift.name: Earth Rift
Earth Rift.description:
One thing is true of earth dragons and earth rift dragons alike: they're a grounded bunch. The earth dragon's brush with chaotic Rift magic might have changed its appearance, but the old adage still applies. Gwyddion the Great Nogard is heartened by this idea. "Perhaps this means that chaos magic on the Surface below has dissipated to harmless levels, too," he mused to Gardenia. "Someone should go down there and find out!"
