The earth dragon's brush with chaotic Rift magic might have changed its appearance, but the old adage still applies. Gwyddion the Great Nogard is heartened by this idea. "Perhaps this means that chaos magic on the Surface below has dissipated to harmless levels, too," he mused to Gardenia. "Someone should go down there and find out!"

Kampos.name: Kampos
Kampos.description: The kampos dragon invokes a children's tale oft told in the Vale.  According to this legend, a mysterious dragon with tentacled wings and an armored tail would find young witches and wizards lost in the wilds, then ferry them to safety upon its back.  Given the uncanny resemblance to the dragon of legend, Gwyddion decided to call this Rift-brushed dragon "kampos," from the phrase "hippicus kampicus," a term in the old tongue meaning "one who rescues."  Looks like you turned the tables on the legend by rescuing kampos from the wilds of the Rift!

Aubergine.name: Aubergine
Aubergine.description:
Even though aubergine dragons share an ancestral connection with nightshade dragons, they couldn't be more different. Our purple pals have a propensity to plunge prematurely into eruptions of giggles. It's a rare occasion that anyone understands the inspiration for such guffaws. Instead, bystanders try to egg it on for even bigger belly laughs. 
 Even though aubergine dragons share an ancestral connection with nightshade dragons, they couldn't be more different. Our purple pals have a propensity to plunge prematurely into eruptions of giggles. It's a rare occasion that anyone understands the inspiration for such guffaws. Instead, bystanders try to egg it on for even bigger belly laughs.

Promethium.name: Promethium
Promethium.description: The Promethium Dragon re-emerged from the Rift awash with an eerie, buzzing energy. The wizards tried to solve the riddle of what they called 'Rift Fire' but were severely disappointed in the end.

Vidalia.name: Vidalia
Vidalia.description:
There is a dragon that can make you think twice, with nothing more than a look. It may appear this creature has no care to give, but here's a secret, it does. Vidalia dragons, prim and proper, will help you clean up and put your best foot forward. If you're not expecting it, their surprising generosity might even make you cry. 
 There is a dragon that can make you think twice, with nothing more than a look. It may appear this creature has no care to give, but here's a secret, it does. Vidalia dragons, prim and proper, will help you clean up and put your best foot forward. If you're not expecting it, their surprising generosity might even make you cry.

Ire.name: Ire
Ire.description: Contrary to its name and appearance, the ire dragon seems to be one of the friendliest dragons in DragonVale. "Happy as an ire dragon" is a common saying in DragonVale, and is not, in fact, meant to be ironic. Of course, this leads to some confusion for any who are unfamiliar with the ire dragon, but no one ever said idioms are easy.

Khamsin.name: Khamsin
Khamsin.description: Don't let the big grinning teeth and open maw intimidate you, khamsins are real sweethearts.  If puddles in the road are rocking your carriage, they will fill them up gladly.  If the barn needs a new coat of paint, they will sandblast the old one right off.  Very useful these dragons, unless you ask Kairos that is.  With the habit of filling up potholes with sand, whenever they see an hourglass running out, they just have to top it off.  Who knows how many times Kairos has had to reverse time to save his empty hourglasses.  Only he would probably.

Jetstream.name: Jetstream
Jetstream.description: Some Valefolk - the type typically prone to wearing pointy aluminum hats - believe the jetstream dragon plays some sort of role in the infamous Cataclysm Causality conspiracy theory. Of course, that is just a theory silly - the jetstream dragon has no agenda but to snack on Dragon Treats and show off for visitors. ... at least, we're pretty sure that's the case, but it's hard to tell from inside this magical bunker.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: This dragon has a peculiar head. It has been said, from this head, pours the most ridiculous banter. The problem is a meticulous canter can be the downfall of an inane jester, whose primary joy will only fester. Tricks are its mainstay, jokes are plain play. Sprite dragon's head is floating, but don't fret. It won't stray.

Tien.name: Tien
Tien.description: Setting the scene - imagine the most epic (but socially distant) party that has ever happened in the Vale!  Celebrating a DECAde of park owenership called for the most exquisite of party activities that the wizards could think of.  One of them was a giant baby fire dragon piñata, filled with delicious berries and beanstalks, everyone's favorite! Wizards and dragons alike tried to knock it down from the Sakura tree, but to no avail.  Until a large and magnificent dragon, unknown to the magicfolk, approached the piñata and started slashing its sharp wings.  Perhaps, this dragon was a result of a special summoning spell done by a very hungry and impatient wizard.  We might never know its origins, but it surely needed a name. Everyone shifted their attention towards the new elegant and shiny dragon and got to brainstorming a name for it.  "Let's name it Ten, after the anniversary! It also has a ten sign on its chest!" someone shouted.  Another yelled "No it looks like it's made of tin, so let's name it that!"  And so, half the folks started chanting "Ten", the other half "Tin" and they couldn't make up their minds.  Until someone suggested they just combine the two names and name it tien. We leave it up to you to decide though - is it a roman numeral on its chest or just an "X marks the spot" type of situation.

Swiftgrace.name: Swiftgrace
Swiftgrace.description: In the Vale it is common belief that the swiftgrace dragons’ magic comes from within and that it’s magical energies flow through its beautiful wings. Every flap of their wings sends waves of magic echoing through the air and every living thing. These waves are invisible to the naked eye but can be felt by those sensitive to their energies. This makes some of the more pessimistic wizards wonder - is the swiftgrace dragon a very powerful creature or is it just pleasant to look at.

Solar Eclipse.name: Solar Eclipse
Solar Eclipse.description: Many people make the mistake of thinking this dragon is the result of an impossible breeding combination between the sun and moon dragons. Instead, this dragon is born only when celestial bodies align properly. Although a wonder to behold, the wizards do not recommend staring directly at them... something about burning your eyes out?

Ghostly Tree.name: Ghostly Tree
Ghostly Tree.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Few people are comfortable watching a tree flying in the sky, which is perhaps why this hybrid is misunderstood as ancient and unknowable. The older ones have been known to offer a helping hand to those lost in a forest, or a friendly conversation to those wandering alone.

Procyon.name: Procyon
Procyon.description: As Nogard says, you shouldn't judge a star by the brightness of its twinkle. The procyon star isn't the brightest in the skybox and this pale yellow creature is similarly dim, but don't think for a moment that this reflects upon the dragon's intelligence. This sharp-witted dragon eluded discovery for a long time, playing a game of stellar hide-and-seek with the wizards. Now that it's finally been discovered, we're thrilled to have such a bright dragon join us in the Vale!

Rosebud.name: Rosebud
Rosebud.description: The tending wizards and witches of the Cadberry Meadows always knew that the surest sign of spring was the return of the rosebud dragons. A frequent sight at the Cadberry Wells, these dragons helped spread waters from the Vernal Springs over the meadows. The wizards and witches would greet the sight of these dragons by passing along just one word: "rosebud."

Water Rift.name: Water Rift
Water Rift.description:
Does the Rift have oceans? Lakes? Ponds? Streams? Little is known about the geography within the Rift, but if the water rift dragon is any indication, there's bound to be water in there somewhere. Heck, maybe there's a portal in the depths of the Rift's oceans that leads to the Surface waters below the Vale! Maybe keep an eye on this dragon--track its whereabouts, see what it does. You never know, you know? 
 Does the Rift have oceans? Lakes? Ponds? Streams? Little is known about the geography within the Rift, but if the water rift dragon is any indication, there's bound to be water in there somewhere. Heck, maybe there's a portal in the depths of the Rift's oceans that leads to the Surface waters below the Vale! Maybe keep an eye on this dragon--track its whereabouts, see what it does. You never know, you know?

Prism.name: Prism
Prism.description: The Prism Dragon is as rare as it is beautiful. Its dark hide absorbs light and magic alike. Its crystalline spines shine with energy that ranges from a rainbow of colors to pure elemental magic!  Truly a majestic creature, this dragon's mere existence reveals much that is otherwise hidden.

Reindeer.name: Reindeer
Reindeer.description: These hybrid dragons come from the Far North and can only be bred near the end of the year. Centuries ago, the magical toymaker Sandakloz journeyed north to study these rare creatures. He never returned from his journey, but every year since, during the month when reindeer dragons can be bred, children wake up one day to find magical toys in boxes bearing the old mage's signature.

Rhinotorch.name: Rhinotorch
Rhinotorch.description:
A trio of rhinotorch dragons were flying over the Vale when they saw a dust storm sweepting over dry treat frams. They landed near a wizard who stared at the barren fields with a frown. The wizard drew his wand and attempted a rain spell, but the water drops just sizzled and turned to steam as soon as they hit the ground. The three rhinotorch dragons looked at each other. One spotted a gigantic snowbank high atop a nearby mountain and made the other two aware of it.
The three dragons charged up the mountain, ran head first into the wall of snow, and disappeared. Moments later, the snow grew bright red and melted with haste. A raging river formed and flowed down the mountain, straight toward the drought plagued fields. The fresh cold water soaked the dirt and saturated the ground. Instantly, burgeoning buds popped up everywhere. The proud, yet soaked, rhinotorch dragons looked down at their success and simultaneously cooled their searing scales.
They heard a faint voice from below yell, "Thank you!"

Blizzard.name: Blizzard
Blizzard.description: The lost Ice Kings were believed to be responsible for unsavory weather at the top of the Berrywhite Mountains. Turns out it was just Blizzard dragons coughing and sneezing. Their colds have been cured and they are no longer contagious, so feel free to breed some and put them next to the other dragons in your park

Mirror.name: Mirror
Mirror.description: It may take some careful reflection to figure out if the mirror dragon is coming or going, but that didn't stop the wizard Vujade from declaring them to be the fairest dragons of them all.

Arcturian.name: Arcturian
Arcturian.description:
A particularly creative youngster came up with a rhyme to honor the arcturian dragon and it has since become quite popular among young and old alike.
Twinkle, twinkle, little wyrm
Up above the vale you burn
Shooting toward the world so fast
Here you come to stay at last
From your home and down to ours
Little dragon from the star

Mountain.name: Mountain
Mountain.description:
The mountain dragon is a solitary beast, found wandering the frozen highlands to the north. Its long horns and shielded back protect it from, well, everything. Since nothing threatens it, it is one of the calmest dragons around. 
 The mountain dragon is a solitary beast, found wandering the frozen highlands to the north. Its long horns and shielded back protect it from, well, everything. Since nothing threatens it, it is one of the calmest dragons around.

Glass.name: Glass
Glass.description: The oils in the hide of the glass dragon give it a glossy appearance and the mixture of Light and Earth Magic somehow colorizes their horns and wings in spectacular displays of beauty.

Smitten.name: Smitten
Smitten.description: Smitten Dragons are unique in that they form deep bonds with the first person they see after hatching. If you happen to become the target of a smitten dragon's affection, consider yourself lucky! They are among the most lovable, loyal dragons known to wizardkind. Although you'd better get used to a dragon following you around everywhere ( and we mean *everywhere*!) --the smitten dragon won't give you a minute alone, even if you just need to use the little wizard's room.

Steam.name: Steam
Steam.description: From the Scrolls of Pi Roh's Ponderings:

Scuttle.name: Scuttle
Scuttle.description:
Another dragon made manifest after an attempt to conjure an oceanic island in the sky.
The group of wizards and witches responsible for these experiments is believed to be a branch of Icy Torrent.  And while their methods and identity remain unknown, their goal is as clear as ice - bring the beauty of the oceans below, to the skies above.  Regardless, the scuttle dragons are cute and harmless, preferring to scuttle away from any inconveniences they find themselves in.  Curiously, they are one of wizard-chef Ramsee's favorite dragons.

Evergreen.name: Evergreen
Evergreen.description: First found in the forests of Farn, the evergreen dragon is one of the few dragons known to roam in large groups. Coming across them in the wild may be a sight to behold, but beware; evergreen dragons are particularly prickly and properly protective of their progeny.

Lava.name: Lava
Lava.description: The lava dragon was the first to undeniably establish that some dragons use magic to fly. While its wings are more than enough to bring it aloft as a juvenile, they remain the same size throughout its life. This creates a somewhat awkward looking adult appearance that it probably wouldn't enjoy you pointing out.

Void.name: Void
Void.description: Void dragons serve an important purpose in their own pocket of reality, namely, keeping the fabric of time in check. And this very purpose is what has brought these sentinels of time here. Tracking Kairos all the way to the Vale to have him right the wrongs he has done to their cherished timelone. Expecting a fight, the void dragons were pleased to find him in a more than cooperative state. Kairos was already waiting for their arrival and was preparing to help them, he is the Dragon of Time, after all. Some void dragons have remained in the vale since then, serving their new purpose as envoys from the Void. Envoids.

Moriante.name: Moriante
Moriante.description:
A tired moriante dragon was softly snoozing atop a large stone, when a loud thud woke it up. Alarmed by the sound, it decided to get up and have a look at what happened. It went to the edge of the stone and tried to push itself forward and fly away, but it instead leaped to the ground because its whole body was covered in some sort of sticky substance and the wings simply wouldn't move.
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The moriante dragon was taking a calm evening flight when it stumbled upon a circle of astronomancers having a party. They were singing, dancing and celebrating the longest day of the year, surrounded by endless barrels of sugary beanstalk juice. Even though it was getting late, the moriante dragon decided to join in and show everyone how it was done.
A crazy skillful wizard was in the middle of the circle dancing to the music coming from nearby, and that really caught the dragon's attention. The wizard stepped aside to give the moriante dragon a chance...Ever since it's hatched, the moriante dragon is said to be very peaceful and calm, but it adores dancing. But little did they know, due to its chubby appearance, it is not always as graceful as it thinks.
The more interesting movements the dragon made, the more the crowd was applauding. Few minutes into the dancing fiasco though, the dragon tried to gracefully walk towards the public, but tripped on its tail and fell right into the barrels full of juice. Many of them broke under the weight and the whole thing was pouring onto the ground, and soon, everyone was knee deep in beanstalk juice.
PRESENT DAY
The moriante dragon slightly blushed at the state of its body...Few astronomancers were cleaning the mess and carefully collecting the barrels pieces. It swiftly cleaned itself up and jumped to sweep all the wooden pieces together with its wings into a neat pile. While no one was looking, it quietly flew away without looking back, ashamed of last night's clumsy performance.

While no one was looking, it quietly flew away without looking back, ashamed of last night's clumsy performance.

Gatren.name: Gatren
Gatren.description: For a long time Wizards believed the gatren dragons to be very old, long-lived, or perhaps even ancient dragons, who had been slumbering in the cave systems of the vale for years at a time.  The stalagmites on their backs take ages to form and in order for that to happen, they would have had to be standing still for a very long time.  Until one day, a baby gatren emerged from the caves with its very own baby-stalagmite formation.  This opened a whole new can of cave worms for the Wizards.  Do gatren dragons age very slowly in the dark, are these just spinal growths serving as a form of crude camouflage or a mean of communication via echolocation?

Ghostly Lava.name: Ghostly Lava
Ghostly Lava.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The lava dragon was the first to undeniably establish that some dragons use magic to fly. While its wings are more than enough to bring it aloft as a juvenile, they remain the same size throughout its life. This creates a somewhat awkward looking adult appearance that it probably wouldn't enjoy you pointing out.

Poison.name: Poison
Poison.description: The poison dragon loves people. Not for breakfast, it just thinks they're great company. Unfortunately, people don't often react well to their deadly neurotoxin. Best to watch it play with its own kind from a safe distance.

Victory.name: Victory
Victory.description: When the champion cloud-vaulter, Nickee of Same-thrice, found herself vexed by the trials before her, she looked up to a victory dragon for inspiration. This dragon's lauded ability is to inspire a vigorous fervor for great deeds with its aura of vibrant optimism. With this boon, Nickee rose to the challenge and just did it.

Whirlwind.name: Whirlwind
Whirlwind.description: When a whirlwind appears, the basic instinct is to seek shelter.  In times like this, wizards in the past have asked themselves what could be the cause of the terrifying wind.  They traveled far and wide to study this phenomenon and no matter where, and how many different legends they have heard, the name of the whirlwind dragon would always come up.  From stories about unrivaled mayhem and destruction tho the slightest breeze or gust of wind, it was believed that this dragon was the source of it.  There were many speculations about its appearance, as it was the common conception that it appeared only during the apex of the storm.  Few were unfortunate or brave enough to weather such conditions, and they told a different tale.  In the bleakest moment, the whirlwind dragon would always appear and protect the whole Vale from a catastrophe.  All this time, it was not causing havoc, it was defending its home...

Huddle.name: Huddle
Huddle.description: One day a couple of wizards were inspecting the fields and came across a rather curious patch of wheat.  It was growing at an immense speed!  Taller, thicker, it was almost ten feet!  "Curious!" they thought... but didn't seem to mind it a lot!  Surely enough a glorious dragon appeared and even though it was weird, it was not feared!  They named the dragon huddle after the clumsy wizard Duddle.  Apparently he tripped over some rubble, fell into a puddle and in the kerfuffle accidentally enchanted the nearby wheat stubble.

Ironwood.name: Ironwood
Ironwood.description:
Famed Oracle Tessa Lonya was lost in the vast dunes of the Sandara Desert. Tired and without water, she collapsed only to wake up at the edge of an oasis with an ironwood dragon! It's a good thing they're friendly. 
 Famed Oracle Tessa Lonya was lost in the vast dunes of the Sandara Desert. Tired and without water, she collapsed only to wake up at the edge of an oasis with an ironwood dragon! It's a good thing they're friendly.

Pouke.name: Pouke
Pouke.description: Just as the weather starts getting warmer is the perfect time to go to the river meadow and have a lovely picnic or even a camping trip. But if you notice a few items missing or misplaced, do not be afraid. That is simply the doing of the pouke dragon. This mischievous dragon likes to play small pranks on visitors, but that only means that it likes you, and that is its way of showing it.

Seasonal.name: Seasonal
Seasonal.description:
It took the wizards a long time to understand and categorize the seasonal dragon because of its amazing ability to change with the seasons. Although this particular variety seems to follow the patterns of the Northern hemisphere, there are rumours of a cousin on the opposite schedule. 
 It took the wizards a long time to understand and categorize the seasonal dragon because of its amazing ability to change with the seasons. Although this particular variety seems to follow the patterns of the Northern hemisphere, there are rumors of a cousin on the opposite schedule. 
 It took the wizards a long time to understand and categorize the seasonal dragon because of its amazing ability to change with the seasons. Although this particular variety seems to follow the patterns of the Northern hemisphere, there are rumors of a cousin on the opposite schedule. 
 It took the wizards a long time to understand and categorize the seasonal dragon because of its amazing ability to change with the seasons. Although this particular variety seems to follow the patterns of the Northern hemisphere, there are rumors of a cousin on the opposite schedule.

Trick.name: Trick
Trick.description: Captain Admar received a promotion for discovering this weird and wonderful little dragon. As the dragon ages, it gains an extra set of eyes and a bigger... smile. The adult trick dragon's little snout may seem cute and huggable, but be wary. As the good Admiral said, "It's a trick!"

Squall.name: Squall
Squall.description: From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Squall Dragon:

Lodestone.name: Lodestone
Lodestone.description: It's said that the great explorer Jorsten Seabound always sailed with one of these dragons perched on the mast of his ship. With the aid of the lodestone dragon's instinctive guidance, he never lost his way. By their instincts, these dragons have found their way to the Vale!

Prestige.name: Prestige
Prestige.description: No one even saw the prestige dragon walk in or around the circus, but no one questioned its entrance on the stage.  It just looks like it belongs there.  Performing magical tricks and illusions that no dragon should be capable of.  This dragon will leave the audience awestruck and scratching their heads, that's a promise.  In turn, some more observant audience members are starting to question, why are rigel and lightning dragons moving backstage so often.  And if there is just one prestige on stage, or perhaps more?

Hooded.name: Hooded
Hooded.description: The hooded dragon is one of the most misunderstood dragons of the vale. Outwardly fierce in appearance, hooded dragons are actually very protective of the wizards and witches to which they become attached. They're exceptionally good at hugs, maybe a bit too much so, but that certainly doesn't stop the ocassional wizard from trying! We advice admiration from a distance.

Gift.name: Gift
Gift.description: These crafty creatures snuck into the bag of holding of the magical toymaker Sandakloz. After being studied over the holidays,  the wizards have found a way to counteract the singularity magic that prevented more than one existing in the same place at the same time. Clever Wizards!

Obsidian.name: Obsidian
Obsidian.description: Found in the volcanic regions of Wrothmoore, the obsidian dragon's iridescent horns are sure to make it one of your visitors' favorite new dragons!

Sparkles.name: Sparkles
Sparkles.description:
The Secret of Voltage
Lost in the spellform energy clouds, a sparkles dragon flew aimlessly, seeking shelter wherever it could. It heard a loud whirring and the occasional yelp. The dragon flew toward the sound, still hindered by limited visibility. It broke through a cloud and saw a spellform outrider dragon caught in a looping flight pattern. The sparkles dragon squinted, arched its shoulders, and sped toward the victim in the wind. It cut through cloud after cloud until it pierced the last one in between it and the outrider dragon. ZAP! A bright bolt of lightning struck the sparkles dragon while energy encased it.
The sparkles dragon went limp and plummeted. The passing air ruffled its fur and tossed its limbs. It was feet away from the hard ground when it suddenly stopped falling. Its body levitated and righted itself. When its arms tensed, blue lightning emanated from its talons. Now, with smoky gray scales and untamed electricity seeping out, the dragon's eyes popped open. It focused on the split mountain spewing purple energy so bright and constant, that it looked like a sun.
The sparkles dragon flew straight to the mountain and charged its entired body. Jagged blue arcs grew and grew, creating and electric aura. When it became three times as big as the dragon, it unleashed the high voltage ball at the split mountain. It collided with the rocky mass and instantly shattered. The Surface formation crumbled on itself and the bright purple energy leak definitively ceased.
The outrider dragon was still circling as if nothing happened, until the sparkles dragon joined it and flew alongside. The outrider dragon broke its daze and looked at the powerful dragon next to it. They both looked at the collapsed mountain. The outrider dragon slowly came to a stop, slumped over, and heavily exhaled. The sparkles dragon gave it gentle pat on the back with its tail.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

The Surface formation crumbled on itself and the bright purple energy leak definitively ceased.
The outrider dragon was still circling as if nothing happened, until the sparkles dragon joined it and flew alongside. The outrider dragon broke its daze and looked at the powerful dragon next to it. They both looked at the collapsed mountain. The outrider dragon slowly came to a stop, slumped over, and heavily exhaled. The sparkles dragon gave it gentle pat on the back with its tail.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Spellform.

Portent.name: Portent
Portent.description: The portent dragon was first discovered by a party of eight adventurers, and is said to be a sign of important things to come. Lured out of hiding by the party's palpable love for dragons, the portent dragon is considered something of a mascot for extreme dragon enthusiasts!

Emerald.name: Emerald
Emerald.description: Should you be lucky enough to breed an emerald dragon, you may notice they're imbued with a special magic from the Shimmering Isles. Small but powerful, the emerald dragon magically generates gems...making it, and other gemstone dragons, the most sought after dragons in all the land. Emerald dragons originate from the crystal forests hidden within the Sedna Mountains. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Neyvee.name: Neyvee
Neyvee.description: These dragons are perfectly built for fishing, with their hydrodynamic bodies, as well as flippers and tiny wings to help them maneuver and propel themselves through the water.  Neyvee dragons can catch hundreds of fish together, and there are very few other fisherman or anglers that can compete with them in the open waters.  On land there aren't as many fish as you can imagine, so there their mobility is not as essential and is limited to bouncing on their bellies and attempts to lift themselves off the ground with their tiny wings.  But they likely do that just to get to the last few fallen crumbs of dragon fruit cake that are stuck under them.

Spritely.name: Spritely
Spritely.description: These spry, cuddly, and inquisitive dragons are known for their natural affinity towards creative wizards and witches. Spritely dragons were originally discovered when famous dragon artist Bob Ploss was planting a grove of Happy Trees. From a nearby grove, he saw a group of spritely dragons staring at him inquisitively. Not to be outdone in curiosity, he immediately set to painting them. From then on, spritely dragons have been a mainstay to creative wizards and witches everywhere.

Mud.name: Mud
Mud.description: Mud dragons love to eat. Second only to eating, mud dragons love to play around in muck. They are so often covered in mud that you rarely ever see their natural skin color. Of course, you wouldn't be able to tell if you were seeing their natural skin color or not, since it looks an awful lot like mud.

Magnetic.name: Magnetic
Magnetic.description: When the magnetic dragon was discovered it was completely by accident. A young adventurer wearing plate mail was riding their horse near the Pliny Foothills when they were suddenly yanked off and sent flying towards the dragon! Luckily, neither the adventurer nor the dragon were harmed, and we've been able to find a way to lessen the magnetic dragon's powerful effect on metal objects. But don't worry, it's sure to still attract visitors!

Squish.name: Squish
Squish.description: Every wizard-farmer's favorite little helper.  Squish dragons are always there to rake the soil and lovingly look after the crops their wizard friends have sown, especially the pumpkin patches, they love those.  No one know exactly why that is, but some speculate it's because pumpkins remind them of themselves and their kin.  Others assume squish dragons just like eating lots of squash, to the point where the dragons themselves start resembling them.  Just don't feed them pumpkins after midnight.

Porcelain.name: Porcelain
Porcelain.description:
Bone dragons are a mainstay of the Vale and have been revered for years, but one wizard loved them so much that he developed a spell to manifest this idolization. The wizard was named Feldspar and his cosmetic conjuration was a success! A plated sheen with ornate designs coated a willing bone dragon volunteer and transfigured it into a porcelain dragon. Both wizard and dragon were delighted with the outcome. When asked about altering a dragon in such a cavalier and mischievous fashion, Feldspar's eyes glazed over with boredom.
*Collect and place 10 unique Ornaments to perform the ritual with a bone dragon.

Vibe.name: Vibe
Vibe.description:
As the sun rose, a vibe dragon sauntered across the vacant Dragon Dance Floor. It spotted a sizeable scorch mark on the edge and tapped its foot on top, presumably to see if it was dangerous...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The vibe dragon walked near the dance floor and could hear infectious beats. There were too many witches and wizards around to get a good look, so it climbed to the top of a canopy. From there, it could see two dragons stamping around to the rhythm. As the sun set, the dancers receded into darkness... until the vibe dragon's pulsing style activated.
The dance floor exploded with an intricate pattern, basking the dancers in a soft orange glow. The dancing dragons gleefully roared. The vibe dragon's head started nodding to the beat as it directed the light show with its entired body.
High above, a sparkles dragon noticed the illuminated display and landed right next to the vibe dragon. The newcomer started bobbing its head in unison with the vibe dragon. Lightning spread across the sky and yellow flashed down on the dancers. The lightning increased, creating a vibrant and choreographed light show that amplified the scene with electrified hype.
Suddenly, a bolt of lightning touched down on the edge of the dance floor. The lights stopped and the dragons froze. The vibe dragon looked at its lighting partner and shook its head. The vibe dragon started its style up again and the party continued.
PRESENT DAY
The vibe dragon glazed over the scorch with intense breath magic then wiped it clean with its tail. With the floor being properly mended, it looked like nothing ever happened.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Hydra.name: Hydra
Hydra.description: Hydra dragons are extremely picky eaters. Since no two heads can agree on what to eat at a given time, it's a wonder they finish a meal at all! Fortunately, the wizards have learned to provide them with a buffet at mealtimes, so each head gets to eat what it wants!

Ghostly Moss.name: Ghostly Moss
Ghostly Moss.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The unusual two legged moss dragon is truly one of nature's marvels. Capable of living in the harsh extremes of the desert, it is also found wandering through forested regions. This beast wanders the world blind and happy as an adult.

Valor.name: Valor
Valor.description: From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Valor Dragon:

Subterranean.name: Subterranean
Subterranean.description: Behold the burrowing subterranean dragon! Unlike dragons that take to the skies, this dragon prefers a much more grounded lifestyle. You can thank Earth Magic expert T. Erra for the discovery. Everyone thought him silly for his endless digging through the Vale's rocky nooks and crannies. "We won't know what's down there until we dig!" a dirt-covered T. Erra insisted to the Board of Magical Priorities when making his case for a full-time team of Valefolk skilled in excavation spells. He sure surprised everyone when he uncovered a trail of tunnels leading to the subterranean dragon!

Radiant.name: Radiant
Radiant.description: While no wizard has dared to measure the internal temperature of the Radiant Dragon, judging from the copious amount of heat radiating from this dragon's fins, it must be formidable. Some clever witches have enticed them to thaw remote snowed-in villages.

Lazuli.name: Lazuli
Lazuli.description: Playful and good-natured, these magnificent dragons are seen as an omen of good fortune by many sailors. The lazuli dragons would often follow ships out at sea for a while, either to feed their curiosity, or to make sure the sailors are safe before diving or flying out of sight. It is also said that feeding them a bit of fish salami as a treat brings even better fortune.

Woodvine.name: Woodvine
Woodvine.description: While on the seemingly endless quest to fight boredom, the wizard Loracles decided to try out his thumbs in gardening.  Secluded away in his tower he spent every waking hour going through countless scrolls and graphs, detailing the mystical Nipong art of dragonsai.  Having gone through the texts more times than there are stairs in his tower, he was ready to tackle this newfound hobby.  Now all that was left was to wait for the dragonsai trees to sprout and grow.  As the days went on and his anticipation grew, it was clear he was losing the battle against boredom.  He knew he would either have to speed this up somehow or buy already grown dragonsai plants, and where is the fun in that?  Quickly he sprung into action, concocting a potion that would hasten the plant's growth.  He poured the first potion's contents into the pot and waited in silence to see what would happen.  He was shocked to see that absolutely nothing happened.  Frustrated by this failure, he tried again and again, potion after potion until the pot was overflowing with all kinds of chemicals, but sadly nothing seemed to work.  Having exhausted himself and all of his options, he decided to hit the sack.  The next morning he was met with a rude awakening as his tower as teeming with small bouncing tree-like critters.  Worried they would devour his newly sprouted plants, he stormed to the workshop only to find that these critters are the plants themselves, come to life as woodvine dragons.

Fever.name: Fever
Fever.description: No one knows what climate fever dragons prefer. They appear to shiver in hot, balmy conditions and seem to sweat in chilly environments. It's taken Valers a long time to understand that these dragons aren't suffering in the slightest. They merely have an idiosyncratic tic that is triggered by temperature. It's possible that's why these dragons were named after a sporadic ailment of magicfolk.

Busby.name: Busby
Busby.description:
Busby dragons are known for their constructive directive, but a particular colony was suffering from destructive motive. They were building a new home to house their whole community, but every adult wanted to create their own section single-wingedly. This spread chaos and confusion until the entire project was in disarray.
One baby busby dragon witnessed the breakdown and waddled into the middle of the mess. It started humming a tune and dancing. Every adult dragon stopped and stared at the energetic hatchling. One, two, then a few, started dancing; before long they were all in sync. The baby busby dragon orchestrated them to work together in perfect harmony, all the while dancing. In no time at all, their new home was finished and fantastic.

Fire Rift.name: Fire Rift
Fire Rift.description:
What a dragon! Gwyddion the Great Nogard theorizes that the fire rift dragon was once an ordinary fire dragon who encountered chaos magic from the Rift. Fortunately, the potency of this chaos magic seems to be on the low end; the only effects so far have been decorative. Maybe keep a eye on this li'l fella, though, lest it develop... other... Rift qualities. 
 What a dragon! Gwyddion the Great Nogard theorizes that the fire rift dragon was once an ordinary fire dragon who encountered chaos magic from the Rift. Fortunately, the potency of this chaos magic seems to be on the low end; the only effects so far have been decorative. Maybe keep a eye on this li'l fella, though, lest it develop... other... Rift qualities.

Teozinte.name: Teozinte
Teozinte.description: Every so often the teozinte dragon sheds its scales, which are then gathered and strung into necklaces, or sewn onto wizard robes. It's all the rage to have discarded teozinte scales on your robes during the Om of Noms, although some say the outfits do look pretty corny.

Osteryx.name: Osteryx
Osteryx.description: Dragons of a feather, flock together... unless they're osteryx dragons.. These silly, soaring scavengers are crazy about stunts. With all their quirks and quickness, it would actually be dangerous if they attempted to fly in this formation. If you observe this zany display, be sure to applaud: silent gawkers really ruffle their scales.

Dargon.name: Dargon
Dargon.description:
Dragon dragons, uhm I mean dARgon dragons are very special.  They seem all sweet and cute, but they're no joke.  Seriously, get close and see for yourself. 
 Dragon dragons, uhm I mean dARgon dragons are very special.  They seem all sweet and cute, but they're no joke.  Seriously, get close and see for yourself.

Ghostly Plant.name: Ghostly Plant
Ghostly Plant.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
People will love to come see your plant dragons play in their beautiful green habitat. They are the friendliest of all the dragon breeds and make great pets!

Quicksilver.name: Quicksilver
Quicksilver.description: The quicksilver dragon has a mercurial personality, often going from playful to pugnacious for no apparent reason. Despite their great bulk, they are deft swimmers -- although most of the time they float at the surface waiting for their next meal to swim by. While tending a Water Habitat, a 'log' turned out to be a hungry Quicksilver Hatchling and a young wizard inadvertently invented a "Run on Water" spell.

Shimmer.name: Shimmer
Shimmer.description: With the return of Light Magic, the sailors of the island kingdoms of the Crimson Sea have a new reason to rejoice; Shimmer dragons have been observed bursting from the sea with their dazzling wings and guiding ships safely out of the paths of storms.

Thrasher.name: Thrasher
Thrasher.description: From toco to sandstorm, the Vale has no shortage of draconic music enthusiasts. However, some musical trends take longer to catch on than others. The thrasher dragons use the sharp edges of their wings to create a shrill, metallic melody. Though older witches and wizards don't care for it, it's gained quite a following among the young ones, who say they appreciate its 'edginess'.

Solis.name: Solis
Solis.description: It is unclear how the solis dragon influences the Vale, but it is definitely the star of the show. Wizards and witches from distant places have tried to study it and figure out why it is so bright on the inside, but never found out as looking at it for too long makes your eyes water. Some theories claim that the solis dragon is responsible for the wonderful climate and weather in the Vale. Others speculate that someone gave it special magical potions that are very dangerous mixed together, but thanks to hydrostatic equilibrium it is safe to be around. So many wild theories, but no one ever considered that maybe it was just very hungry and swallowed a giant glowing ball.

Maw.name: Maw
Maw.description: Superstitious Valers believe these dragons to be ancient deities of feasts and prosperity, while others just see them as rampant gluttons.  So when you hear a knock on your door on Halloween, you best hope it's not a maw dragon, one handful of candy is never enough for their insatiable appetite.  With their monstrous mouths and massive teeth, they can gnaw through buckets of candy without a care in the world.  Some valers have gone as far as to have special containers next to their doorstep just for that - buckets of candy for this scenario labeled with the text "Break in case of maw dragons!".

Atramento.name: Atramento
Atramento.description:
The Motto of the House of the Hidden Bolt is "Sparking Curiosity".  And atramento looks like a curious dragon, don't you think?  So curious that it went on an adventure to another dimension or used its brilliant hiding skills to win some games of hide and seek.  Either or, we don't really know, but if asked maybe it will share its tail.  Um, tale. 
 The Motto of the House of the Hidden Bolt is "Sparking Curiosity".  And atramento looks like a curious dragon, don't you think?  So curious that it went on an adventure to another dimension or used its brilliant hiding skills to win some games of hide and seek.  Either or, we don't really know, but if asked maybe it will share its tail.  Um, tale.

Ironwrought.name: Ironwrought
Ironwrought.description: What a pinnacle of strength! The wizard Fe Brinell first discovered the ironwrought dragon when he witnessed it pull a prodigious patch of pumpermelons out of the ground in one sweeping mouthful! And talk about a timely discovery--what better dragon to be found on the 6th anniversary of the opening of the Vale's parks than one of such might? A park proprietor like yourself knows just houw much care and effort goes into maintaining your fleet of floating islands and the dragons who call them home. The ironwrought dragon is a strong symbol of that mettle, wouldn't you say? Rally carries a weight!

Moss.name: Moss
Moss.description: The unusual two legged moss dragon is truly one of nature's marvels. Capable of living in the harsh extremes of the desert, it is also found wandering through forested regions. This beast wanders the world blind and happy as an adult.

Dittoglide.name: Dittoglide
Dittoglide.description:
Zoom! An adult dittoglide dragon zipped across the surface of a river with its clear reflection creating an illusion of a tandem stunt show. It did loops, barrel rolls, and even flat spins. A group of baby dittoglide dragons caught sight of the fascinating flight and meandered closer and closer to the river. The adult was oblivious to the enraptured audience and continued its routine.
The babies hopped on a log that stretched out into the river for the best seats possible. As they sat hypnotized, the log dislodged and floated away from the river bank. The babies all squealed with fright. The adult dittoglide dragon lost focus and fell from the sky. It looked around and saw the log floating quickly downstream. It lowered its head and rocketed toward the helpless hatchlings. The adult looked ahead and saw sharp rocks that were bound to tip the log over. The dragon sped ahead, looking for a solution. It saw piles of dead leaves on the river banks and flew in circles faster and faster until a cyclone formed. The adult dittoglide dragon drew the wind and leaves over the river and stopped. The cyclone ceased and the leaves dropped into the water, forming a padded dam in front of the hazard.
The log gently hit the makeshift blockade and the babies stayed safely aboard. They all sighed and one by one, waddled off the log to solid ground.

Garden.name: Garden
Garden.description: Gardenia has an affinity for the garden dragon - then again, it's quite hard not to be fond of a this green cutie, especially when it shares part of your name!

Bone.name: Bone
Bone.description: Bone dragons can only be found for a couple weeks during the year. The rest of the year it is believed that they burrow underground near cemeteries to be around other bones. But I bet if you breed one and put it in a habitat with other bones, it would stick around. Or perhaps near a heat source to keep away the bone-chilling winter cold?

Pepper.name: Pepper
Pepper.description: Pepper dragons are feisty creatures. They are one of the few dragons known to actively engage in a staring contest with lightning dragons. Once, a young apprentice, Cheelei, was bored with studying lava so she instead traveled to the western shores in order to examine pepper dragons in their natural setting. She silently observed them until a sudden fit of sneezing blew her cover.

Vipera.name: Vipera
Vipera.description: The vipera dragon appears untrustworthy, but looks can be deceiving. Many wizards often tend to stay away from it, but not because of its appearance. However, it is actually very sweet and kind in nature, little spicy sometimes and veeeery very clingy. It will give you a peck on the cheek if you dare to get close enough, and soon after it uses “clinch location” to find you for more snuggles, just like its predecessors. Vipera kisses and best wishes to everyone in the Vale!

Muse.name: Muse
Muse.description:
"Sing, O' muse dragon, and move my quill!"
Often, a scribe struggling to find the perfect way to describe a dragon will call out a little chant in honor of the muse dragon. Legend has it that the muse dragon is a font of inspiration for all creators and that its three heads represent the pillars of the Arts: talent, practice and learning. Others say that the heads represent the three tools of creation: mind, body and magic. Whatever the truth may be, the muse dragon has earned its fame. This dragon's breath is an invigorating melody of pure motivation guaranteed to clear any creative blocks.

Quaa.name: Quaa
Quaa.description: Quaa dragons mean well and are of kind nature, but this did not stop them from quickly becoming a menace to the Wizards of the Vale.  What qualifies them as a nuisance you ask?  Well, whether Valers are having a quality time quilling on their porches, or napping wrapped in a cozy quilts, quaas have trouble staying quiet.  It's a good thing they aren't quadrupedal, for their stomping would be quite quaking.  It is hard to quantify the times they have been shooed away, it might be in the quadrillions, but they just don't quit.  Wanna hear the most annoying sound in the Vale?  QUAA!

Air.name: Air
Air.description:
Air dragons spend almost their entire lives in the air -- eating, playing and even sleeping without ever touching the ground. It is rare indeed that anyone ever gets to view this dragon up close. Wizards have confirmed that this dragon is the result of breeding fire and water dragons. 
 Air dragons spend almost their entire lives in the air -- eating, playing and even sleeping without ever touching the ground. It is rare indeed that anyone ever gets to view this dragon up close. Wizards have confirmed that this dragon is the result of breeding fire and water dragons.

Seaweed.name: Seaweed
Seaweed.description: The seaweed dragon is very concerned with its appearance. This dragon is not only social but it craves attention from anyone. For some reason, the only creature it doesn't get along with is the occasional other seaweed dragon.

Snowy Gold.name: Snowy Gold
Snowy Gold.description: Every few years, when conditions are just right, wizards and witches from all across the world climb Mount Oly for a festival of competitions. It was during the downhill free form flying races that Snowy Olympus Dragons were first sighted. Swift and agile, these dragons make the best wizards look like amateurs. Gold Snowys are champions, even among their own kind.

Moonstruck.name: Moonstruck
Moonstruck.description: Easily entranced by wonder and beauty, the Moonstruck dragon often stands for days staring longingly into the magical moons of the Moon Habitats, or flying gracefully around them. You will not meet a more affectionate dragon, nor one more attached, as this one. One must take care that these dragons remember to eat and rest, as they live in a state of blissful preoccupation.

Berry.name: Berry
Berry.description: While tending shrubberies one day, the young witch Nee found a young berry dragon playing. She fed it some dragon treats and was amazed when the berry dragon changed colors! Kindly by nature, these berry dragons not only love dragon treats, but love to show off their colors to all the visitors of your park!

Ghostly Kringle.name: Ghostly Kringle
Ghostly Kringle.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The story of one of the first encounters between dragons and wizards is believed to have involved the kringle dragon:
A long time ago, in ancient times past
Arose a fierce storm with winds that did lash.
From inside the storm there came a deep moan
That frightened all folk, from small to full grown.
The moan did continue all through the night
Even when the storm passed come early morn's light.
A brave soul did leave the warmth of his home
To see what could make that sad, lonesome groan.
It didn't take long, there up in a tree
A dragon was stuck, struggling to be free.
Fetching a tool from his wagon,
The wizard quickly released the dragon.
And the dragon was freed, so it is said,
That dragon became the wizard's best friend.
And thus is the tale, or so I've been told,
Of how kringle dragons came in from the cold.

Begonia.name: Begonia
Begonia.description:
Gardenia's Color Guard: Cold
Lumi sped over hilltops and around trees on a dangerously fast ice sled. This normally brought joy to the pint-sized witch, but she was dedicated to the search of her dear friend. She heard a fiery blast in the distance and turned to locate the source of the sound. CRASH! Her ice sled collided with a frozen patch of begonias and sent her flying headfirst into a snow bank.
When she pulled herself out, a baby begonia dragon charged toward her with the widest grin. The baby dragon tackled her and pushed her completely through the snow bank. It licked her face incessantly until Lumi was a cacophony of laughter and tickled gibberish.
They were so enamored with their instant bond, they chased each other, played hide and seek, and cuddled in the cold. The begonia dragon smelled food in Lumi's pocket and jabbed its nose in, unabashedly searching for the snack. Lumi writhed with giggles until her wand fell to the ground. It landed on ice, glowed, and projected a hologram of Gardenia decorating for the Gathering of Roses.
Lumi and the baby begonia dragon stopped playing and watched. The baby dragon saw Lumi's smile fade to a frown. While Lumi got lost in her grief once more, the baby dragon continued to rummage through Lumi's pockets. Lumi was not amused, but soon saw the dragon pull out a star pod treat. It gobbled it down and instantly grew into a juvenile.
The begonia dragon lowered its wing, which was now three times as big, and beckoned Lumi to climb on. She did and they continued their search from the sky with proud proficiency.

Watch.name: Watch
Watch.description: Watch dragons rarely sleep. Instead, these alert guardians look after parks night and day. We're not quite sure what they need to protect us from, but their tenacity and courage are admirable.

Lichen.name: Lichen
Lichen.description: Lichen dragons can be found on the highest mountain peaks and furthest polar reaches throughout the world. Our wizards say that the unique substance growing on them is some sort of strange plant that feeds the dragons using sunlight. Or something. I didn't really understand it myself. Oh and be sure not to confuse lichen dragons with any other kind of supernatural beings, they've been known to take offense to that.

Peoni.name: Peoni
Peoni.description: The peoni dragons are likely distant relatives of the giddles, and they also love to play tricks on other dragons and Valers.  They take a deep breath and jump in the water, letting the beautiful peony-like blossom on their backs float above them.  When anyone or anything comes near to have a whiff of the innocent looking flower, they suddenly jump out, giving them a good scare.  Most of the time, however, they give themselves away by having fits of laughter from the anticipation, sending bubbles to the water's surface.

Ignis.name: Ignis
Ignis.description: We all know the motto of the House of the Blazing Gale: "Unscorched, Untethered, Untroubled" and how the blazing gale dragon is usually unbothered by Pi Roh's poor attempts for a beautiful firework shows.  Unbothered, but loves to crash and over-shine them.  Well, did you know that ignis dragon was the one to fire up blazing gale's desire to show off like this?  So, which one was the first to come - blazing gale or ignis?  Or was it the egg or the chicken?  We can't remember...

Platinum.name: Platinum
Platinum.description: While exploring a cave, deep in the middle of the Berrywhite Mountains, the explorer Antonio von Sickengen discovered a third treasure dragon; the platinum. After achieving his fame with the platinum dragon, Antonio retired to a quiet life raising and studying quicksilver dragons.

Iceberg.name: Iceberg
Iceberg.description: A deft swimmer and an excellent dancer, this recently discovered rare cousin of the ice dragon has a horn made entirely of pure ice.

Epoch.name: Epoch
Epoch.description: In a feat of nigh unheard-of magic, the epoch dragon ages backward, hatching as a full-grown adult and aging (or is it de-aging?) to a little dragonling. There are numerous expert theories as to how this unusual magic works. Some say Kairos sneezed on the first epoch egg and these dragons have been aging backward ever since. Others say that tendrils of the Cataclysm's chaotic energy found their way into an epoch dragon's nest and reversed the flow of time. No one really knows! Everyone can agree, however, that this dragon is as adorable as it is interesting

Trove.name: Trove
Trove.description: The bane of any crew - the stowaway. These dragons would often sneak into ships and hide in some dim corner or cubbyhole. Sometimes sitting in the most awkward and contorted positions for hours, even days, just waiting for the unwitting host crew to set sail to find their next treasure trove. As soon as the dragon caught a whiff of gold, no matter how far it was buried under the sand, it would scurry out of its hiding spot and make a mad dash to the treasure, long before the crew have even had a chance to react, let alone disembark. If they don't get caught beforehand that is, in which case they are often jettisoned from the ship or fired from the cannons as punishment. The trove dragon doesn't seem to care, there are always more ships in the sea.

Viridian.name: Viridian
Viridian.description: We wizards are just as surprised as you might be by the viridian dragon.  Little is known about what happens in the rift, though the Valefolk are working night and day to understand exactly how its chaotic magics work.  So far, the viridian dragon seems to be pretty normal---it's not terrorizing villages or nominee townspeople, which is always nice when it comes to dragons from other dimensions.  Interestingly, the viridian dragon's back appears to be covered in armor-like scales.    Perhaps the viridian evolved to withstand debris storms within the Rift---or maybe it just likes to look cool for its Rift friends.  There's so much to learn about these dragons!

Sunstruck.name: Sunstruck
Sunstruck.description: The sunstruck dragon is happiest when surfing across some righteous sand dunes. In fact, it needs little else to stay happy. Wizards summarize this dragon's lackadaisical lifestyle in three words; sandsurfing, mondo treats, and primo naps. Gnarly.

Metal.name: Metal
Metal.description:
For years explorers were afraid to enter the Tull Caverns because of the loud noises that could be heard coming from deep below. It's only thanks to the brave Dickinson Osborne that we now know that these sounds come from the metal dragon's unique behavior of "drumming" precious metals with their heavy tails. 
 For years explorers were afraid to enter the Tull Caverns because of the loud noises that could be heard coming from deep below. It's only thanks to the brave Dickinson Osborne that we now know that these sounds come from the metal dragon's unique behavior of "drumming" precious metals with their heavy tails.

Quintessence.name: Quintessence
Quintessence.description:
Dragons in the Vale, necessary for true balance. Their inherent magic, dormant at a quick glance.
But this is merely a misunderstanding; powers are used in moments of need  notwithstanding. Valefolk can be overt and garish, when sorcery is used to solve problems. But the first known quintessence dragon quelled a 500-year storm in perform and fantastic fashion:
The storm brought wicked winds, torrential rain, hellacious hail, and violent lightning. It caused chaos and panic amongst the witches and wizards. The Vale was fraught with disaster... until a quintessence dragon descended from the sky, with wings fully spread in total glory.
 It saw fires sparked by lightning strikes and unleashed water breath magic to extinguish the rampant flames. It saw magicfolk slipping into floods and roared with earth magic to raise the ground underneath the afflicted. Using the power of plant magic, the quintessence dragon conjured a path of leaves for Valers to follow to safety. Once they were all gathered in a single safe zone, the dragon shouted louder than any living creature ever had. Metal sheets emerged from the ground and surrounded the Valefolk to protect them from fierce winds. Then, with a final touch, the quintessence dragon spat a tiny fireball down to ignite a campfire. The witches and wizards kept warm and protected while the storm passed.
This is why quintessence dragons are so revered and pampered; not just as repayment for the Vale's survival, but to keep them close for the next tempest... should one arrive.

Loot.name: Loot
Loot.description: Gleaming crystals, glimmering coins, sparkling jewels - the loot dragon is drawn to every sort of shiny bauble. Most precious of all to this dragon, however, are gems. Folks were a little worried about letting a dragon toss a powerful magic gem around, so the wizards designed a special, magic-free gem just for this dragon. All the fun of a magic gem, with none of the explosive mishaps.

Lotus.name: Lotus
Lotus.description: Legend has it that Sidd Arthur, a privileged nobleman turn wandering wizard, once rested under the wings of a lotus dragon. Upon awakening, Sidd was famished. Having no food, he attempted to transmute some local wild flowers into a snack. Sadly, the result was unpalatable. To his surprise, though, the lotus dragon snapped them up! Thus, Dragon Snaps were invented!

Quartz.name: Quartz
Quartz.description: The quartz dragon is just adorable. Valefolk find its crystalline wings so enticing, they've started conjuring witch- and wizard-sized replicas to wear as fashion accessories. Unfortunately, no one thought of a spell to sand down the pointy ends, creating quite the painful fashion faux pas for anyone standing behind the wing wearer. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Dark.name: Dark
Dark.description: Torn from our world long ago, Dark Dragons have returned to herald true balance to magic. Due to their lack of excellent eyesight they often get very close to... everything. Their fierce loyalty and companionship have made them quick favorites of many members of the wizarding community.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description: What dragons may come, when we have shuffled off this vale's veil, and worked magic while we slumbered? Well, it seems Young Witch Feiljean fell asleep practicing at her spells one night, but kept right on casting. In fact, others watched in wonder as the slumbering apprentice worked magic more powerful than all but a few have ever seen! When the night was over, most of the magic had faded away, but the great, strange dragons that had appeared that night remained. They are beautiful but elusive creatures, and tend to vanish quickly if you approach them directly.

Bastion.name: Bastion
Bastion.description:
The Secret of Inspiration
While the other eight spellform dragons were witnessing the birth of a fury dragon on the Surface, the lone darcowl dragon in the Vale was combating increasingly hostile energy alongside Kai and Ellie. More and more kids started casting spells to push back the purple fog. Even the dragons without enhancements rose to the occasion and used their magic breath to bolster the unified defense.
Just then, the fury dragon rose high above the Vale and proudly floated with a scowling observance of the chaos. It smirked. The Surface energy walloped the darcowl dragon and sent it into a stupor. Ellie ran to check on it as Kai fired suppressing spells to keep her safe from the onslaught. The fury dragon's smirk faded when all it could see was children and dragons fighting an endless battle. Another wave of energy hit the darcowl dragon and it tumbled off the island's edge. The fury dragon rocketed straight down toward the helpless being. The darcowl dragon vanished below and energy cloud and the fury dragon followed it blindly.
High above the Surface, the group of spellform dragons flew up while the non-flyers hitched a ride. They were looking for the furious one, when two dragons burst through a cloud above them and colloded with the group. A bright light exploded from the epicenter of the collision.
As the light faded, a new dragon appeared. Its bright blue wings and staggering aura magically held the stunned dragons in mid-air. Much like the fury dragon was created from raw rebellion, the bastion dragon was created from pure hope. The bastion dragon flew up to the safety of the Vale and gently descended with the dazed dragons still in tow. As they landed, the immaculate force emanating from the bastion dragon quelled all of the Surface energy. The purple fog faded, and a clear blue sky framed the rising sun for dawn to grace the Vale once again.
The petrified House Witches and Wizards broke free from the spell and witnessed other adult magicfolk appearing from thin air. Nogard looked around and saw a boy jumping for joy, "Young one. What happened here?"
The young boy said, "My name's Donlo, Mr. Nogard sir. The dragons did it! They saved the Vale!"
Nogard looked over and saw the newly pink-maned fury dragon stand up in the middle of the spellform dragons. The group closed in on the fury dragon and huddled together, resting their heads and wings on each other. The bastion dragon enveloped them all with its brilliant wings. Kai and Ellie watched and smiled as the warmth of sunlight spread.
*This dragon must be level 4 of higher to wear a Spellform.

Pond.name: Pond
Pond.description:
More than one wizard has sat by a pond dragon and thought it just an ordinary pond--imagine the surprise when that pond flew away! Even in a land as magical as the Vale, that's just something you don't see every day. 
 More than one wizard has sat by a pond dragon and thought it just an ordinary pond--imagine the surprise when that pond flew away! Even in a land as magical as the Vale, that's just something you don't see every day.

Daylily.name: Daylily
Daylily.description: If beauty and grace were to become a living creature, they still wouldn't compare to the daylily dragon.  Don't let its calm demeanor fool you though - this dragon has a touch of spice.  And like its namesake, it doesn't really look like a dragon.  But definitely is one.  Trust us - we are Dragon specialists.  We know best.

Leaf.name: Leaf
Leaf.description: Leaf dragons are famous for their uncanny ability to blend into their surroundings. Novice caretakers are frequently flummoxed by the sudden "disappearance" of their leaf dragons. More experienced wizards bring along a peppermill and lightly season the bushes in a habitat until they hear a sneeze!

Chitin.name: Chitin
Chitin.description: A parched baby chitin dragon once wandered through the wilderness searching for a puddle of water. It heard a drip, drip, drip, licked its lips, and spun around. The purple dragon saw nothing except for low hanging tree branches and vines. DRIP! The dragon heard it again, but this time it saw a shimmer of water beyond the vines. There was a small cave housing a fresh rain puddle, still dripping from a storm. The baby chitin dragon sprinted toward the vines, hoping to break through and enjoy a cool drink. Instead, it tripped, rolled into a ball, and sailed right through the cave and out the other side. It landed in a mud puddle and was covered in muck. It shrugged and took a huge sludgy slurp.

Xanthium.name: Xanthium
Xanthium.description:
The young students of the Vale favor a game comprised of throwing zazzberries at cacti-snacks. If a zazzberry sticks on a thorn of the cacti-snack, the thrower shouts, "Spike!" and all other contestants must run a lap around the target. This was a light-hearted game until one day...
A group of students spotted, nestled in a large bush, the biggest cacti-snack they'd ever seen. They immediately started playing and threw a volley of zazzberries at the target. "Spike!", said one boy and the rest ran torward the gigantic cacti-snack. As they rounded the thorny fruit, a rumbling snort bellowed out of the supposed dragontreat.The youth screamed in horror and ran. Two eyes popped open and the spiky treat jumped up. It was in fact a slumbering xanthium dragon! After being unexpectedly roused, it turned toward the fleeing students and roared.
The spiker stood still and watched as the sour dragon, spotted with zazzberry spalts, tried to shake off the impaled fruit from its back. The boy slowly approached it with his hand outstretched. The xanthium dragon locked eyes on him but didn't move. The boy managed to get close enough and plucked the zazzberry off. He held it out for the dragon to eat and the xanthium dragon snatched it up with a quick snap of its tongue. The dragon smirked and rolled over for a belly rub. The boy gave it a pat and signaled to his friends to come over and join.
Xanthium dragons can be quite prickly if they feel disrespected, but if you try to smooth things over, they'll show a softer side.

Silverline.name: Silverline
Silverline.description: Silverline dragons have a remarkable knack for looking on the bright side. This perspective is obvious when they seek out their favorite snack, a dark purple berry with juice sweeter than anything in the Vale. It doesn't even have a name because magicfolk dare not venture into the thorny thicket that guards the fruit. When silverline dragons emerge from a foraging feast, they're covered in spines. A good shake usually jostles most free, but the ones stuck in the tail are stubborn. These dragons don't mind and use it as a comb for grooming their scaled coats back into a pristine condition.

Morphimagus.name: Morphimagus
Morphimagus.description:
In the vast and expansive libraries of the Vale, it is easy to misplace or lose something if you're not careful. Some apprentices even manage to get lost themselves in the many weaving and overlapping corridors and floors. This is where morphimagus dragons come in. These kind but shy creatures, who prefer not to be the center of attention, wander the libraries and assist the senior wizards with maintaining and arranging the unimaginable number books and tomes. It is when apprentice wizards look and snoop around that the dragons' stage fright-or-flight instincts kick in, taking the form of something inconspicuous. Who would find a wizard's hat to be out of place in a library full of wizards?

Some apprentices even manage to get lost themselves in the many weaving and overlapping corridors and floors. This is where morphimagus dragons come in. These kind but shy creatures, who prefer not to be the center of attention, wander the libraries and assist the senior wizards with maintaining and arranging the unimaginable number books and tomes. It is when apprentice wizards look and snoop around that the dragons' stage fright-or-flight instincts kick in, taking the form of something inconspicuous. Who would find a wizard's hat to be out of place in a library full of wizards?

Bronze.name: Bronze
Bronze.description: Bronze dragons are extremely playful. The toymaker Lerner has spent years trying to create a toy strong enough for bronze dragons. Unfortunately, park owners report that none of the toys have lasted more than 10 minutes. Back to the drawing board.

Fissure.name: Fissure
Fissure.description: Nestled deep within Laki Chasm is a cave. Within that cave is a lake. And at the bottom of that lake is yet another cave. And within that cave at the bottom of the lake in the cave is yet *another* lake. And–-well, you get the idea. It goes on for quite a while. Such is the perilous path to reach the home of the fissure dragon, deep in the earthen core of the chasm. The only wizard up for the journey wasn't a wizard at all, but a witch named Penny Syll ("Pen" for short). As it turns out, she was just trying to find a quiet place to do some spellwriting–-wasn't even trying to discover a dragon. What luck!

Cyclone.name: Cyclone
Cyclone.description: Valefolk thought they were in for a second Cataclysm when a series of terrible tornadoes tore through the skies of Witchitoto Plains. Worried the destruction would reach inhabitated villages, a band of brave witches and wizards gathered to investigate. Lead by volunteer Dorothea Wynd, the group made for the plains and set to studying the unusual cyclonic phenomenon. As they observed, they discovered this was no ordinary cyclone, but a cyclone dragon! The poor creature was dazzled by a hypnotic dragon, and had been stuck tornadoing through Witchitoto ever since. Thankfully, a simple right-round spell gave the cyclone dragon control of its movement again. What a whirlwind adventure!

Gamma.name: Gamma
Gamma.description: The origin of the gamma dragon, as told by the wizard Kirbixblee, starts with a particularly monstrous lightning strike to a banner flying atop the ancient Ferrigneaux Academy. A never before seen magical reaction occurred and these once tiny and gentle dragons exploded out into the greater world, suddenly huge and green.

Mine.name: Mine
Mine.description: One of the oldest known dragon types, the mine dragon spends much of its time deep underground in the cold Dramoria Mines. Because they are often seen running into walls while moving about, it was once thought that they felt their way around using their beards. We now know that they just have really poor eyesight.

Misfortune.name: Misfortune
Misfortune.description:
Stub your toe? Must be a misfortune dragon. Lost your favorite crystal. Misfortune dragon. The misfortune dragon has been blamed for a lot of wizard oopsies over the years, and quite unduly! In fact, this nocturnal dragon is so rarely seen that many wizards and witches miss out on the opportunity altogether. Naturally, this means rumors of misfortune over the years.
Plus everybody knows that lightning dragons are actually responsible for everything and anything going amiss.

Triple Leap Year.name: Triple Leap Year
Triple Leap Year.description:
All good things come in threes - three-course meals, three little kittens, triple cheeseburgers, live laugh love signs and of course - three-headed dragons.  Because three heads are better than two!
Let's celebrate our third leap year together with the mesmerizing triple leap year dragon.  Because the third time is the charm, right?

Melancholy.name: Melancholy
Melancholy.description: Despite its name, the melancholy dragon isn't actually gloomy -- instead, this droopy-looking dragon seems to be more like a sadness-soaking sponge. Visitors claim that spending time with this dragon actually seems to lift their spirits, as if the melancholy dragon absorbs their troubles. In fact, it's not uncommon for magical healers to prescribe an afternoon with this adorably mopey dragon to cure a case of blue-hoos. Whether it works or not, the gloomy dragon doesn't seem to mind the company.

Fluffles.name: Fluffles
Fluffles.description: These dragons give off immense cuteness and cuddliness, that surprisingly isn't lost when they grow up.  Wizards and wizzlings alike can barely resist hugging them on sight.  Just be careful not to get any of your hair stuck on them, that would be rather unfortunate.

Forest.name: Forest
Forest.description: Often seen stomping around with moss dragons, the forest dragon is a particularly social creature. Similar to the evergreen dragon, you will often find forest dragons frolicking in groups.

Sailback.name: Sailback
Sailback.description:
A snoring sailback dragon slept belly up on the sand of a paradise habitat. Small waves crept in and splashded its head. Its eyes slowly opened and blinked to get the water out. The sailback dragon sluggishly rolled over and stood up, stretching its back and tail as far as it could. A heavy groan escaped its mouth.
As the sound of waves grew louder, the dragon's jaw dropped...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The sailback dragon was decked out in its glowing style and performed dazzling acrobatics in the middle of a sea of tiki torches. A magicfolk audience changed, "Sailback! Sailback!" The dragon caught sight of a pile of blushrooms, danced over to it, and dove in headfirst. It ate the lot and emerged with a face splattered in blue.
The crowd cheered. A nearby armament dragon observed the spectacle and chuckled. The sailback dragon ran around to make sure everyone could see its blue face before it jumped into the water.
While the exuberant dragon was in midair, someone shouted, "You can't swim!" Panic hit the sailback dragon's face before it belly-flopped in deep water...
PRESENT DAY
The sailback dragon stared at the water and slowly backed up. It stepped in a shallow puddle and yelped. The dragon scampered away and didn't look back.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Garnet.name: Garnet
Garnet.description: First discovered in several inlets of the Shimmering Isles, Garnet dragons were initially believed unsuitable for parks because of their abrasive attitudes. Fortunately, the witch Amalthea showed how to properly tame and care for these beautiful creatures. Ever since, wizards have found these dragons to be a blast! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Kaiju.name: Kaiju
Kaiju.description: The kaiju dragon is the strongest known dragon in all the vale. Witnesses swear they've seen a pack of kaiju dragons pulling entire mountain ranges in their wake, just as casually as you might pull a cart of robes. The larger mystery is what the kaiju dragons intend to do with an entire mountain range.

Binky.name: Binky
Binky.description: Always there to liven up the party and brighten up the mood, binky dragons are often invited to wizzling birthday parties.  You may have to get a spare birthday cake, because it may end being juggled and gobbled up along with its orbs.  They think they are very cheeky and nobody sees them do it, but it's just that wizards let it slide, they've earned it.  Give their flower a whiff, I dare you.

Bloatato.name: Bloatato
Bloatato.description:
Bloatato dragons can be somewhat oblivious, but don't assume they just sit around. There was once a sweating, hot bloatato dragon that was approximately four hops away from a shimmering puddle. It sat there staring at it for maybe an hour, yet it never made one wiggle toward the water. Then, with one swift action, it spread its scrawny wings and feverishly flapped. It made the short journey, stopped flying, and plummeted down into the puddle. Some say the dragon was so hot it sizzled as soon as it dropped.
