It sat there staring at it for maybe an hour, yet it never made one wiggle toward the water. Then, with one swift action, it spread its scrawny wings and feverishly flapped. It made the short journey, stopped flying, and plummeted down into the puddle. Some say the dragon was so hot it sizzled as soon as it dropped.

Turquoise.name: Turquoise
Turquoise.description: Turquoise dragons inhabit the arid Khorasan region of the Shimmering Isles and are the oldest known gemstone dragons. Fun fact, despite their dry climate, their skin is the smoothest of all the dragons. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Lagoon.name: Lagoon
Lagoon.description: The lagoon dragon was thought to be a myth for nearly a century. Witches and wizards reported seeing a mysterious "something" floating serenely in the lakes of the Vale Highlands, but their claims were dismissed as hoax-mongering when the strongest of revealing spells returned neither scale nor tail. Finally, an adventurous wizard known as Neddard Hill had the wits to lure the mysterious something with a trail of floating treats. Lo and behold, the lagoon dragon came om-nom-noming its way into view. Even shy dragon can't resist treats!

Twinkle.name: Twinkle
Twinkle.description: The highlight of numerous Vinturfjordian winter carols, the twinkle dragon has seriously impressive set of wings. They shimmer and glimmer with such festive spirit, you can't help but sing its praises-literally! As folk croon in Vinturfjord, "Just see that dragon twinkling, shining and a'sparkling too! Come on, it's lovely weather for a snow flight together with you!"

Surprise.name: Surprise
Surprise.description: Surprise dragons are notorious for appearing when you least expect them, although there's always a good possibility for one sneaking up on you when you're carrying something. Valefolk still talk about the time when a surprise dragon startled Ma' Goody while carrying a basket of dragon treats. Dragon treats EVERYWHERE. But the surprise dragon was more than happy to help with eatup -- uh, cleanup, that is.

Stoneheart.name: Stoneheart
Stoneheart.description: The story of the stoneheart dragon it a bit of gloomy tale. So it's told, the wizard Mort Encha was obsessed with creating the perfect potion to win the affections of his unrequited love interest. One day, a wand misfire caused several vials of failed potions to shatter. The amalgam of potions seeped through the dirt floor of Mort's hut and into the soil of his treat farm next door. Soon after, a wandering stoneheart dragon stopped to snack on Mort's potion-powered pumpermellon plants. Fortunately, aside from a harmless case of stonescale, the dragon was unharmed. Still, Mort felt so guilty about the accident that he never touched a drop of love potion again, and thus, sadly, he was never united with his true love. Valefolk say the stoneheart dragon's seemingly sad expression is an ode to poor ol' Mort.

Ghostly Oni.name: Ghostly Oni
Ghostly Oni.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Oni dragons may look like they can live in any stark environment, but in actuality they love a comfortable den made of found objects around the Vale. Leaves, scraps of yarn, and even discarded Valefolk clothing are ideal for their makeshift bedding. Gwyddion the Great Nogard claims to have seen on lash out during this odd ritual. The oni dragon was diligently crafting its sleeping quarters when tree branches whirled in from a westward wind and decimated the dragon's hard work. The oni dragon drew its club-tail back and with one fell swoop, shattered them into a thousand pieces. It is rumored that the oni dragon smirked and started over again.

Malachite.name: Malachite
Malachite.description: Centuries ago Professor Bixby was traveling to the Scar of the World for research when he discovered something that he never thought possible -- a malachite dragon! It didn't take long for the Professor to find out that these dragons relish in smashing things into puny little pieces. Bixby's notes say something about not making them angry...we wouldn't like them when they're angry. Luckily the wizards were at least able to find a way to keep malachite dragons from destroying the park.

Swamp.name: Swamp
Swamp.description: The swamp dragon is the master of its domain, though not at all territorial. A truly strange breed, but one that teaches you something new every time you study it.

Sandscale.name: Sandscale
Sandscale.description: If you're taking a stroll on a beach, keep watch for sandscale dragons soaking up the sun. If you accidentally step on an outstretched wing, those dragons will let you know you've crossed a line. Their reaction is no more than a startling grunt but it has rubbed  a few wizards the wrong way. Even though sandscale dragons don't hold grudges, some Valefolk still claim they are a little rough around the edges.

Snowsquall.name: Snowsquall
Snowsquall.description:
Dragons in the Rift have developed strange and unusual features to deal with the Rift's wonky wibbles and wobbles. Coping with this chaos magic seems to have led to the sprouting of tentacles on the snowsquall dragon's face. Some folk might be inclined to say, "Ew," but that's awfully rude. You might sprout tentacles, too, if you spent long enough in the Rift! 
 Dragons in the Rift have developed strange and unusual features to deal with the Rift's wonky wibbles and wobbles. Coping with this chaos magic seems to have led to the sprouting of tentacles on the snowsquall dragon's face. Some folk might be inclined to say, "Ew," but that's awfully rude. You might sprout tentacles, too, if you spent long enough in the Rift!

Dandelion.name: Dandelion
Dandelion.description:
From the scrolls of the poet Hy Koo:
Fluffy wisps and wings
Breeze-floating dandelions
Dreaming of blushrooms

Smolder.name: Smolder
Smolder.description: You, uh, might want to warn your visitors to extinguish their wands before approaching the smolder dragon. Of course, no dragon would ever want ever intentionally set off a wand backfire -- just a safety precaution.

Mistletoe.name: Mistletoe
Mistletoe.description: Mistletoe dragons are a mischievous lot and the subject of many a myth. Some people believe they bring luck, some people believe they bring love, others still believe they can end conflict simply by being near. The only thing we know for certain is they love to take Tree Dragon treats when they aren't looking.

Chorister.name: Chorister
Chorister.description: A merry looking dragon, sometimes seen, or rather, heard singing the soothing song of its species.  And with the winter magic's return, this has become an even more regular sight.  Almost like the dragon has felt it and wants to spread joy to all those around.  The wizard Noel adores the chorister dragons for their singing, if only he could capture it in a bottle or record it somehow.  Oh, and a fun fact for you: a group of flying chorister dragons is called a choir.

Scourge.name: Scourge
Scourge.description:
The Hunt is Plagued
Kaleni came running back to the Magical Mystery Team after witnessing the charlatan dragon chase down the Eldritch. "Guys, this is getting serious---," but before he could finish his sentiment, they all witnessed a sharp black beak poke through the blue portal. A scourge dragon with yellow eyes and sallow fur awkwardly flew into the Vale and touched down in front of Whitbee. The wizard pointed to the charlatan dragon's path. The scourge dragon twitched and craned its head sideways. With a muted guttural shriek, it hobbled away on hoof.
Nogard cut the tension, "I think we should follow this one together." The team exchanged glances and nodded in agreement.
"No way!" Kaleni blurted. "After what I saw, I'm staying right here." Moony-Loo nuzzled up against the frightened wizard and Kaleni gave him a pat on the head. Nogard conceded but instructed Kaleni to send up a signal flare spell at the first sign of trouble.
As the team followed the scourge dragon, they saw treat farm crops wilt and dry out almost instantly. Gardenia gasped so loudly that the scourge dragon snapped around to look behind it. Lumi cast a camouflage spell around the crew just in time. The scourge dragon continued. Gardenia, on the other hand, huffed and started slinging regrowth spells at the wake of withered crops.
Alone in a glade, the eldritch dragon stared at its tail and hind legs covered in a charlatan shroud. It looked up to see the trees all around it shrivel and dry. The grass turned brown and quickly encircled the eldritch dragon. As the unknown magic was inches away from the dragon, it flew up and out of harm's way.
Just outside the forest, Lumi pointed up at the eldritch dragon flying out of the spreading danger. The scourge dragon rose up and flew over the escapee. Their wings touched and the eldritch dragon saw a grayness spread. Its wings wilted and resembled those of the scourge dragon.
Just then, a bright, red flare shot high in the sky.

Elysium.name: Elysium
Elysium.description: If you climb Mount Oly, up past Competitions Ridge, up even higher than the clouds, you will find the peak: Elysium. There, wizened wizards and witches can set down their wands and reflect on their long, magical lives. It is there that the Elysium dragon wanders, spreading auras of calm introspection and remembered dreams.

Marbletail.name: Marbletail
Marbletail.description: Famed Vale artist and inventor Kassan once tried to enlist the help of a marbletail dragon with a new painting technique inspired by the dragon's aptly named tail. Unfortunately, marbletail dragons aren't exactly helpful studio assistants -- the final result was less marbled and more just paint splattered on a canvas. Maybe this dragon is more of a pollocktail at heart.

Bearded.name: Bearded
Bearded.description: Named by the Wizard Pogona, bearded dragons are named for the spikes protruding from their jaws. They can often be found lazing about, basking in the sun. Due to their solitary nature, they've often been mischaracterized as grumpy, but the reality couldn't be further from the truth. Bearded dragons take great interest in training younger dragons making sure they stay in line

Heat.name: Heat
Heat.description: The blue gossamer wings of the heat dragon emanate a magical warmth sure to please any and all visitors to your park.

Burrow.name: Burrow
Burrow.description: Armed with a keen sense of smell, a light source of their own and most importantly an affinity towards anything earthly, burrow dragons often... burrow to forage for food or dig out curious stones, crystals and minerals. This set of skills is often utilized by the scouts to help save wizards and dragons stuck in cave-ins. Any precious rocks they find along the way they just keep for their collections.

Snapper.name: Snapper
Snapper.description: Some believe the snapper dragon is at the center of an unusual legend about the origin of the world. So it's told, the Surface land from whence the Vale islands were carved rests on the back of a giant shelled dragon. And that dragon, too, rests on the back of another shelled dragon. And what do you know--that dragon, in turn, rests on the back of yet *another* shelled dragon. And what, you ask, does that dragon teeter atop? Why, it's shelled dragons all the way down! So the legend goes, anyway.

Mountain Sun.name: Mountain Sun
Mountain Sun.description: The motto of the House of the Mountain Sun takes its inspiration from the mountain sun dragon, and for obvious reasons. Have you ever seen a jaw so chiseled or a coat of scales so luminous? Pure magnificence!

Cotton.name: Cotton
Cotton.description: Coinciding with the anniversary of the magic that makes DragonVale possible is the arrival of cotton dragons. The magical fibers that the cotton dragons shed during this time is actually what the wizards and witches of DragonVale make their robes out of. The touch, the feel of magic... cotton.

Eridanian.name: Eridanian
Eridanian.description: Nobody is certain about what lies in the core of a star, but the eridanian dragon may be the closest we'll ever get. Noel DePlante thinks it's possible that the first dragons of this kind were formed in the sputtering embers of stars that burned out and fell to the ground. Perhaps this little one is giving us a glimpse into the beginning of time itself.

Astraline.name: Astraline
Astraline.description: With the way to the dreamland open, a group of dragons fueled by curiosity ventured into the realm of dreams, to see what all the fuss was about.  Soon they emerged happy and cheerful, seemingly floating weightlessly around, as if still in a dream.  It seems as if they absorbed some of the dream's mysterious properties but did not get enough time to practice.  This brings a slew of questions regarding the dreamland.  Does time there flow at the same rate as here?  Is there even such a concept as time there?  What do those who dream in the land of dreams dream of?  No one is brave enough to go and document their experience, but one can dream.

Angler.name: Angler
Angler.description: The angler dragons are most active during the early hours of the day, when there is little to no noise and nuisances, and as a result they have remained largely undiscovered by the Wizards of the Vale, who like to sleep in a few extra hours. They use their hooked tails to catch fish, even in the cold of winter they saw holes through the thick ice sheet, allowing them to continue fishing. The dragons will move away from their fishing spot as soon as someone approaches them, not because they are scared, but because the noise of their uninvited visitor will likely scare away any potential catch.

Scoria.name: Scoria
Scoria.description: Near the Mines of Dramoria, the Bessemer Wastes are home to the often overlooked scoria dragons. They are so overlooked, in fact, that our wizards accidentally classified them as the wrong type of dragon. Ooops. In their later years, scoria dragons grow rocklike scales on their back, but don't let their appearance fool you; they're still fast as can be when racing other dragons.

Nox.name: Nox
Nox.description: Gwyddion's Field Notes on Dragons of the Rift: "I am the first of the Wizards to bare witness to this paradoxical specimen. This dragon grows horns from a very early age, probably to stop it from floating away, as many things in the Rift have a tendency to do. Its body appears to be made up entirely of some sort of Rift energy, as it frequently disappears into what can be described as a self-made portal, which likely leads to an unidentified location somewhere else in the Rift. Need to study this.. nox dragon further"

Iden.name: Iden
Iden.description:
The Haunted Harvest really takes off!
After the last portal breach, the Wizards decided to still keep it open but to install barricades around the perimeter of the portal.  That way they would be able to see what comes in and decide on whether or not to let it stay.  The portal started sparkling again and everyone was there this day, aiming their wands at the portal and waiting in bated breath to see what would make its way through.  The dragon that came in was white and fluffy, almost like it was riding in on a cloud or pillow of feathers.  It had a quick look around and simply flew over the barricade the Wizards had prepared for its arrival and escaped.  All that hard work and anticipation just to have it fly over them.  The other two dragons that had arrived either made no attempt to fly away or simply couldn't, no one saw this coming.  Gardenia had had enough of Whitbee's portal bafoonery, threw her wand at him and stormed out.  Later that day she found where the new arrival went after making its escape, straight to the other two of course.  They were all playing and jumping together cheerfully, this put a smile on Gardenia's face.  In a sigh of relief she thought maybe it wouldn't be so bad having them around for Harvest... as long as the sun never goes down again.  Who knows what the new dragon has hidden in store for them for when night falls, hence the name - iden.

Who knows what the new dragon has hidden in store for them for when night falls, hence the name - iden.

Davinese.name: Davinese
Davinese.description: Always coming up with new gadgets and inventions, Tolzar's well of innovations eventually ran dry, so he sought out to find new inspirations.  While taking a stroll through the Vale, many new ideas came to his mind.  Some were nice, but some were stale, so they were left behind.  Only one idea would stay, when he saw a group of dragons play.  A bunch of davinese dragons were having tons of fun with another group, jumping around and running about, but could not follow their friends high in the sky, to hang out with those that could fly.  Tolzar immediately got busy and fashioned a harness, one with wings that gave them flight.  He watched with joy as the davinese dragons joined the others in the clouds, flying far out of sight.

Salamander.name: Salamander
Salamander.description: Salamander dragons love to sleep in old logs. Sometimes when they snore, their breath catches the logs on fire. Luckily, their watery skin protects them and the bed of ashes is comfortable enough that their slumber is never disturbed.

Brizoni.name: Brizoni
Brizoni.description: Feeling right at home beneath that stone, brizoni dragons pick, shape and carry boulders from a very early age. Smoothing and evening them out over time. When the dragons grow, so must their boulder, making the process of picking and shaping start over again. It's not clear why they do this but some have even learned to balance themselves on their boulders. When brizoni dragons play, they always carry their team to victory.

Lycan.name: Lycan
Lycan.description:
Shortly after the first lycan dragon was brought to DragonVale, the park caretakers were stumped by a creepy conundrum. Every night, a whole batch of treats would go missing. Nobody suspected this scrawny dragon of such ravenous behavior... until they watched it at night. Do you know where we get the expression 'hungry like the lycan dragon'? Come by after sunset, if you dare, and then you'll see. 
 Shortly after the first lycan dragon was brought to DragonVale, the park caretakers were stumped by a creepy conundrum. Every night, a whole batch of treats would go missing. Nobody suspected this scrawny dragon of such ravenous behavior... until they watched it at night. Do you know where we get the expression 'hungry like the lycan dragon'? Come by after sunset, if you dare, and then you'll see.

Bounteous.name: Bounteous
Bounteous.description: When the harvest yields the most, bounteous dragons are always near. Witches and wizards constantly try to conjure new spells to deter these unabashed crop connoisseurs. Little do they know, these dragons are not selfish. These caring creatures are in fact making sure the hatchlings have more than enough to eat. Some bounteous dragons keep bringing treats after the babies grow into juveniles... sometimes even into adulthood.

Delight.name: Delight
Delight.description: Yay, it's the delight dragon! Look at how happy it looks! That happiness is infectious! Literally infectious! Any who visit the delight dragon just can't stop smiling, laughing, and writing with overzealous exclamation points! It's actually something of a problem, but everyone is just too darn happy to care! Three cheers for the delight dragon!

Honeyglow.name: Honeyglow
Honeyglow.description: While Gardenia was wandering the Thousand Acre Woods one spring afternoon, she spotted what appeared to be a dragon tail sticking out of a hole in a tree. Curious, Gardenia tugged on the tail... and out tumbled a honeyglow dragon! The dragon had been snacking on sweet tree nectar, and had grown so plump from its omnomnomming, it was having trouble wiggling back out of the tree. How very fortunate that Gardenia came to the rescue of this rumbly-tumblied dragon!

Flower.name: Flower
Flower.description: The bright flower dragon is a favorite among dragon hobbyists. Though they sometimes get carried away, they aren't really dangerous. Just remember that they only bite because they think it's playing. It's important to train them not to bite before they get too big.

Fireflight.name: Fireflight
Fireflight.description: Mornings are majestic for magicfolk who awake at dawn. Even at night their wings don't rest. Their involuntary behavior forms a makeshift tent to protect the creatures from rain and snow, but the prolonged formation llifts them into the air by sunrise. They serenely float along until gentle breezes rouse the dragons and they descend to start their day. Early risers in the Vale boast the beauty of this daily ritual but jealous friends say they're full of hot.

Topaz.name: Topaz
Topaz.description: On the edge of the Shimmering Isles, in the Crimson Sea, one of smaller, more mysterious islands is home to the topaz dragons. Due to their isolation, topaz dragons are a bit shy, but eventually they warm up and are one of the friendliest dragons in existence. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Jet.name: Jet
Jet.description: The jet dragon was first discovered shortly after the Cataclysm. The wizard Lignius found a smooth, black stone amid the pulverized trees near the Scar. That stone turned out to be a jet dragon egg! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Andromedan.name: Andromedan
Andromedan.description: From the moment of birth, both individuals in an andromedan dragon pair are drawn together by a mysterious force. It's even been demonstrated that feeding treats to one will somehow nourish the other. This has led some astronomancers to question whether the pair can truly be considered individuals or whether they are really the same entity. We'll leave the speculation to the astronomancers, we just think this dragon is really awesome.

Darcowl.name: Darcowl
Darcowl.description:
The Secret of Stealth
A piece of rock whizzed through the sky and slammed into another. BANG! Another collided, then another; each one with a structure on top. One building's sign swung violently from the commotion and it read, "Bizarre Bazaar". A darcowl dragon peeked out from behind the building and looked around with wide eyes.
Ellie walked by and the darcowl dragon darted back behind the building. It waited for her to pass then slinked out to observe more of this new environment.
SQUISH. The darcowl dragon lifted its foreleg and saw smoky, purple fog clinging to it like goo. It tried to shake it off but instead it spread back to its tail and up to its head. Instantly, the dragon changed forms and blended in with a nearby shrubbery.
Ellie walked by again and the dragon stood as still as possible. Ellie kept walking without pause. The darcowl dragon looked at itself and saw more purple fog seeping up and over the edge of the island. It ran to the edge, clung to the ground, and peered off into the distance. It couldn't see anything except a sea of purple fog. It crept down onto the spire, close to the clouds, and poked its head through.
Four distinct and massive plumes of purple fog billowed up from the Surface. Lightning strikes blasted throughout the sky. The darcowl dragon's eyes glazed over and its mouth fell agape.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to equip Spellform pieces.

Dazzle.name: Dazzle
Dazzle.description:
In the middle of an empty Colosseum, a dazzle dragon slept atop a bed of flowers and confetti.  It grunted and kicked its feet as if it were immersed in an intense dream...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
Outside the Colosseum, Zola gave a pep talk to the dazzle dragon as it ineffectively hid behind a tree.  “Just give ‘em an act with lots of flash”, she said.  Just then, a razzle dragon hurriedly escorted an elder earth dragon out of a heated contest.  The dazzle dragon’s eyes darted from the massive arena to Zola.
Zola paused, then snapped her fingers.  Shiny black bangles, spikes, and shoulder pads appeared on the dragon.  Zola rubbed her chin while observing the outfit then twitched her nose.  A sleek pair of sunglasses coalesced on the dragon’s head.
The dazzle dragon walked out from behind the tree and admired its new look.  It let out a squeaky roar and jumped back behind the tree.  Zola looked at the setting sun and twirled her quill.  She waved her writing utensil at the ever-shy dragon and cast a magic mic spell.  A conjured golden microphone levitated in front of the dragon’s mouth.  It released a curious groan and it was instantly translated into a melodic and lyrical vocalization that any witch or wizard could understand.
The dazzle dragon hopped back out from hiding and held its head high.  It nodded at Zola, then marched into the Colosseum.  The razzle dragon flew around the crowd and swooped down to announce the arrival of the headlining dazzle dragon.  It took center stage and bellowed a verse.  Zola flicked her quill and beat-heavy track backed the vocals.
The crowd was stunned...  too stunned to properly react.  Then, a bastion dragon flew in, activated its conjured spellform, and danced in the sky.  The crowd snapped out of its stupor and cheered louder than the Colosseum could contain.
PRESENT DAY
The dazzle dragon awoke suddenly and immediately moon-walked across the Colosseum floor.  It looked around and saw not a single Valer nor dragon was there.  It promptly went back to sleep with its sunglasses by its side.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

The dazzle dragon awoke suddenly and immediately moon-walked across the Colosseum floor.  It looked around and saw not a single Valer nor dragon was there.  It promptly went back to sleep with its sunglasses by its side.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style 
 In the middle of an empty Colosseum, a dazzle dragon slept atop a bed of flowers and confetti.  It grunted and kicked its feet as if it were immersed in an intense dream...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
Outside the Colosseum, Zola gave a pep talk to the dazzle dragon as it ineffectively hid behind a tree.  “Just give ‘em an act with lots of flash”, she said.  Just then, a razzle dragon hurriedly escorted an elder earth dragon out of a heated contest.  The dazzle dragon’s eyes darted from the massive arena to Zola.
Zola paused, then snapped her fingers.  Shiny black bangles, spikes, and shoulder pads appeared on the dragon.  Zola rubbed her chin while observing the outfit then twitched her nose.  A sleek pair of sunglasses coalesced on the dragon’s head.
The dazzle dragon walked out from behind the tree and admired its new look.  It let out a squeaky roar and jumped back behind the tree.  Zola looked at the setting sun and twirled her quill.  She waved her writing utensil at the ever-shy dragon and cast a magic mic spell.  A conjured golden microphone levitated in front of the dragon’s mouth.  It released a curious groan and it was instantly translated into a melodic and lyrical vocalization that any witch or wizard could understand.
The dazzle dragon hopped back out from hiding and held its head high.  It nodded at Zola, then marched into the Colosseum.  The razzle dragon flew around the crowd and swooped down to announce the arrival of the headlining dazzle dragon.  It took center stage and bellowed a verse.  Zola flicked her quill and beat-heavy track backed the vocals.
The crowd was stunned...  too stunned to properly react.  Then, a bastion dragon flew in, activated its conjured spellform, and danced in the sky.  The crowd snapped out of its stupor and cheered louder than the Colosseum could contain.
PRESENT DAY
The dazzle dragon awoke suddenly and immediately moon-walked across the Colosseum floor.  It looked around and saw not a single Valer nor dragon was there.  It promptly went back to sleep with its sunglasses by its side.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Ooze.name: Ooze
Ooze.description: This dragon defies description. The ancient manuscript "The Done Witch" tells of several renowned scribes nearly going mad trying to find just the right words to describe this rare and ancient creature. Their vague and contradictory descriptions seemed unbelievable, until one of these dragons dragged itself from the marshes at the mouth of the Aichpey river to lay dreaming in the road before the Mouth Inn. Now we know why they had such a hard time.

Snooz.name: Snooz
Snooz.description: The snooz dragons had gone unnoticed for a very long time, hiding above plain sight.  They float high in the sky napping on their soft, cloud-like tails, remaining unbothered by the commotion down in the Vale.  That is until one day Tolzar flew his Optical Oracle high above the clouds.  On the way back down he snagged one of the clouds and slowly dragged it behind him all the way down to the Vale.  When they landed, the dragon woke up with a mighty yawn and looked around confused at its unfamiliar surroundings.  Thinking it was just a dream, it went back to sleep.  Much to its surprise, the dragon slept incredibly well with the soothing sounds of chirping birds and running water.  So well in fact, that it opted to stay in the Vale.

Silver.name: Silver
Silver.description: The Great Witch Rudna was having a dream about potions and her famous Parkes Poultice when she awoke to an amazing sight. A silver dragon helping a gold dragon carry away some of Thatche's treasure. Little did she know, it was the first sighting of a second treasure dragon.

Geode.name: Geode
Geode.description: These dragons were recently discovered deep within the Tull Caverns. The Wizard scholars are abuzz with the mysteries surrounding this dragon, some theorize that they are the ancient ancestors of gemstone dragons. While sharing a marked resemblance to gemstone dragons, they are unable to generate magic gems and retain the ability to breed with other dragons.

Frostfluff.name: Frostfluff
Frostfluff.description:
Gwyddion's Field Notes from the Rift:
"Day 5 in the Rift. Adopted a dragon disguise to track a new Rift-touched dragon. Am observing from a distance so as not to disturb its natural behavior. Seems to be primarily of the Cold trait family. Appears to be incredibly fluffy and adorable. Must quell urge to abandon disguise and pinch cheeks. Temptation proving increasingly difficult to keep at bay. So... cute... cannot... resist... tiny... baby... fluffface..."

Fae.name: Fae
Fae.description: Sprightly dragons filled with joy, glamour and sparkle.  The mystical fae dragons watch over and protect their fairy brothers and sisters wherever they go.  Ironically, these protectors are easily startled and often phase out of existence, to an unknown location, realm or perhaps even plane of reality.  No one knows for sure where they go, but many would love to see the magical places that faes travel to to get away from everything, for it must be truly spectacular.

Labradorite.name: Labradorite
Labradorite.description: First discovered in the Plagioclase Caves of the northern lands, the labrodorite dragon is best known for its iridescent, itty-bitty wings. What it lacks in wingspan, however, it makes up for in sheer joie de vivre. The labradorite dragon is one of the Vale's friendliest dragons, always up for a game of Dragon Treat Catch or Wand Fetch. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Djinni.name: Djinni
Djinni.description:
After spending one thousand and one nights searching the Sandarra Desert for treasure, the traveler Ala Din came across the fabled Cave of Wanderers. Though the cave was filled with fascinating and jeweled treasure, he became transfixed on a somewhat grimy lamp. Overtaken by the need to shine it up a bit, he suddenly found himself in front of a djinni dragon.
Having heard rumors of such fantastical creatures from legend, he did the first thing that came to mind: he wished for more wishes. This was of course against the rules of magic, and immediately and forever stripped the djinni dragons of any wish-granting powers they might have had.

Snowpocalypse.name: Snowpocalypse
Snowpocalypse.description: After the eruption of the mythic volcano Garita, which released the apocalypse dragon, the resultant ash clouds drifted to Vinturfjord. When the clouds cooled, the magic within condensed into the most beautiful snowfall ever witnessed. But by the sixth hour of the sixth day of the sixth week of snowfall, Vinturfjordians began to fear the end of the Vale was near. Luckily, just when it seemed like the snow would never stop, a great wind whipped all of the fallen snow into the form of a dragon! Or at least that's the legend--we might not know exactly how the Breeding Cave works, but we're relatively certain it doesn't work like that.

Smigi.name: Smigi
Smigi.description: Originally discovered by the Wizard and Witch duo, Jules and Lillian, smigis were often seen swinging and gliding in the wild, thanks to their amazing acrobatic skills.  The duo would chase after the dragons, trying to get close enough to study them, only able to catch up when the dragons got tired.  The smigis weren't running away out of fear, however, they simply had fun running along with their new bipedal friends.  The dragons would curiously wonder why the wizards walk on their hind legs, but they didn't judge.  It is the sounds of cheering and laughter that brought them to the circus, excited by the possibility of showing off their agility, as well as making new strange friends.

Stoneshell.name: Stoneshell
Stoneshell.description:
One might think it would be difficult to fly with rocks for wings, but the stoneshell dragon manages quite well. Those boulder-like appendages also serve the dual purpose of giving this hidden dragon a way to tuck itself out of sight. More than one wizard has mistaken a concealed stoneshell dragon for a Burcadian Standing Egg! 
 One might think it would be difficult to fly with rocks for wings, but the stoneshell dragon manages quite well. Those boulder-like appendages also serve the dual purpose of giving this hidden dragon a way to tuck itself out of sight. More than one wizard has mistaken a concealed stoneshell dragon for a Burcadian Standing Egg!

Lapis.name: Lapis
Lapis.description: The controversial wizard Pablue Pickaxe is said to have studied nothing but the azure Lapis dragon for the longest period of his time as master of the Academy. Despite the eccentric distortions his spells wove, his work was greatly admired and influences wizards to this day. Some say he was inspired by the images of the noble dragon found frequently in the ancient desert monuments Pickaxe made his home. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Sleighbell.name: Sleighbell
Sleighbell.description: Unique tufts of fur resemble bells with a jingle, the sleighbell dragons usually befriend wizards and love to mingle. Every eve of seasonal celebration, these selfless creatures inspire great imagination.

Plumewing.name: Plumewing
Plumewing.description: The witch Ally Tanco was the first to breed the plumewing after the stabilization of the Rift.  You should know this about Ally: she dresses EXCLUSIVELY in gold and silver, and the day of the plumewing's discovery was no exception.  When the plummeting hatched and saw the mesmerizing metallic materials of Ally's fashion choices, it flew about in a dizzying tizzy, squeaking so excitedly, Ally feared the hatchling would faint.  Whatever the reason, it seems plumewing dragons REALLY like shiny things.  Like, really really.  You might want to warn visitors to keep an eye on any loose change in their pockets.

Regal.name: Regal
Regal.description: Originally from the Palagos islands, these dragons had to stand out amidst the vibrant tropical colors in order to even be seen by their own kind. Thanks to that extravagant plumage, its hard to miss the regal dragon! Even if you do the majestic behavior of this dragon is sure to make itself noticed in front of any wizard or witch.

Tourmaline.name: Tourmaline
Tourmaline.description: Between their epic, flashy coloration and and an inherent magnetic charm, tourmaline dragons are more social than other dragons. It's difficult to say exactly how and how much dragons communicate with ( or pay attention to) each other, but tourmaline dragons at least pause before wandering off to-- Oooo, something shiny! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Storm.name: Storm
Storm.description:
Native to mountain regions, the storm dragon loves to come out during snowy thunderstorms at high altitudes. It is a common dragon but few people know they've seen one because storm dragons look like lightning shooting across the sky and their roar sounds like rolling thunder. 
 Native to mountain regions, the storm dragon loves to come out during snowy thunderstorms at high altitudes. It is a common dragon but few people know they've seen one because storm dragons look like lightning shooting across the sky and their roar sounds like rolling thunder.

Puffles.name: Puffles
Puffles.description: Puffles are often approached by Wizards and other dragons alike under the assumption that they will be nice and cuddly. But despite their soft outward appearance, their coat hides the truly ferocious beast they are underneath. Sometimes you can catch glimpses of the scary claws, leathery skin so tough it can shrug off the sharpest of rocks and gnarly horns that would worry even the diamond dragons. Just don't make any loud noises around them as they might pull a scaredy-turtle.

Cave.name: Cave
Cave.description: Found deep in the Tull Caverns, cave dragons have adapted googly eyes to see in the dark. Their long jointed legs make them excellent runners, able to clear large boulders whilst staying in full stride.

Leathery.name: Leathery
Leathery.description: Hailing from the Tannis Valley, the arrival of the leathery dragons coincides with the third anniversary of the magic of  DragonVale. Wizards have been digging into their secrets for years.

Ghostly Evergreen.name: Ghostly Evergreen
Ghostly Evergreen.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
First found in the forests of Farn, the evergreen dragon is one of the few dragons known to roam in large groups. Coming across them in the wild may be a sight to behold, but beware; evergreen dragons are particularly prickly and properly protective of their progeny.

Monte.name: Monte
Monte.description:
As it walked through the Vale yawning, a monte dragon stumbled upon a giant mess of chopped, diced, and smashed beanstalks. It bent down to take a taste, mostly to determine if it was still good to eat. It smacked its beak with appeasement and went in for another bite...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The monte dragon flew high above a crowd of Valers and dragons, diving and swooping between the tall beanstalks of a large treat farm crop. The Valers held buckets over their heads and the dragons watched intently. The monte dragon snapped and chomped at the beanstalks. Chunks flew in the air as sugary juice rained down into the buckets. The magicfolk emptied the buckets in a giant trough for the spectating dragons. A darcowl and an outrider dragon sidled in and lapped up some fresh beanstalk juice. The smiled at each other with dripping jowls.
The monte dragon kept flying and slicing beanstalks until the trough was overflowing. The witches and wizards below tried to signal for it to stop, but the dragon saw what looked like a rowdy good time. Soon, everyone was knee deep in beanstalk chunks.
PRESENT DAY
The monte dragon took a second look at the mess and may have blushed... it would be hard to tell. It pushed all the beanstalk pieces together with its wings and assembled a pile. It picked up a large leaf in its beak and placed it neatly on top. As it walked away, it stopped and turned back for one last bite for the road.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear of Style

Thistle.name: Thistle
Thistle.description:
An explanation for this dragon's exceptionally fluffy tail hails from the homework scrolls of the House of the Iron Blossom:
There once was a dragon called thistle who dreamt of a day it could whistle.
It huffed and it puffed 'til its tail was quite fluffed, but the best it could do was a sniffle!

Phantom.name: Phantom
Phantom.description: Phantom dragons began appearing in the frozen highlands of the far North. A slight chill can be felt as they glide by, but it's uncertain if this is due to their temperature or their spectral appearance.

Singularity.name: Singularity
Singularity.description: When you look at the singularity dragon, you're not seeing the dragon, but an outline caused by magical waves distorting *around* the dragon. It's true! The singularity dragon itself has no visible form. You can thank the astromancer Sven Sparrowing for that mind-bending bit of magical theory. He witnessed the distortions while stargazing one particularly clear night, and has been confusing people with his discovery ever since.

Copper.name: Copper
Copper.description: Our wizards tell us that other than their ornate horns, copper dragons are a solid color before hatching. It is only through an odd natural process that they obtain the green hue that is seen on their wings and belly. They are thought to shed the rest of their scales periodically, which keeps them looking as good as new! It's strange that no one ever sees them laying around, where do they all go?!

Ghostly Lichen.name: Ghostly Lichen
Ghostly Lichen.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Lichen dragons can be found on the highest mountain peaks and furthest polar reaches throughout the world. Our wizards say that the unique substance growing on them is some sort of strange plant that feeds the dragons using sunlight. Or something. I didn't really understand it myself. Oh and be sure not to confuse lichen dragons with any other kind of supernatural beings, they've been known to take offense to that.

Ouroboros.name: Ouroboros
Ouroboros.description: Scholars agree the hatching of the first Ouroboros dragon coincided with the day the Scar of the World was created. Some call them a harbinger of ill, but even more say they are a living prophecy; promising that someday the Scar will be healed.

Moon.name: Moon
Moon.description:
The first mythical moon dragon was so enchanting that the first sun dragon created the world and stars for the two of them to share. But their magic was so strong that they had to separate themselves or risk destroying everything. Legend claims that they became the sun and moon and their descendants now live in our world. 
 The first mythical moon dragon was so enchanting that the first sun dragon created the world and stars for the two of them to share. But their magic was so strong that they had to separate themselves or risk destroying everything. Legend claims that they became the sun and moon and their descendants now live in our world.

Limulimu.name: Limulimu
Limulimu.description: Nobody really believed it when the self-proclaimed dragon expert, Dustin McBurr, came back from the Crimson Sea announcing he had discovered a new dragon. It was just like that time he had insisted he had seen an invisible dragon—preposterous! It wasn’t until McBurr appeared in the middle of town, still covered in the Crimson Sea’s briny water, with a happy little limulimu dragon by his side that valors had to acknowledge his discovery.

Permafrost.name: Permafrost
Permafrost.description: From the freeziest, coldest regions of the far north hails the permafrost dragon. This fierce flier has to keep up with the worst of the winter weather, so don't let those adorable little baby wings fool you. Despite its appearance as a hatchling, the permafrost dragon grows up to sport a seriously impressive wingspan!

Chaiko.name: Chaiko
Chaiko.description: Despite their look, chaiko dragons are actually very friendly, especially with the sugarplum dragons.  But when they spot their favorite treat, and see there is competition for it, then their mean look starts to make more sense.  You see, they go nuts for nuts and will have these strange rattle battles with one another for the right to eat the treat.  Even squirrels don't have the courage to steal nuts from them.

Alure.name: Alure
Alure.description: One day on their way back from the Shimmering Isles, the wizard Samjack and his celtic dragon companion were sailing home with a crew of sailors. Entering a thick fog on their way, they all started hearing a delightful tune that would gently caress their ears as if an angel had softly whispered into them. Only the celtic dragon wasn't enjoying it, covering its ears from the sound. Entranced by the tune, the captain ordered the helmsman to steer towards the source of the singing. Getting closer and closer, the alluring song became gradually louder and louder. And there, deep in the fog they discovered the source - a dragon as beautiful as a dream and as scary as a nightmare. With only the celtic dragon not under the alure dragon's charm, it tore off the sails of the ship and started dragging it backwards with all the strength it could muster. Once the crew were out of the fog, it could finally rest and take a breather. The sailors fashioned a new makeshift sail and made their way home and to this day they wonder, what would have happened if not for the help of that wizard's companion.

Terradiem.name: Terradiem
Terradiem.description: A manuscript written 1,970 years ago depicts a great dragon that represented the entire world and how it worked in perfect harmony. Those images have been reused, the manuscript has been recycled among the populous, causing a renewed interest in this great dragon. Lo and behold, the terradiem dragon was rediscovered wandering around the Scar of the World!

Fluorescent.name: Fluorescent
Fluorescent.description: The fluorescent dragon's hide is super glossy, thanks to a heaping dose of powerful light magic--which comes in handy if ever you're spelunking or lost in an especially shadowy alternate dimension. What better adventuring companion than a glow-in-the-dark dragon?

Sugarplum.name: Sugarplum
Sugarplum.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 6
That very same night, a sugarplum dragon wandered in search of flowers that reflected the moonlight. It came across a cluster of lunar-luminescent lilies that inspired the dragon to grin and skip. It plucked some and placed them between scales and fur to enhance its luster. It let out a happy little chirp. A barrage of footsteps grew louder and louder until an avarice dragon appeared at the peak of anger. The sugarplum dragon recoiled, but soon saw the red, droopy eyes and sullen stance of the creature. The sugarplum dragon approached the weary one and saw its unforgiving living quarters. In no time at all, the sugarplum dragon had gathered straw and grass to form a much more comfortable bed for the avarice dragon. The avarice dragon inspected the bed as if it were a trap, then placed one paw gently on the bedding. It was soft. The avarice dragon plopped down and sighed heavily. the sugarplum dragon was so delighted it leaped and twirled with glee. Incidentally, this celebratory dance hypnotized the avarice dragon into a deep sleep.

Dawnbringer.name: Dawnbringer
Dawnbringer.description:
From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Dawnbringer Dragon:
 
 From the Vellum of Visions, An Ode to the Dawnbringer Dragon:

Humuhumu.name: Humuhumu
Humuhumu.description: Humuhumu dragons are known for their remarkable ability to forget things. It's rather endearing to watch a Humuhumu dragon meet a little witchling, only to forget a few minutes later, then get excited to meet the same witchling over and over again. Of course, this does mean that you need to watch how often Humuhumu dragons eat — they forget that they've eaten and just keep eating!

Razzle.name: Razzle
Razzle.description:
A razzle dragon sat on the edge of an icy pond, soaking its long legs.  It stretched both out of the ice bath, winced, and set them back in...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The razzle dragon, limber and spry, ran through the Vale gathering attention with mouth-clicks, chirps, and exuberant wing flapping.  A nearby vanguard dragon snickered at the peculiar display.
On the outskirts of the Vale, A lumberjack of a wizard had cast an auto-axe spell and watched it methodically chop a tall oak.  The razzle dragon sped by and caught the working wizard’s eye.  He walked away from the spell with only inches left intact on the trunk.  The swaying tree released a loud CRACK and alarmed the amused vanguard dragon.  It came running around the corner just in time to divert the falling tree with its strong wings.  THUD!  The tree struck the ground a few feet from the Hibernation Cave.
On a thick wooded trail, an ignite dragon led a pack of baby dragons on a hike to wild dragon treats.  The ignite dragon blasted branches and thorns out of their path with precision breath magic.  The razzle dragon flew overhead, cawing and gesturing to anyone below it to follow.  The ignite dragon got distracted and followed the hoopla.  The baby ignite dragons stopped walking when they were faced with an impenetrable thicket.  The dutiful vanguard dragon appeared shortly thereafter and landed near the hatchlings.  It cleared a path for them but in turn became encased in thorns and prickly branches.
In the center of town, a witch was as busy as a busby dragon painting her house when the razzle dragon skipped by squawking and waving.  The witch thought something important must be happening for this fabulous fanfare, so she followed the rabble-rousing razzle dragon too.  Unfortunately, the velocity of the witch’s levitating paint globs increased as soon as she left.  It appeared as if her neighbor might be the recipient of an unwanted home makeover, until the resourceful vanguard dragon flew in front of the rogue paint and flapped its enormous wings.  Of course, the paint went straight up in the air and rained down on the poor, selfless soul trying to help avert disaster.
When the winded, scathed, and painted spellform dragon caught up with the razzle dragon, it loudly and proudly waltzed into the Colosseum.  The vanguard dragon stopped, shook its head, and turned around.
PRESENT DAY
The razzle dragon stepped out of the ice bath and calmly stood on one leg to dry off.  It tucked its head under its wing and snoozed away.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

It came running around the corner just in time to divert the falling tree with its strong wings.  THUD!  The tree struck the ground a few feet from the Hibernation Cave.
On a thick wooded trail, an ignite dragon led a pack of baby dragons on a hike to wild dragon treats.  The ignite dragon blasted branches and thorns out of their path with precision breath magic.  The razzle dragon flew overhead, cawing and gesturing to anyone below it to follow.  The ignite dragon got distracted and followed the hoopla.  The baby ignite dragons stopped walking when they were faced with an impenetrable thicket.  The dutiful vanguard dragon appeared shortly thereafter and landed near the hatchlings.  It cleared a path for them but in turn became encased in thorns and prickly branches.
In the center of town, a witch was as busy as a busby dragon painting her house when the razzle dragon skipped by squawking and waving.  The witch thought something important must be happening for this fabulous fanfare, so she followed the rabble-rousing razzle dragon too.  Unfortunately, the velocity of the witch’s levitating paint globs increased as soon as she left.  It appeared as if her neighbor might be the recipient of an unwanted home makeover, until the resourceful vanguard dragon flew in front of the rogue paint and flapped its enormous wings.  Of course, the paint went straight up in the air and rained down on the poor, selfless soul trying to help avert disaster.
When the winded, scathed, and painted spellform dragon caught up with the razzle dragon, it loudly and proudly waltzed into the Colosseum.  The vanguard dragon stopped, shook its head, and turned around.
PRESENT DAY
The razzle dragon stepped out of the ice bath and calmly stood on one leg to dry off.  It tucked its head under its wing and snoozed away.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style 
 A razzle dragon sat on the edge of an icy pond, soaking its long legs.  It stretched both out of the ice bath, winced, and set them back in...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The razzle dragon, limber and spry, ran through the Vale gathering attention with mouth-clicks, chirps, and exuberant wing flapping.  A nearby vanguard dragon snickered at the peculiar display.
On the outskirts of the Vale, A lumberjack of a wizard had cast an auto-axe spell and watched it methodically chop a tall oak.  The razzle dragon sped by and caught the working wizard’s eye.  He walked away from the spell with only inches left intact on the trunk.  The swaying tree released a loud CRACK and alarmed the amused vanguard dragon.  It came running around the corner just in time to divert the falling tree with its strong wings.  THUD!  The tree struck the ground a few feet from the Hibernation Cave.
On a thick wooded trail, an ignite dragon led a pack of baby dragons on a hike to wild dragon treats.  The ignite dragon blasted branches and thorns out of their path with precision breath magic.  The razzle dragon flew overhead, cawing and gesturing to anyone below it to follow.  The ignite dragon got distracted and followed the hoopla.  The baby ignite dragons stopped walking when they were faced with an impenetrable thicket.  The dutiful vanguard dragon appeared shortly thereafter and landed near the hatchlings.  It cleared a path for them but in turn became encased in thorns and prickly branches.
In the center of town, a witch was as busy as a busby dragon painting her house when the razzle dragon skipped by squawking and waving.  The witch thought something important must be happening for this fabulous fanfare, so she followed the rabble-rousing razzle dragon too.  Unfortunately, the velocity of the witch’s levitating paint globs increased as soon as she left.  It appeared as if her neighbor might be the recipient of an unwanted home makeover, until the resourceful vanguard dragon flew in front of the rogue paint and flapped its enormous wings.  Of course, the paint went straight up in the air and rained down on the poor, selfless soul trying to help avert disaster.
When the winded, scathed, and painted spellform dragon caught up with the razzle dragon, it loudly and proudly waltzed into the Colosseum.  The vanguard dragon stopped, shook its head, and turned around.
PRESENT DAY
The razzle dragon stepped out of the ice bath and calmly stood on one leg to dry off.  It tucked its head under its wing and snoozed away.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Kwall.name: Kwall
Kwall.description:
The Haunted Harvest begins!
Knowing what shenanigans his questionable decor might unleash when the Harvest begins, Whitbee and the other Wizards barricaded the blue portal he had made.  They took shifts monitoring it to make sure no more horrific dragons come pouring out into the Vale.  One day, as Whitbee stood watch, a knocking on the barricade was heard...from the inside of the portal.  Unsure if it was real or just his imagination, Whitbee knocked on it himself, hoping nothing would reply.  Instead of the silence he was hoping for, what he got in response was much worse, the portal began sparkling and the planks started violently shaking as something was trying to brute force its way through to his side.  He quickly sounded the alarm and all the other Wizards rushed over, they turned over whatever furniture they could and took cover behind it, wands aimed at the portal ready for whatever it is that comes out.  After a few minutes, the planks could no longer hold the beast and it made its way through.  Much to their relief, it wasn't the eldritch horror or doom bringer they were expecting.  Instead, it was this cute, bulbous, innocent looking bundle of ectoplasm.  Sure, some of his inner working should not be visible to the naked eye but when it stuck its tongue out like a puppy, they decided to let it stay.  Kwall, they named it, after the sound Lumi made when she first saw it.  Had this whole ordeal happened at night, however, this would have been an entirely different story. 
 The Haunted Harvest begins!

Instead, it was this cute, bulbous, innocent looking bundle of ectoplasm.  sure, some of his inner working should not be visible to the naked eye but when it stuck its tongue out like a puppy, they decided to let it stay.  Kwall, they named it, after the sound Lumi made when she first saw it.  Had this whole ordeal happened at night, however, this would have been an entirely different story.

Decay.name: Decay
Decay.description: The decay dragon is the star of spooky bedtime story in the Vale, giving it somewhat of an unfair reputation. Parents tell their children not to play tricks, or else the decay dragon will drag them from their beds and bring them to a horrible land without candy! In reality, though, the decay dragon's interests are more about eating treats, and less about dragging little witches and wizards off into the night.

Coldcoil.name: Coldcoil
Coldcoil.description:
Motto of the House of the Icy Torrent: "We Do Not Sink".  And with the new addition to the house, the coldcoil dragon, we can safely add "We Do Not Stop If An Opportunity For Dragon Treats Is Presented" to the motto.  Long story short, a group of magicfolk were quietly admiring their garden full of Zazzberries, when they noticed something sneaking out of the nearby lake.  They went closer to inspect only to find a large shell on the ground, but didn't think much of it.  Until the shell grew legs.  And headed towards the nearest Zazzberry bush. 
 Motto of the House of the Icy Torrent: "We Do Not Sink".  And with the new addition to the house, the coldcoil dragon, we can safely add "We Do Not Stop If An Opportunity For Dragon Treats Is Presented" to the motto.  Long story short, a group of magicfolk were quietly admiring their garden full of Zazzberries, when they noticed something sneaking out of the nearby lake.  They went closer to inspect only to find a large shell on the ground, but didn't think much of it.  Until the shell grew legs.  And headed towards the nearest Zazzberry bush.

Wraith.name: Wraith
Wraith.description: It has been said to never enter a staring contest with a lightning dragon. The calm and piercing eyes of the wraith dragon give their lightning dragon cousins the shivers.

Bellflower.name: Bellflower
Bellflower.description:
The master plant wizard Treppide was on a quest to find and devour,
The most delicious plants near the bell tower,
But instead he found the bellflower.

Yolkwing.name: Yolkwing
Yolkwing.description:
The Burcadians of the Mountain Sun first discovered the yolkwing dragon. Adrift in the 
, it was first found by one of Kaleni's apprentices. The yolkwing's sunny disposition found an easy home in the farms and fields of Burcadians, and is happy to make its home in many park settings. The yolkwing's whimsical appearance is sure to crack up many a visitor!

Wendigo.name: Wendigo
Wendigo.description:
The Haunted Harvest trick or eating!
After kwall's spooktacular entrance through Whitbee's portal, the Wizards decided not to repair the barricade on the portal, but still keep a watchful eye on it.  This time the portal began sparkling at dawn and the Wizard who was there all but expected another cutesy dragon to pop out.  Instead, what came out, might as well have come out of somebody's darkest nightmare.  A ferocious, hunched over beast that looked as if it had just fought death itself...and won.  The dragon, with an eerie glow in its eyes, started thrashing around, knocking over barricades and furniture with intense rage and fervor.  Gardenia was alone on watch and did her best to stay out of harm's way until backup arrived.  She threw a few treats its way as distraction but the dragon paid no attention to them.  It hadn't come looking for treats, and this was no mere trick.  When the others arrived, the sun had just risen and they were baffled as to why Gardenia would sound the alarm and hide in fear over such a cute and fuzzy dragon, even its horns look like candy canes.  When she came out of hiding she could not believe her eyes, the horrific beast that was rampaging moments ago was now nomming on the treats she threw at it earlier.  In a panic she quickly described how just moments ago it looked entirely different and was ramming and smashing everything, as if it was possessed by an evil spirit.  They scoffed and joked about her having to catch some sleep instead.

It hadn't come looking for treats, and this was no mere trick.  When the others arrived, the sun had just risen and they were baffled as to why Gardenia would sound the alarm and hide in fear over such a cute and fuzzy dragon, even its horns look like candy canes.  When she came out of hiding she could not believe her eyes, the horrific beast that was rampaging moments ago was now nomming on the treats she threw at it earlier.  In a panic she quickly described how just moments ago it looked entirely different and was ramming and smashing everything, as if it was possessed by an evil spirit.  They scoffed and joked about her having to catch some sleep instead.

Butterfly.name: Butterfly
Butterfly.description: Flightless as babies, the amazing butterfly dragons transform into multi-winged magnificent creatures. They can be found fluttering around the lush Sykie Meadows. Their large and beautiful wings are sure to attract visitors... unless the visitor mistakes their wings for a fearsome wingaling dragon.

Ghostly Nosferatu.name: Ghostly Nosferatu
Ghostly Nosferatu.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Originally discovered by the powerful wizard Whitbee, the nosferatu dragon possesses an impressive pair of sweet teeth! However, there is no need to be frightened, as their propensity to bite can be satisfied by dragon treats!

Flicker.name: Flicker
Flicker.description: What are the twinkling lights that float around this gentle creature? For a long time, the prevailing theory was that the flicker dragon traveled the tundra, drawn to stray fireflies. The people of the north would set candles on their window sills, which would sometimes attract a passing dragon. One day, a wise wizard pointed out that fireflies don't, in fact, line anywhere near the far north. It appears the flicker dragon was just making social visits!

Rust.name: Rust
Rust.description: Most people mistake rust dragons for land lovers and think that water is harmful to their metallic scales. While they do feel at home on land, rust dragons are the best swimmers of all of the known dragons! Our wizards still haven't been able to figure out how it is they manage to stay afloat though.

Comet.name: Comet
Comet.description: Galaxy dragons are Ashlee's absolute favorite type of dragon. So when her parents told her about the arrival of the comet dragon, she could hardly form complete sentences. "C-Can we p-please go visit the dragon park?" Ashlee stuttered. That night, she watched the comet dragons execute supersonic dives that ignited bright coronas of vaporizing ice. As she watched them zip and zoom in bright streaks that lit up the night sky, Ashlee was sure that the comet dragon would be her new favorite. Until the next galaxy dragon came along, of course.

Bramble.name: Bramble
Bramble.description: The bramble dragon has a thorny history among witches and wizards. Often found sleeping in heavily forested areas, this dragon is easy to miss until you stumble into its prickly tail… and get stuck there. Nurses skilled in mending magic are frequently dispatched all over DragonVale to free the unfortunate folk who get tangled up with bramble dragons. The bramble dragons don't mind the attention, though; they get pretty attached to new friends.

Ghostly Ghost.name: Ghostly Ghost
Ghostly Ghost.description:
It was once beleived to be a prank played on young Valers... but a ghostly ghost dragon is no joke.
There was a group of young magicfolk who loved mysteries, yet they never solved one. Most of the time, they would gather just to eat loads of treats. Of course, when they least expected it, they saw a ghostly ghost dragon emerge from a foggy forest. Candy fell out of their mouths and they ran. They didn't realize the dragon only wanted to share some more spooky snacks.

Snowy Silver.name: Snowy Silver
Snowy Silver.description: Every few years, when conditions are just right, wizards and witches from all across the world climb Mount Oly for a festival of competitions. It was during the downhill free form flying races that Snowy Olympus Dragons were first sighted. Swift and agile, these dragons make the best wizards look like amateurs. Silver Snowys are very nearly as graceful as Golds, but the witch Kaylamac still scowls sometimes when they hatch.

Cyclops.name: Cyclops
Cyclops.description: The cyclops dragon was first discovered when one visited the renowned wizard Harry's house. They immediately saw eye to eye. Harry labored over a spell that would allow them to thrive in Olympus habitats. Fun fact: Harry spends most of his efforts in creating a spell that will pause time.

Ghostly Earth.name: Ghostly Earth
Ghostly Earth.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Despite the harshness of their habitat, the earth dragon is the least restless of all known breeds. They are supremely well adapted for their desert homes with thick skin and large bodies to store water. The spikes on their back offer protection from predators, but honestly, what animal in its right mind would think to take on one of these massive beasts?

Bicentennial.name: Bicentennial
Bicentennial.description: Rumored to only appear every great few ages, the bicentennial dragons are among the rarest dragons ever seen by witches and wizards. On a chance encounter at the Garita volcano, the witch Komoria was suprised to find the bicentennial dragons following her back to the Vale. Darting in flight with their dual pairs of wings, these dragons rarely stay on the ground for long. Be sure to breed one before they return to the skies!

Frons.name: Frons
Frons.description:
In old school style, frons is in the answer to yet another riddle in the House of the Iron Blossom:
What is thin and flat,
Can sometimes be in unusual format,
Is light as a feather, but is metal,
And it's not very mettle?
Oh, and it used to look quite different. 
 In old school style, frons is in the answer to yet another riddle in the House of the Iron Blossom:
What is thin and flat,
Can sometimes be in unusual format,
Is light as a feather, but is metal,
And it's not very mettle?
Oh, and it used to look quite different. 
 In old school style, frons is in the answer to yet another riddle in the House of the Iron Blossom:
What is thin and flat,
Can sometimes be in unusual format,
Is light as a feather, but is metal,
And it's not very mettle? 
 In old school style, frons is in the answer to yet another riddle in the House of the Iron Blossom:
What is thin and flat,
Can sometimes be in unusual format,
Is light as a feather, but is metal,
And it's not very mettle?

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description: Believed to be the ancient ancestor of the more common fire dragon, scorch dragons tend to play in thunderstorms, tornadoes, wildfires or any other extremely dangerous places. Through much hard work (and some pretty impressive healing magic) we learned enough about these ancient beasts to keep them - and your visitors - safe and happy in your park.

Thundersnow.name: Thundersnow
Thundersnow.description: The roar of the thundersnow dragon is powerful enough to shake snowflakes from their clouds and send lightning jetting across the sky. Juvenile witches and wizards with mischief on their minds will sometimes coax the thundersnow dragon with treats, hoping its excited roar will bring a thunderous blizzard to cancel school!

Water.name: Water
Water.description:
The water dragon is native to places where magic-imbued waters collect. It needs to have a very specific combination of magic and minerals. They are the most playful dragon ever seen, sure to cause a splash with your incoming visitors. 
 The water dragon is native to places where magic-imbued waters collect. It needs to have a very specific combination of magic and minerals. They are the most playful dragon ever seen, sure to cause a splash with your incoming visitors.

Delirium.name: Delirium
Delirium.description: Nogard, O Nogard, what does a great dragon make? Is it a cavernous clack or a twistiforous shake? Perhaps it is the poise with which it dances, or staring eyes that bring on trances? The value of a dragon, Nogard concludes, lies not in its parts, but in the imaginings it brews.

Ghostly Glacier.name: Ghostly Glacier
Ghostly Glacier.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
Tremendous eaters, glacier dragons follow the first rule of geography, never get separated from your lunch. Trails of excess water in your habitat? We assure you that's meltwater, not an accident.

Ghostly Poison.name: Ghostly Poison
Ghostly Poison.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
The poison dragon loves people. Not for breakfast, it just thinks they're great company. Unfortunately, people don't often react well to their deadly neurotoxin. Best to watch it play with its own kind from a safe distance.

Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
Sandstorm.description:
Throughout the ages, enthusiasts have risked the harshest deserts in search of the sandstorm dragon to hear the percussive beat and the syncopated rhythms of its wings. Some minstrels have tried to recreate the sound in a new form of music they lovingly call "tectonica." The prospect of hearing the real thing, without braving a dangerous sandstorm, is bound to attract many visitors. 
 Throughout the ages, enthusiasts have risked the harshest deserts in search of the sandstorm dragon to hear the percussive beat and the syncopated rhythms of its wings. Some minstrels have tried to recreate the sound in a new form of music they lovingly call "tectonica." The prospect of hearing the real thing, without braving a dangerous sandstorm, is bound to attract many visitors.

Starshine.name: Starshine
Starshine.description: It used to be that the winter witch, Lumi, would win the fairy light decorating contest every year. Jealous neighbors began to get suspicious; there's no way any spell could make lights shine like that! After a bit of snooping, it was discovered that Lumi wasn't using fairy lights at all, but was enticing starshine dragons to nap amongst her trees! Lumi didn't face any repercussions, though--it's now common to find a few starshine dragons helping light up huts this time of year.

Lumineux.name: Lumineux
Lumineux.description: When waves of nightmares manifest and wash over the dreamland, lumineux dragons quickly move to action. They huddle together with other inhabitants of their realm, protecting them by radiating a pleasant aura of warmth and serenity, keeping the nightmares away. With hearts of gold, these dragons can illuminate even the darkest of the dreamland's corners.

Etch.name: Etch
Etch.description: As if beckoned by a mysterious force, some etch dragons made their way here, following the aura of the enveloping darkness and dread in the Vale.  The wizards had only read about these dragons in pre-cataclysm texts.  Quiet and reclusive in nature, but unnerving and suspicious in their appearance.  Originating from the swamps of Catchafaya, where they are well suited for their home environment, although they do have to compete for insects with the local Kroki dragons every now and then.

Lacuna.name: Lacuna
Lacuna.description: In the old tongue, "lacuna" means "lake of the abyss" -- and it was in the abyss of the Rift that the wizard Anne T. Matre discovered the lacuna dragon. The clever witch, an expert in revealing hidden things, devised a spell to track dragons in the miasmic ether. After some time spent following what turned out to be Gwyddion in a dragon disguise (he, too, has his ways of finding dragons), Anne happened upon the luminous glow of the lacuna. She was so transfixed by the dragon's flowing tail, so much like the coral that once grew in the Surface oceans, she nearly lost her way back! Well, at least she could've kept Roger company.

Halo.name: Halo
Halo.description: Elmin the Stirrer achieved culinary fame when he completed his first legendary angel food cake. Once the cake was baked and the kitchen shutters opened, the powerful aroma brought gawkers from far and wide. The heavenly scent even wafted high into the clouds, from where it drew a dragon that nobody had seen before. That day marked both the introduction of the halo dragon and Elmin's ascent to the title of Master Chef.

Trepak.name: Trepak
Trepak.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 9
Trepak dragons are a dignified bunch and it's not just the uniformity of their coat. They enjoy organizing the efforts of their fellow dragons. So when one trepak dragon has seen Valers and dragons working together, it was beyond delighted. It sought out the cauldron of chocolate brew to taste it, but it had grown cold. It then tried to find the carolers that had adopted a libretto dragon in their vocal vocation. All it could find were frightened singers who had disbanded and sought shelter to avoid a threat from above. The trepak dragon then ventured toward the triumphant treat display that would soon garner much attention, but what it found was a few smashed desserts on the ground where an entire table had apparently been stolen. The trepak dragon snorted and marched straight to the dragons that apparently left evidence of their participation in these shady shenanigans.

Garland.name: Garland
Garland.description: Gallantly gathering fruit and flora to celebrate the 4th anniversary of magic at DragonVale, the witch Gardenia stumbled upon an incredibly beautiful and particularly stubborn bushel of blossoms to pick. Nestled deep in the verdant vines of an ancient, magical tree, the Garland Dragon was awoken by Gardenia. The majestic creature stood up and Gardenia instantly knew this guest would guarantee a grandiose celebration.

Jamjam.name: Jamjam
Jamjam.description: Constantly surrounded by so many bearded Wizards, jamjam dragons feel right at home in the Vale, and they are a favorite among the little wizzlings.  So warm and fluffy, you can hug them for hours and not get tired of it.  Some, however, are afraid of the tiny present-stealing gnomes that live inside the big bushy beards they have.  Reaching out and grabbing the presents right off of anyone who hugs the dragon.  The Wizards know better than to believe that made-up nonsense... it... it's made-up, right?

Light.name: Light
Light.description: Having not been seen in Ages, the ethereal Light Dragon makes a glorious return to the world of DragonVale. Enthusiastic and bright, these otherworldly dragons are sure to brighten up your park!

Ovalith.name: Ovalith
Ovalith.description: The Ovalith Dragon has not been seen in the world since the Age of Myth! Awakened from their aeons-long slumber, these graceful and stately dragons may well be the last of their kind, treat them well! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Amethyst.name: Amethyst
Amethyst.description: Whilst exploring the Gerias Mines, the enchantress Gigi Ode came across a spherical chamber completely covered in purple hued crystals. She quickly came to the realization that she was, in fact, surrounded by a plethora of amethyst dragons. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Dracabra.name: Dracabra
Dracabra.description: Tales from legends inspired by a coven of witches to follow a seemingly lost baby dracabra dragon. They followed its erratic flight until it took rest high atop a tree. There, it clung to a branch and hung upside-down, wary of its observers. The coven dispersed for fear of spooking the young creature. The witches returned when dawn broke and were astonished to find a fully grown dragon! Somehow, the dracabra had managed to sneak off and gorge itself on treats, growing to full size overnight!

Lacewing.name: Lacewing
Lacewing.description: We're pretty sure this dragon's wings aren't made of lace. After all, how would it fly? Well, magically, one supposes. Okay, so, maybe its wings are made of magic lace. But where does magic lace come from? Magic thread? All good questions.

Elegant.name: Elegant
Elegant.description:
A bedraggled elegant dragon slinked up to a pond and bent down to take a sip. It caught a glimpse of its disheveled reflection and stumbled back. The shocked dragon leaned in again to confirm its appearance in the water...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
A crowd of magicfolk were talking about the Secrets of Spellform while several dragons milled about a flower-covered patio. The witches and wizards stopped all conversation and the dragons stood perfectly still. Every head turned in the same direction to see and elegant dragon gracefully gliding down a grassy knoll.
The chic presence made its way down to the patio, gently making a trail on the flowered floor. A riptide dragon poked its head out of a nearby lake and stared blankly at the flowing peace of the elegant dragon. The now giddy riptide dragon dove down and popped up high in the air. It flipped over and over, let out a whistle, then straightened for a perfect dive.
A gigantic splash of muddy lake water landed on the elegant dragon. Muck and flowers were pasted all over its body and face. An audible gasp rippled through the crowd. The dripping elegant dragon looked up at the blushing riptide dragon. With one swift flick of its head, the elegant dragon displayed its style. The frills around its neck and tail flung the muddy mess in all directions into the crowd.
Music kicked on and the elegant dragon started dancing. Everyone joined in.
PRESENT DAY
The elegant dragon, still looking at itself, snickered and dunked its whole head in the water. The mud and flowers washed away, and the dragon snapped its head back to dry off. A spitting sound was heard seconds later. The dragon turned around to see Kaleni wiping water off his face.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style
