Music kicked on and the elegant dragon started dancing. Everyone joined in.
PRESENT DAY
The elegant dragon, still looking at itself, snickered and dunked its whole head in the water. The mud and flowers washed away, and the dragon snapped its head back to dry off. A spitting sound was heard seconds later. The dragon turned around to see Kaleni wiping water off his face.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style 
 A bedraggled elegant dragon slinked up to a pond and bent down to take a sip. It caught a glimpse of its disheveled reflection and stumbled back. The shocked dragon leaned in again to confirm its appearance in the water...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
A crowd of magicfolk were talking about the Secrets of Spellform while several dragons milled about a flower-covered patio. The witches and wizards stopped all conversation and the dragons stood perfectly still. Every head turned in the same direction to see and elegant dragon gracefully gliding down a grassy knoll.
The chic presence made its way down to the patio, gently making a trail on the flowered floor. A riptide dragon poked its head out of a nearby lake and stared blankly at the flowing peace of the elegant dragon. The now giddy riptide dragon dove down and popped up high in the air. It flipped over and over, let out a whistle, then straightened for a perfect dive.
A gigantic splash of muddy lake water landed on the elegant dragon. Muck and flowers were pasted all over its body and face. An audible gasp rippled through the crowd. The dripping elegant dragon looked up at the blushing riptide dragon. With one swift flick of its head, the elegant dragon displayed its style. The frills around its neck and tail flung the muddy mess in all directions into the crowd.
Music kicked on and the elegant dragon started dancing. Everyone joined in.
PRESENT DAY
The elegant dragon, still looking at itself, snickered and dunked its whole head in the water. The mud and flowers washed away, and the dragon snapped its head back to dry off. A spitting sound was heard seconds later. The dragon turned around to see Kaleni wiping water off his face.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

Ghostly Coal.name: Ghostly Coal
Ghostly Coal.description:
This ancestral dragon was summoned from realms beyond.
It is said that before the discovery of magic, humans relied on far more crude ways of meeting their needs. They burned a black stone called coal, named for the coal dragons whose skin it so resembles. This time of year, the wizards exchange coal dragon eggs with each other to remember hardships endured by those who lacked the companionship of dragons.

Yule.name: Yule
Yule.description: The Jolly Jubilee was approaching, and the wizard Kaleni could hardly contain his excitement.  Every year the wizards' feast was overflowing with treats like pumpermelon pie and berry bauble bonbons.  Just the thought of all those tasty goodies was making Kaleni's stomach rumble.  One day, Kaleni decided to go check in the larder, just to make sure that there were enough supplies for impending celebration.  But to his abject horror, Kaleni found the larder nearly empty!  This state of affairs was completely unacceptable to the wizard, and he was determined to make it right.  He hitched a sleigh to his trust Yule dragon and the two made their way out into the cold.  The snow outside was piled all the way to the roofs and the wind blew with biting force, but the steadfast yule dragon plowed through it all.  The pair stopped at each house and the yule dragon roared a melodious tune to get the residents' attention.  Kaleni explained their plight to the wizards they visited and each one gave generously.  By the end of the night, the treat pile on the sleigh was so tall that the yule dragon had to balance carefully to keep it all from toppling over.  Once the last of the treats were loaded into the larder, Kaleni looked at the hoard of generous donations and sighed with content.  The feast was saved.  His work complete, Kaleni tucked in for the night, but not before grabbing a couple Fiery Fig Fritters for a well-deserved snack.

Glasswing.name: Glasswing
Glasswing.description: The pretty glasswing dragons awe and inspire Wizards and Valers alike, with visitors coming from far off islands just for a chance to observe and paint them.  Artists often end up running out of materials before they can finish, however.  Either because the dragons are so very colorful, or because everyone spends so much time looking at them, that all the paint just dries up.

Pharaoh.name: Pharaoh
Pharaoh.description:
When the tomb of Amun-Ris was opened, and the dust of ages billowed out, it was clear that the room had sat undisturbed for a millennia. While most of the ancient Sand Kings' tombs had collapsed from time and neglect, this one's sanctity was preserved, along with the first intact dragon egg from that time that we've ever found! Why was it untouched?
Many suspect an ancient curse, but we dismiss such rumors. Still, it couldn't hurt to keep an eye on visitors passing the dragon's habitat. Just to be safe.

Nether.name: Nether
Nether.description: The nether dragon is a peculiar breed: super strong, resistant to fire, bestowed with enhanced sight, capable of understanding the words "dragon treat" in numerous ancient magical languages. Given its strange traits, Valefolk like to speculate that this dragon came from the netherworld, but no one is quite sure. Perhaps the biggest mystery is why the word "pancakes" in any language gets this dragon riled up. Heck of a thing.

Fire.name: Fire
Fire.description:
When you think of dragons, the fierce fire dragon is probably at the forefront of your thoughts. It is true that these beasts get cranky when they are cold. All you have to do is keep them warm and they become as harmless as the ground beneath their feet! Never mind that their feet are typically found above active volcanoes. 
 When you think of dragons, the fierce fire dragon is probably at the forefront of your thoughts. It is true that these beasts get cranky when they are cold. All you have to do is keep them warm and they become as harmless as the ground beneath their feet! Never mind that their feet are typically found above active volcanoes.

Longcicle.name: Longcicle
Longcicle.description: Wandering the highest mountains and the coldest peaks, these dragons like to play in the snow and to sleep on pointy mountain tops and spires by coiling their bodies around them.  They only make their way to the Vale when the winter comes along, and some see them as welcomed guests, and others as a menace.  You see, there aren't many mountain tops down in the Vale, so when all the tail planters are taken and the lamp posts are too bright to sleep under, the longcicle dragons often turn to one obvious alternative; the chimneys on the Wizards' rooftops.  Sure it might look cute on the neighbor's roof, but when you start hearing snoring and creaking directly from above, you might consider those new igloo alternatives everyone has been on about.

Starlight.name: Starlight
Starlight.description: Every so often, witches and wizards gather to commemorate when the first stars fell and the galaxy dragons first came to the Vale. It was on one of these gatherings that the littlest witch wished upon a star to see a dragon never seen before. To everyone's surprise, the very first starlight dragon appeared then and there! From that point onward this dragon has been an omen of serendipity and good luck.

Alpenglow.name: Alpenglow
Alpenglow.description:
The alpenglow dragon is so named for a phenomenon in the Rift that occurs when light reflects of of pockets of chaos magic to beautiful effect. A similar light effect seems to occur in this dragon's horns and belly, as though lit with an internal alpenglow. Gwyddion the Great Nogard believes the inner lamplight allows the alpenglow dragon to navigate even the darkest corner of the Rift. 
 The alpenglow dragon is so named for a phenomenon in the Rift that occurs when light reflects of of pockets of chaos magic to beautiful effect. A similar light effect seems to occur in this dragon's horns and belly, as though lit with an internal alpenglow. Gwyddion the Great Nogard believes the inner lamplight allows the alpenglow dragon to navigate even the darkest corner of the Rift.

Thunder.name: Thunder
Thunder.description: Originating in the Verulean Highlands, Thunder dragons have been known to exist for quite some time but were much too loud to display in parks. Fortunately, the witch Tranquila spent considerable time creating a spell to dampen the sound of her husband's thunderous snoring. She modified the spell a bit and it works well enough on Thunder dragons to allow them to share habitats with other dragons and not deafen park visitors. Though some ear plugs may still be in order.

Snowbrush.name: Snowbrush
Snowbrush.description: You know it's wintertime in the Vale when the snowfields are dotted with dragon-sized holes! There seems to be no better fun for a snowbrush dragon than diving in and out of snowdrifts. You'd probably do it too if you had golden scales to protect your noggin!

Trench.name: Trench
Trench.description: In the deepest recesses of the Sea of Anayrahm lives the aptly-named trench dragon. With a home so far from the sun, the trench dragon relies on its own dark magic glow to shed light on the gloom of the deep sea. As you might imagine it can get pretty boring down there in the dark - good thing it's easy to make friends in your park!

Spectrapod.name: Spectrapod
Spectrapod.description:
Spectrapod dragons live in underwater burrows where they spend most of their time.  They come out on occasion to find sources of food and are really good at hide and seek, especially when they are seeking something that isn't really hiding.  They can detect twelve color wavelengths, nine more than your average wizard.  Try to imagine a color you can't even imagine. Now do that eight more times.  That is how a spectrapod dragon sees you, as a thermonuclear bomb of light and beauty.
A spectrapod dragon has battering ram hands that they use to punch basically everything.  They can deliver a blow with 1500 Newtons of force, which tells you what kind of weak punch a wizard must have.  That punch is so powerful that even kaiju dragons can't handle it.  Water moves out of the way so fast that little vacuums are formed, creating a shockwave of light and heat.  Talk about a one hit wonder.  Their limbs are so resilient in fact, that researchers have been studying their cellular structure for use in the development of sturdier dragon habitats.

Infrared.name: Infrared
Infrared.description: There's more to this dragon than meets the eye. Look closely at the adult infrared's belly, and you might notice a familiar hatchling form. No, no, don't worry--the infrared dragon doesn't consume hatchlings. What a silly notion! Rather, as this dragon ages, it blossoms plumes of magical smokescales to build its grown-up dragony shape. Such is the awesome power of the concentrated fire magic!

Frostflower.name: Frostflower
Frostflower.description: As dragons go, the frostflower is a very particular creature. It tends to reveal itself in the wild only when conditions are *just* right- cold, but not too cold, and dark, but not too dark, and covered, but not too covered. And they're shy, to boot- sheesh! If you were to sneak up on an unsuspecting herd of frostflowers, you can be certain they'd flee faster than an iceberg dragon in a fire habitat. But don't do that! That's just cold.

Plumpkin.name: Plumpkin
Plumpkin.description: Plumpkin dragons usually stick together, but one baby became enchanted by the Vale's horticultural expert, Gardenia. One evening while taking a sip from a nearby stream, it watched the witch cast spell after spell, moving plants, soil, and rocks in all directions. The baby was so hypnotized by the display that it forgot it was drinking. The plumpkin baby feverishly flapped its wings to get a closer look, but instead it just rolled forward, too engorged with water.

Gulletail.name: Gulletail
Gulletail.description:
Winter Saga: Chapter 2
Sometimes, even dragons can get lost in a forest. If their wings are too stiff to fly above the treetops, it can cause quite the panic... it's even worse if they have no wings at all. This happened to one unfortunate gulletail dragon, as it wandered and shivered in the night, looking for any relief from the bitter cold. It smelled what could only be a hot treat and followed its nose to a clearing. It found an oblivious nibwhip dragon stirring a witch's cauldron, billowing with steam. The gulletail dragon circled the clearing, trying to distract the helpful dragon with ominous noises. The nibwhip dragon finally broke its concentration and left the cauldron unattended to search for the cause of the ruckus. The gulletail dragon licked its lips and slithered toward the chocolaty goodness...

Funis.name: Funis
Funis.description: As soon as the clouds grew larger and the sky got darker over the Vale, campers would trip over the ropes of their tents left and right, thinking they were simply having trouble seeing them with so little light.  Little did they know, the ropes of their tents had come to life, blindly and instinctively striking at their legs as they passed.  A single string of rope is nothing to be afraid of, but when they merge together into a funis dragon, they form a mighty bundle.

Aperture.name: Aperture
Aperture.description: To the naked eye, the portals of these dragons may look like plain magic or an innate ability to teleport, but being made of pure water and ice, these dragons possess a far more amazing talent. Sensing and using the water molecules in the air, they somehow disperse their mass and perfectly reshape themselves a short distance away. For this reason, aperture dragons love to shower in the rain, as this is the most literal form of refreshing. Jusk ask their best buddies, the atramento and rigel dragons.

Conch.name: Conch
Conch.description: If you were to put your ear to a conch dragon's wing, you'd be able to hear the ocean! Which is fortunate, since living on islands in the sky means there's not a whole lot of opportunity to hear the ocean. Thanks, conch dragon!

Pollen.name: Pollen
Pollen.description: Pollen dragons may be adorable, but rest assured these dragons can be quite the nuisance. They release a fine powder-like substance that is known to attract other dragons. Unfortunately, many people report being allergic to it. Guests that experience any symptoms should report directly to the Wizard Clinic. We've been assured that side effects of treatment only include being turned into the occasional frog.

Soot.name: Soot
Soot.description: The soot dragon's favorite sleeping spot is underneath cauldrons--which, while adorable, has given more than one potion-brewer quite the scare. Imagine trying to stoke the "fire" only for it to wake up and fly away!

Iron.name: Iron
Iron.description: First discovered during the great wizard Dalfgan's maiden attempt to summon an unknown beast from ancient times, the iron dragon is a close cousin of the more common metal dragon. The large metal block at the end of its tail is intimidating to some, but we've been assured that it just uses it for communication. Hopefully they don't try to communicate with any of the visitors!

Polarian.name: Polarian
Polarian.description: Looking up on a clear night in the Vale, this dragon's namesake star can be seen burning white hot and unmoving on its celestial throne. When other stars are whisked to and fro by the pull of season and the push of time, this one stays planted, a comfort to any who seek stability. Spend time with the polarian dragon, and you'll see this constance and grace reflected in its demeanor.

Jade.name: Jade
Jade.description: The jade dragon's varied shades of green camouflage them so well that discovering them on the lush, overgrown Isle of Ulmek came as quite a shock. Imagine the surprise at finding a thirteenth gemstone dragon! For some reason, the coalescence of magic that makes jade dragons available lasts longer than the other gemstone breeds. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Woolen.name: Woolen
Woolen.description: Woolen dragons are friendly, specifically when they need help with an itch. Rough objects, like trees and jagged rocks, suffice but a willing witch or wizard is even better. When snow begins to fall and you feel something nuzzling against your leg, it’s probably a woolen dragon asking for a good scratch. And they are, of course, great companions if you’ve forgotten your mittens.

Toco.name: Toco
Toco.description:
High atop a skytree, a tired toco dragon rolled over on a leaf and almost fell to the ground. It planted a wing on the edge and pushed itself back, but for some reason, there was a busted bongo drum encircling its fruit-colored feathers. it tilted its head at the mysterious musical instrument that looked more like a bracelet...
THE NIGHT BEFORE
The toco dragon was taking a calm evening flight when an intriguing and rhythmic beat echoed up from the ground. A circle of magicfolk were pounding drums with joy!
The dragon landed right in the middle and looked at each drummer with a smirk. The music overwhelmed the dragon it such a way, its only avenue to distribute the positive energy was to run in circles, waving its wings wildly. The Valers laughed and kept the beat going. One wizard soloed on some bongo drums and it caught the dragon's attention. The wizard stepped aside to give the toco dragon a chance... if it would even recognize what the Valer was offering.
The toco dragon raised its wings and beat the bongos with fervor. The circle of players encouraged it and cheered. Even a dash and psyche dragon started nodding their heads. The toco dragon got so animated, it punched right through the drum with its wing. The dragon might have apologized if it could, but it immediately flew away with the drum trailing its flapping wings.
PRESENT DAY
The toco dragon still gazing at the drum, shook its wing violently to rid itself of the embarrassment. Unfortunately, it heard some Valers below talking just as the drum flew off. The dragon tried to catch it, but it crashed to the ground and caused the witches to look up. The toco dragon scrambled to hide amongst the leaves and sheepishly peeked out.
*This dragon must be level 4 or higher to wear a Style

River.name: River
River.description: River dragons live on land but spend much of their time in the water. Their boundless energy and constant frolicking cause river dragon scales to fray at the edge, giving them the look of fur. Often found near the Ami'Lya Pond, their splashing creates something akin to a melody; they will occasionally dance to this river song.

Spore.name: Spore
Spore.description:
When the spore dragon emerged from the Rift, Gwyddion the Great Nogard couldn't believe his eyes. "We haven't seen a dragon from the Rift since Light and Dark magic returned to the Vale!" he exclaimed to Gardenia, who was first in line to study this dragon's unusual pattering of mushroomscales. What wonders! 
 When the spore dragon emerged from the Rift, Gwyddion the Great Nogard couldn't believe his eyes. "We haven't seen a dragon from the Rift since Light and Dark magic returned to the Vale!" he exclaimed to Gardenia, who was first in line to study this dragon's unusual pattering of mushroomscales. What wonders!

Canna.name: Canna
Canna.description: A characteristic of the canna dragons is that they always appear like they are in a hurry.  Due to their rather chubby physique though, they aren't that fast.  That was concluded by the great wizard Kojntas after studying them for centuries.  He also discovered that they have evolved to use their tail as a makeshift boat to get to places faster, also with the help of a random stick.  Too bad they lose it from time to time.  That's probably the reason why even after this super cool evolution they are still pretty much stuck in the same place.

Serenity.name: Serenity
Serenity.description: You'll know a serenity dragon is nearby when a lovely feeling of calm washes over you, and you find yourself stopping in your tracks to smell the flowers and admire the view. In fact, when poet Norbert Frost first observed the effects of the serenity dragon, he was so moved, he created a scroll of poems inspired by this dragon's serene nature. His poetry readings are now the most popular in DragonVale!

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.description: For every happy and contented dream, there is the other, darker side that can frighten wizards and witches everywhere. Discovered by the vivid dreamer Tober Gelndun, these dragons mean no ill as they simply bring balance to the dreamworld. Still, the faint of heart are recommended to keep a good distance.

Lightmare.name: Lightmare
Lightmare.description: In service to the balance of the dreamworld, lightmare dragons roam without rest to keep nightmares in check. Catching and absorbing their darkness, slowly transforming them into pleasant dreams that they then release into their surroundings. Ironically, these dragons do not sleep, for if they did, the dark energy absorbed over time would likely manifest in an untold number of nightmares. They do give nightmare dragons an occasional hug by accident.

Mesolite.name: Mesolite
Mesolite.description: Watching the mesolite dragon fly is even more impressive when you realize that each of the 'feathers' are solid crystal, weighing in at over a tonne combined! Most of these are on the dragon's wings, which it has to fold up carefully when walking to avoid being tipped over. So how does the dragon fly at all? Simple, it's magic! This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Sunscorch.name: Sunscorch
Sunscorch.description:
Sunscorch dragons live up to their name. They seek out warmth and bask in it until their thermometric scales transform. Shade can help revert them back and water is just as effective. If you prefer your Ami'Lya Pond to be full of water, maybe move it away from a sunscorch dragon looking to cool off; their tails can make rather large splashes. 
 Sunscorch dragons live up to their name. They seek out warmth and bask in it until their thermometric scales transform. Shade can help revert them back and water is just as effective. If you prefer your Ami'Lya Pond to be full of water, maybe move it away from a sunscorch dragon looking to cool off; their tails can make rather large splashes.

Chrome.name: Chrome
Chrome.description: The chrome dragon is a vain dragon and has often been caught looking at its own reflection off of its shiny scales. Even though this dragon is extremely docile, it's probably best to approach it with caution. The sun's bright reflection has been known to start the occasional fire.

Hedera.name: Hedera
Hedera.description: Very few magics are more powerful than nature.  This is best observed with our new findings of one very curious dragon, the wizards later discovered was part of the monolith family.  More primal than its kin, this dragon is nature's masterpiece.  Deemed the bully of winter, this dragon will be your personal bodyguard and will always love you.  According to the Burcadian lore, its primary job is to keep the Vale from all things bad, including winter.  It's said to be the bringer of spring.  Since it was doing its job quite well, the Burcadians put ivy wreath on it, but with every good deed, a new leaf will appear, until one day they just started growing out of its skin.  Don't let its size fool you thought - the hedera monolith is as sweet as they come.  And it looks like it hits the Burcadian gym often as well, amirite.

Bonescale.name: Bonescale
Bonescale.description: Little was known about the icy Caves of Ramora in the northern wastelands until an adventurous group of dragonologists set out to search for clues of ancient dragon life. While excavating the caves, a young wizard named Garant became excited when he unearthed a fully intact dragon skull! You can imagine his surprise when the skull began to move, followed by a long neck, wings, tail, oh my! It was a living dragon! Other bonescale dragons began to dig themselves out of the earth, curious to greet the newcomers and more than happy to accept a few treats. It turns out that bonescale dragons love to burrow into the earth to keep warm in the icy north. Clever dragons.

Sonic.name: Sonic
Sonic.description: The sonic dragon usually makes almost no sound as it flies, but can sometimes be found harassing travelers by breaking the sound barrier close overhead. Though it resembles a bat, and does in fact communicate similarly, the yellow glow from its body makes this dragon entirely too obvious at night.

Voltaic.name: Voltaic
Voltaic.description:
The voltaic dragon certainly made quite an entrance into the Vale when it emerged from the Rift. A thunderous cacophony accompanied its arrival, and with it some of the fiercest rains in Vale memory. But for all the voltaic's pomp and circumstance, this is one scaredy dragon––the terrifying sound of its own thunderous arrival sent it scurrying into a nearby cave. Gwyddion the Great Nogard depleted an entire plot of pumpermelons trying to coax it back out! 
 The voltaic dragon certainly made quite an entrance into the Vale when it emerged from the Rift. A thunderous cacophony accompanied its arrival, and with it some of the fiercest rains in Vale memory. But for all the voltaic's pomp and circumstance, this is one scaredy dragon––the terrifying sound of its own thunderous arrival sent it scurrying into a nearby cave. Gwyddion the Great Nogard depleted an entire plot of pumpermelons trying to coax it back out!

Flickerflame.name: Flickerflame
Flickerflame.description: The great researcher, professor Dravin spent numerous days observing the flickerflame dragons for his book The Origins of Dragons part III.  But the opposing dual nature of this dragon confused him so much, that all he could come up with is that you will be hot and you will be cold, and you will literally be on fire in the presence of the flickerflame dragon.

Antarian.name: Antarian
Antarian.description: The antarian dragon's appearance closely mimics a specific cluster of stars, a fiery orange splash across the sky. Depictions of the dragon have been found in cultures far removed from each other, from the nomads of the Sandara Desert to the scribes of the Windswept Peaks. The astronomancers are still puzzled as to what these findings could mean.

Kringle.name: Kringle
Kringle.description:
The story of one of the first encounters between dragons and wizards is believed to have involved the kringle dragon:
A long time ago, in ancient times past
Arose a fierce storm with winds that did lash.
From inside the storm there came a deep moan
That frightened all folk, from small to full grown.
The moan did continue all through the night
Even when the storm passed come early morn's light.
A brave soul did leave the warmth of his home
To see what could make that sad, lonesome groan.
It didn't take long, there up in a tree
A dragon was stuck, struggling to be free.
Fetching a tool from his wagon,
The wizard quickly released the dragon.
And  the dragon was freed, so it is said,
That dragon became the wizard's best friend.
And thus is the tale, or so I've been told,
Of how kringle dragons came in from the cold.

Pearl.name: Pearl
Pearl.description: Pearl dragons are known for being some of the most playful and friendly dragons in all the land. If you ever see them in the wild, the chances are high that they will be racing other gemstone dragons near the sea surrounding the Shimmering Isles. This year the pearl dragon was able to beat the alexandrite dragon and our wizards cast an amazing spell to allow you to breed them. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Oracle.name: Oracle
Oracle.description: The epic Oracle Dragon is so named for its blind stare, as if gazing into another realm. Ancient Surfacefolk used to revere the Oracle Dragon, bringing it food and pettings in exchange for good fortune. Whether the Oracle Dragon really *can* see into the future is beyond the current understanding, but it doesn't hurt to befriend this dragon, just in case.

Gourd.name: Gourd
Gourd.description: The wizards and witches agree: the more bumps on the dragon, the better the harvest will be! Which is splendid news with the arrival of the gourd, as the harvest will yield a fabulous hoard!

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: Arriving in a fury in the nick of time comes the shield dragon! This dragon is strong, honorable, interesting, elegant, loyal, and devoted. This dragon's scales are smooth yet cold to the touch, as if they were made of iron.

Crypt.name: Crypt
Crypt.description: The crypt dragon gets its name due to often being found near mausoleums and cemeteries. They have no connection with the undead, they just like the quiet.

Love.name: Love
Love.description: The rare love dragon hails from the western slope of the Berrywhite Mountains and only shows up for a few weeks each year when love is strong in the air. Getting one of these lovely beasts is sure to inspire your visitors to buy flowers and maybe even find a spark of love.

Infernus.name: Infernus
Infernus.description: A cheerful and playful camper, this dragon would spend most of its time swimming around in the campsite lake.  Gently spraying those passing by or forcefully tipping the boat over if they pollute the water.  Once the dark clouds came rolling in and everything started going awry, it hid in the only place it knew it would be safe - deep underwater.  As bottomless pits were forming and thorny vines were sprouting, the lake began slowly turning into lava.  With the dragon still inside, it started morphing and absorbing the properties of the lava lake, turning into the infernus dragons, still as cheerful and playful as ever, but with the new ability to have its own hot tub.

Canvas.name: Canvas
Canvas.description: With their ever-changing coat, the canvas dragons have caught the attention of the more artsy wizards.  Many are envious of the skill and finesse they show with their brush-like tails, but what exactly they use to paint on themselves is still a mystery.  Are chemicals released that create beautiful colors when mixed together, or does the tail somehow triggers pigment-carrying cells in their skin?  We don't know, but they sure love to show off their masterpieces.

Dusk.name: Dusk
Dusk.description: Mottled by the stars, the dusk dragon moves as fluidly as the eventide, like a leaf on the wind. The first known account of this celestial creature was written by the brave adventurer, Mal'Gorram, whose poignant exclamation still hold true, "Shiny!"

Antumbra.name: Antumbra
Antumbra.description: Gwyddion's Field Notes on Dragons of the Rift: "Witnessed the hatchling of an antumbra dragon. Appears to sport exoscales for protection from Rift debris. Squeezey-pincery face is of the adorable variety. Luminous hindquarters may serve as a nightlight in  scary Rift regions. Pronounced pumpermelon penchant proven--pockets pilfered."

Verglace.name: Verglace
Verglace.description: The verglace dragon can be difficult to spot out in the open. It likes to settle on icy lakes or in massive snowdrifts and sit still, immobile as ice, in ponderous contemplation. Many wander over to stare at this dragon's frozen facts, wondering if they're looking at an expertly made ice sculpture - but no, it's just the verglace dragon, remembering the fjords of home.

Century.name: Century
Century.description: Astounding! The wizards have discovered the Century dragon, the 100th dragon available to breed and display in your park. Luckily these dragons move a bit slow or they would have been the 90th dragon. These peaceful and wise dragons are visiting from Glacier Point but will eventually return home, so don't forget to breed several for your park!

Metal Rift.name: Metal Rift
Metal Rift.description:
Do you hear a killer rock'n'roll guitar riff when you look at this dragon? No? Just Gwyddion? He might be hexed--someone should help him. Anyway, the metal rift dragon is a tenacious sort. Most dragons play well with others, but the metal rift dragon seems to prefer going solo. As the songwritter witch Jill White sings, "The metal has its way." 
 Do you hear a killer rock'n'roll guitar riff when you look at this dragon? No? Just Gwyddion? He might be hexed--someone should help him. Anyway, the metal rift dragon is a tenacious sort. Most dragons play well with others, but the metal rift dragon seems to prefer going solo. As the songwritter witch Jill White sings, "The metal has its way."

Aquamarine.name: Aquamarine
Aquamarine.description: Adrift in the Sea of Kimzar with no help in sight, the water wizard Koostow despaired that his latest magical experiment hadn't gone quite as he had planned. Much to his surprise, he was lifted from the icy waters on the back of an Aquamarine dragon and rescued. To return the favor, Koostow worked hard to make sure these dragons would be comfortable living on the Gemstone Island. This dragon cannot breed at this time.

Heavy Metal.name: Heavy Metal
Heavy Metal.description: You have probably heard of the metal dragons, but have you heard of the heavy metal dragons?  No?  Weird.  They were first noticed by the great explorer Jorsten Seabound.  And we say noticed, because he made sure to keep his distance upon discovering them.  Thse dragons breathe out an enormous fire cloud every once in a while, and that's why Jorsten watched them from afar, to prevent his beard from catching fire.  He also noted in his journal that the heavy metal dragons, contrary to what folks would imagine, love to hang out in beautiful flowery fields.  Why - no one knows.  Probably because their sick riffs require a lot of open space, and because they look intimidating, but are real sweehearts.

Lageto.name: Lageto
Lageto.description: Attending the circus and enjoying the show, the Wizards Benson and Jerram thought they had enough of the salty popcorn and wanted something sweet for a change.  So they went out in search of ice cream, excitedly sharing what flavors they would get, how many scoops they would eat and how many sprinkles they would...sprinkle on them. "-Sprinkles?!" One of them exclaimed, disgusted at the mere thought of putting that stuff on his favorite dessert.  The two Wizards instantly started arguing, which way is "right".  Seeing the argument is going nowhere, they came up with an idea - they would let their companion lageto dragon decide for them.  The dragon would be blindfolded and two giant buckets of ice cream would be presented, one with sprinkles on top, and one without.  Thinking it would just pick one and devour it, proving once and for all which way was better.  Instantly upon the removal of the blindfold, their companion went ballistic in excitement, jumping into the buckets and making a mess gobbling everything up.  With the dragon covered in all sorts of flavors and toppings, looking happier than ever, the Wizards realized there is no right way, as long as you enjoy it.  Both Wizards are still on the same page about Nubbleberries on pizzas though - they hate it.

Conifer.name: Conifer
Conifer.description: Valefolk look upon the conifer dragon as a symbol of wisdom--and who wouldn't? Just look at those massive, magnificent eyebrows! Nothing says "confounded by cravings for Kraken Kabbage" like a bold, bushy brow.

Lullaby.name: Lullaby
Lullaby.description: If sleeping in was a lifestyle, lullaby dragons would be the living embodiment of that, as it is the one thing they love most, and for them there is no better way to spend their time. Wizards wonder if these dragons even have a sense of time with all that sleeping, but no one can deny the benefits. Like the warmth of the blanket, the joy of taking a quick nap, a relaxing snooze, an energizing power nap, a rejuvenating beauty sleep and a calming drowse...just five more minutes please.

Winter.name: Winter
Winter.description: In the stark lands of the North, dire winters have long been a bane to the natives. The wizard Marten Slowquill discovered that winter dragons, long thought to be shaggy variants of forest dragons, were in fact a distinct breed. What's more, they were found to grow out their voluminous coats just before the first snow fall, giving the people of the North a harbinger for when winter is coming.

Nebula.name: Nebula
Nebula.description:
From the homework scrolls of Mrs. Murphy's School for Spellwork and Sorcery, Grade Five:
"My assignment is to write a poem about the nebula dragon,
But the only word that rhymes with 'dragon' is 'wagon.'
Besides, I'm not sure dragons can read. A different assignment is just what I need.
Mrs Murphy, please don't fail me when you're inking--I should get an A because this poem shows magical thinking."

Surge.name: Surge
Surge.description: What causes the unusual glow pattern of the surge dragon? Magic, of course! Haven't you been paying attention to the way things work around here?

Nightbloom.name: Nightbloom
Nightbloom.description:
The shy nature of the nightbloom dragon lends to its name--only at night will it unfurl its magnificent pearlescent wings! Whitbee has been working on ways to coax this dragon into being more of an anytimebloom dragon; so far, nothing has shown any promise as a method of motivation, but he's working on it! 
 The shy nature of the nightbloom dragon lends to its name--only at night will it unfurl its magnificent pearlescent wings! Whitbee has been working on ways to coax this dragon into being more of an anytimebloom dragon; so far, nothing has shown any promise as a method of motivation, but he's working on it!

Hyperion.name: Hyperion
Hyperion.description: The brave Wizard Kael studied the great texts of old to find the strongest dragon he could summon.  The scriptures mentioned hyperion dragons - beings of immense power from an unknown world.  The spell seemed easy to follow, but its cost would prove to be too great, even for someone as skilled as Kael.  Halway through the incantation, he fell exhausted, leaving the summoning unfinished.  He awoke to find a hyperion dragon seemingly stuck between two planes of existence, constantly trying to come through to our world.

Blazing.name: Blazing
Blazing.description: The blazing dragon is a master of flight and is remarkably fast. Many attempts have been made to craft a magical blazing saddle, but thus far nothing could withstand the fire for long.

Snowy Bronze.name: Snowy Bronze
Snowy Bronze.description: Every few years, when conditions are just right, wizards and witches from all across the world climb Mount Oly for a festival of competitions. It was during the downhill free form flying races that Snowy Olympus Dragons were first sighted. Swift and agile, these dragons make the best wizards look like amateurs. Bronze Snowys are the most common of this breed, but are no less epic for that!
